loans.name: Las Piedras Group

texts.es:
Milena es una mujer de 43 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 6 hijos de 4, 5, 6, 7, 21 y 22 años, y su negocio es la panadería tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, independiente y muy dedicada. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ caracterizada porque sus pobladores son sobrevivientes de un turbión del rio en los años setentas.
Milena es de cabello blanco, baja estatura y físico delgado (al centro lleva una cartera marrón). Su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al transporte y con sus hijos; los mayores trabajan los menores estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propio construido de madera con techo de calamina y piso de tierra. Su sueño por mejorar su negocio la llevo a liderar la banca de personas con negocios como; venta de comida, venta de ropa de segunda mano, artesanía en cerámica, venta de refrescos, venta de fruta, venta de verduras, venta de flores y venta de empanadas. Su negocio es la panadería tradicional como; Cuñapé (Pequeño bollo hecho de harina de yuca con queso), Empanada de arroz (Horneado de arroz y queso), Bizcochos de trigo (Bollitos duros de harina de trigo), Arepas (Panqueques de harina de maíz mezclados con queso y fritos) y otros, “quién no se toma un café por la tarde degustando un horneado tradicional? Son los sabores de mi tierra que los disfrutamos a diario…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de un horno industrial y una garrafa de gas. Su sueño es tener un negocio bien consolidado, ella desea realizar la compra de un horno industrial y una garrafa de gas para hornear pan tradicional. Esta es la 4 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Milena solicita un préstamo para la compra de un horno industrial y una garrafa de gas para hornear pan tradicional.
texts.en:
Milena is a 43 year old woman. She lives with her spouse and has 6 children, aged 4, 5, 6, 7, 21 and 22. Her business is a traditional bread bakery.

She is a good mother, and a very hard worker. She runs her business in the ‘Plan 3000’ neighborhood. It is characterized by its residents, who are survivors of a river flood in the seventies.

Milena has white hair, short stature, and a thin build (she is in the middle with a brown wallet). Her mother tongue is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her spouse, who works in transportation, and their children. The older ones work and the younger ones are in school. They live in their own home built of wood with a metal sheeting roof and a dirt floor. Her dream to improve her business led to her leading a bank of people with businesses such as selling food, selling second hand clothing, ceramic crafts, selling beverages, selling fruit, selling vegetables, selling flowers and selling empanadas. Her business is a traditional bread bakery. She sells traditional bread such as cuñapé (a small roll made of yucca flour with cheese), rice empanada (baked rice and cheese), wheat biscuits (hard wheat rolls), Arepas (corn meal pancakes mixed with cheese and fried) and more. “Who doesn't drink some coffee in the afternoon with traditional baked bread? They're the flavors of my people that we enjoy every day…” she remarks. The advantage of her business is that she sells everyday. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy an industrial oven and a gas tank. Her dream is to have a well consolidated business. She want to purchase an industrial oven and a gas tank to bake traditional bread. This is her fourth loan cycle with the institution in the 4 years she has been doing this activity.

These are the reasons that Milena is asking for a loan to buy an industrial oven and a gas tank to bake traditional bread.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven and gas tank to bake traditional bread.

loans.name: Osmar Adin

texts.es:
Osmar, de 27 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tienen dos hijos que por el momento no estudian y solo los cuatro viven en casa. 

Osmar, es agricultor en pequeño y desde su infancia le ayudaba a su padre a sembrar y fue así como aprendió, además de eso también trabaja como jornalero, actualmente va a sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y los cultivará a 15 minutos de su casa y se trasporta en bicicleta. 

Osmar, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono y pesticidas, para que cuando empiece a llover pueda sembrar y estar preparado para aplicar sus productos a la milpa en los días que le corresponda. 

Osmar, desea que las condiciones climáticas cambien, porque de esa cosecha depende el sustento de la familia.
texts.en: Osmar is 27 years old. He didn't have the chance to go to school. He lives with a partner and his companion works at home. They have two children who are not going to school and the four of them live at home. Osmar is a small farmer and since he was a child he helped his father grow a crop and that is how he learned. In addition to this,  he worked as a daily laborer. He is currently ready to plant 7,000 square meters of corn at a lot located 15 minutes from his home, and he will get to it by bicycle. Osmar needs the loan to buy agricultural inputs such as manure and pesticides, so that when it starts raining he can plant and be ready to apply these products to the fields when needed. Osmar hopes that the climate conditions will change, as his family will depend of this harvest.

loans.use: buy agricultural products such as manure and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in an assortment of apples, pears and strawberries, and more.

loans.name: Ihab

texts.en:
Ihab is a 27-year-old married man from Deir Albalah city, located in Gaza strip . He manages/ operates a small restaurant, where he sells light sandwiches and soft drinks for day laborers and children after school. The community enjoys his sandwiches and It is a very good business, which provides the family with a good income.

Because he wanted to buy some supplies for his restaurant, Ihab took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he can buy a refrigerator and other supplies to improve his restaurant. Ihab wants to improve his business by making fresh fruit cocktails and so he needs to store perishable items in the refrigerator. Ihab appears in the photo while he was working

loans.use: buy a refrigerator and other supplies to improve his restaurant.

loans.name: Adelina Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Adelina tiene 46 años de edad,  vive en una comunidad de Trojes, al Oriente de Honduras, es madre soltera vive con sus cuatro hijos y su actividad principal es la ganaderia, tiene su propia hacienda ganadera y cuenta con 7 años de dedicarse a este rubro.
Doña Adelina obtiene la leche del ganado y esta la vende a sus clientes que son personas y distribuidores de las misma con el prestamo espera comprar 2 novillos para repastarlos y un fardo de semilla crisanta para poder mejorar sus pastos en sus potreros.
Uno de sus sueños es poder aumentar el número de cabezas de ganado en su hacienda.


Trojes, Honduras - Julio 2015.
texts.en: Mrs. Adelina is 46 years old. She lives in the community of Trojes, in the eastern region of Honduras. She is a single mother with four children and her main business is raising cattle. She has had her own cattle farm for the past 7 years. Dona Adelina collects her cattle milk and sells it to her clients. With this loan, she expects to buy two steers to raise them,  and a bundle of crisanta seed to improve her pastures. One of her dreams is to increase the number of livestock in her farm.

loans.use: To buy two steers and seeds for her business.

loans.name: Jessica Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jessica, de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está acompañada y su pareja es motorista de camiones, tienen 2 hijos y los dos están estudiando. 

Jessica, desde hace 4 años se ha dedicado a la venta de joyas de acero y enchape, antes vendía ropa, pero le genera más ganancias vender ese otro tipo de productos; ella hace pedidos grandes a una empresa y luego se encarga de revender el productos, a manera de que le quede ganancia. 

Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar productos como cadenas, pulseras, relojes, aritos, anillos de enchape y acero, estos los hará en dos pedidos.

Jessica, desea en un futuro poder construir una pequeña galera para guardar el carro.
texts.en:
Jessica is 24 years old. She went to school up to seventh grade. She is married and her husband is a truck driver. They have two children and both of them are in school.

For 4 years, Jessica has sold steel and veneer jewelry. She used to sell clothes, but selling this other type of product generates more profits. She makes large orders from a company and then she re-sells the products and makes a profit.

She needs the loan to buy products such as chains, bracelets, watches, earrings and veneer and steel rings. She will do this in two orders.

Jessica in the future wants to build a small galley to keep her car in.

loans.use: to buy products such as chains, bracelets, earrings, and veneer and steel rings.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es: Alfonso es un joven emprendedor de 19 años que reside en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla que heredó de su padrastro el negocio de elaboración de pecheras y correas para caninos; actividad en la que su padrastro laboró más de 20 años y que decidió otorgársela.  Alfonso comercializa sus productos en pueblos del Cesar, Guajira y en poblaciones aledañas al Departamento del Atlántico, dos veces por semana y realiza sus cobros inmediatamente.  Alfonso está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo el cual piensa invertir en materiales como cuero, cuerina y herrajes.  Esta inversión permitirá que amplié su gama de productos y responda oportunamente a las solicitudes de sus clientes.  Su meta a futuro es mejorar el surtido y que su negocio le permita adquirir una casa propia.
texts.en: Alfonso is a young entrepreneur, 19 years old, who lives in a neighborhood in the municipality of Barranquilla. He inherited the business of making dog harnesses and leashes from his stepfather, work that his stepfather did for more than 20 years and decided to give to him. Alfonso sells his products twice a week in the towns of Cesar, Guajira, and in neighboring communities to the Atlantic department and collects immediately. Alfonso is applying for his first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which he plans to invest in materials such as leather, synthetic leather, and metal pieces. This investment will allow him to expand his range of products and respond opportunely to his customers' requests. His goal for the future is to improve his assortment and that his business allows him to get his own house. yeras

loans.use: to invest in materials such as leather, synthetic leather, and metal pieces.

loans.name: Reyna Suyapa

texts.es: Reyna, tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera con dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Hace 11 años inició con su propia actividad de negocio donde vende ropa como camisas, pantalones, faldas, blusas, ropa interior y zapatos. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y entrega a domicilio. Ella ha invertido varios préstamos a su negocio para mantenerlo activo y con las ganancias a podido salir adelante con su familia. El préstamo actual es el Octavo ciclo y es por 12,500 lempiras, con el cual va comprar más ropa como camisas, pantalones, blusas, faldas, calzado y ropa interior para vender y aumentar sus ingresos. Su plan es crecer en clientes y como microempresaria generando más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Reyna is 38 years old, a single mother with two children, and lives in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Eleven years ago, she began her own business where she sells clothing such as shirts, pants, skirts, blouses, undergarments and shoes. She makes her sales as a street vendor and does home deliveries. She has invested various loans in her business to keep it active and, with the earnings, she has been able to get ahead with her family. The current loan is the eighth loan cycle and is for 12,500 lempiras, with which she will purchase more clothing such as shirts, pants, blouses, skirts, shoes and undergarments to sell and increase her income. Her plan is to grow in customers and as a micro-entrepreneur, generating more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, pants, blouses, skirts, shoes and undergarments to sell and increase her income.

loans.name: Salmabeevi And Group

texts.en:
Salmabeevi works hard to sustain her family on her limited income. She works as a daily wage labourer in agricultural fields. She is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two teenaged children. As her children grow up, Salmabeevi would require more funds to sustain her family. To add to everything, her work is seasonal in nature.

Therefore, in an attempt to find a steady source of income, she underwent training in doing semi-precious stone work on sarees. But she needs funds to purchase raw materials to start her business. She is joined by 4 other women who also need funds to start their respective businesses to add to their source of income. Together they seek a group loan of Rs. 100,000. They are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to start her business of doing semi-precious stone work on sarees

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
ELLA  ES UNA JOVEN AMA DE CASA DESDE HACE UN AÑO SUS ENCÍAS SE INFLAMAN LO QUE LE HA PROVOCADO UNA FUERTE  INFECCIÓN Y DOLORES EN MULAS Y ENCÍAS. ESTO TAMBIÉN LE HA CAUSADO DIFICULTAD PARA ALIMENTARSE DE MANERA CORRECTA
REQUIERE URGENTEMENTE VARIOS TRATAMIENTOS  DENTALES PARA PODER LIMPIAR LAS ENCÍAS Y EVITAR QUE SE DAÑEN SUS PIEZAS DENTALES. DESGRACIADAMENTE LOS RECURSOS ECONÓMICOS DE SU ESPOSO SON POCOS
texts.en:
She is a young housewife. For a year her gums have become inflamed, which has caused a severe infection and pain in her molars and gums. This has also made it difficult to eat the right way.

She urgently needs several dental treatments to be able to clean the gums and avoid damage to her teeth. Unfortunately, her husband has few financial resources.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Fakhriddin

texts.ru:
Фахриддин молодой предприниматель из городка Курган-Тюбе. Ему 31 года. Фахриддин женат, и имеет годовалого сына. 
   Фахриддин решил начать свой бизнес, чтобы покрыть расходы семьи. Он планирует открыть продуктовый магазин. Он нашел помещение, поставил полки для продуктов и купил холодильник. Фахриддину теперь нужно купить продукты питания и начать бизнес. Для купли продуктов он обратился за кредитом. Поддержите Фахриддина в его начинаниях.
texts.en: Fakhriddin is a young businessman from the town of Qurgan-Tube. He is 31, married, and has a one-year-old son. Fakhriddin decided to start his own business to cover his family’s expenses. He plans to open a grocery store. He found a room, put in shelves for the food and bought a refrigerator. Now he just needs to buy grocery products and start the business. He applied for a loan to buy grocery products. Support Fakhriddin in his business venture.

loans.use: to open a new grocery store and buy grocery products

loans.name: Juana Olimpia

texts.es: Juana de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace varios años, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal. ella esta solicitando nuevamente un credito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor para poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Juana is 50 years old. She lives in her own house with her family group. She has sold fruit and vegetables for several years. Her business is located in the municipal market. She is asking for a loan again to buy more fruits and vegetables wholesale so she can have more income.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Carmen Otilia

texts.es: Carmen de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 2 años inicio con capital propio, tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas mercaderia como refrescos, golosinas, sopas, granos basicos, etc. todo por mayor y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Carmen, 59 years old, lives in her own house with her daughter. She has had a small store located in her home for the past 2 years. she began with her own capital and has many customers, especially her neighbors. With the earnings that she gets from her sales, she manages to cover some household expenses. She is asking for a loan to purchase more merchandise such as soft drinks, candies, soups, basic grains, etc., all in bulk, and in this way be able to have better income.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise such as soft drinks, candies, soups, basic grains, etc., all in bulk.

loans.name: Sojigul

texts.ru:
Ее зовут Сочигул. Ей 55 лет. Сочигул вдова. У Сочиды большая семья. Ее семья состоит из двоих сыновей, одной дочки, 2 невестки и 4 внуков. 
  Сочида в течение 7 лет занимается продажей топливо. Она держит топливо в канистрах и пластиковых баков. Для наполнения бака машины топливом она использует воронку и ведро. Сочида мечтает иметь свою заправочную станцию. Но сейчас ей она просит кредит для приобретения топливо.  Сочида надеется, что она получит кредит и постепенно ее доход увеличится.
texts.en: This is Sojigul. She is 55, widowed, and has a large family, consisting of two sons, a daughter, two daughters-in-law, and four grandchildren. Sojigul has been selling fuel for seven years. She keeps the fuel in gas cans and plastic cans and uses a funnel and bucket to fill fuel tanks of machines. Sojigul dreams of having her own gas station. For now she is applying for a loan to purchase fuel. She hopes that she will get the loan and that her income will gradually increase.

loans.use: to purchase fuel (petrol, diesel) to sell

loans.name: Karanjung Lestari 1 Group

texts.en:
Passing the 6 months of loan period, the Karanjung Lestari 1 group showed they can run a pig business well. Their pigs grew healthy and fat. They give them a nutritious feed and vitamins. The group also had a high price when they sold the pigs together to the big buyer. Most of them are satisfied with the result.

Ni Made sold all of her pigs. Having support from her husband, she is determined to increase the business to support the income of her family.

As the groups' previous loan was successfully paid off, Ni Made continued her loan to increase the pig business. With full support from her husband, Ni Made use her loan to purchase 4 local piglets for pig barbeque. The local pigs will be sold every 2 month. The advantage of the business is for pay school fees. She hopes her children can gets higher education for better future. Now with 5 members, the group receive 17.500.000 IDR loans and Ni Made receives 3.500.000 IDR. She hopes all their plans will be running smoothly, she can earns more profit.

loans.use: to purchase 4 local piglets for pig barbeque.

loans.name: Balcon Florido Group

texts.es: Lenny tiene 33 años de edad es conviviente con dos hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida en la afueras de vivienda. Ella años atrás se dedicaba al cuidado de sus hijos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas mercadería arroz papa aceite pollo. El grupo “BALCON FLORIDO” agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Lenny es la primera del lado derecho.
texts.en: Lenny is 33 years old, and is partnered, with two dependent children. She works selling food outside her home. In past years, she worked taking care of her children. The loan will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise such as rice, potatoes, oil, and chicken. the Balcon Florido group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the granted loan. Lenny is the first on the right.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, potatoes, oil and chicken.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of animals.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier tiene 57 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive con su esposa sin carga familiar en el distrito de Zaña que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente al comercio y crianza de ganado menor.

Javier se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su vehículo (mototaxi), actividad que realiza desde hace más de 2 años, cuenta con experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Javier espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Javier is 57 years old, married, and lives with his wife without family responsibilities in the district of Zaña which is located in Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. Life in the community is peaceful and the people work primarily in commerce and raising small animals.

Javier works offering passenger transportation services in his vehicle (mototaxi), work that he has done for more than 2 years. He has experience in the sector and has very good personal and work references in the zone. The loan will be used to make repairs and do maintenance on his vehicle since it currently is in bad condition. With this, Javier hopes to offer better service to his customers, which will generate more income and in the end will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to make repairs and do maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Zuvaida

texts.ru: Зувайда, 55 лет, замужем, есть 3 детей. У Зувайды среднее образование, уже 10 лет занимается полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 0,56 Га земли, где Зувайда выращивает картофель и клевер. Ее ежемесячная прибыль - 3,000 сом (KGS). Зувайда решила приобрести удобрения для обработки почвы и выращивания экологически-чистого картофеля, так как цены сейчас ниже, поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS). Свои доходы Зувайда планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Zuvaida is 55, married, and has three children. She has a high school education and has been planting crops for ten years. She has a 0.56 hectare plot of land where she grows potatoes and clover. She earns 3,000 som (KGS) per month. Zuvaida decided to buy fertilizer to treat the land for planting her organic potatoes because the price is currently now. This is why she applied for a loan of 10,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank. She plans to invest her profits in expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and grow organic potatoes

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Irene is 29 years old and has three children who are in school.

Irene has a buy and sell personal product care business in the Philippines. Irene requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, lotion, roll on, etc..

Irene has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Irene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, lotion, roll on, etc.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 28 years old and has three children.  Marissa is married and has three children who are in school.

Marissa is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Marissa requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Marissa has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil is 29 years old. He lives with his parents and brother in Chokhatauri district. Avtandil is an artisan and generates 200 GEL monthly. The family is involved in agricultural activities. They have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow fruits and vegetables for family use.

Avtandil decided to start taxi business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan. With the received credit he will purchase a car and will start a taxi business. He will serve locals as a taxi driver and will have stable income alongside the agricultural activities. Avtandil awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start taxi business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es una señora de 62 años de edad es casada y trabaja como recepcionista. La señora sufre desprendimiento de retina en su ojo derecho, debido a que fue víctima de un atraco, la agresión fue directamente en su ojo por lo que perdió la visión. Ella necesita urgentemente  una cirugía llamada vitrectomía para poder recuperar la vista, su preocupación es llegar a perder su trabajo a causa de esta discapacidad.
texts.en:
She is 62 years old and married. She works as a receptionist. She suffers from retina detachment in her right eye because she was the victim of a mugging. The assault was directly to her eye, and she lost her vision.

She urgently needs surgery, which is called vitrectomy, in order to recover her vision. Her fear is that she will lose her job do to this disability.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Malia

texts.en: Malia is a 42 year old mother with 2 children, she runs a business of selling tuna sandwiches, toast sandwiches in her community to earn a living. Malia has requested a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, box of fish canned tuna, plastic bags, containers, butter, to assist with the business. She will expand her business using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, box of fish canned tuna, plastic bags, containers, butter,.

loans.name: Loy

texts.en:
Loy is a 31-year-old married construction worker with two young children in his care. His two children attend school. He has worked as a construction worker since 2014, earning around $8 each day. His wife is a 36-year-old factory worker, earning approximately $5 each day. All of them live in the Takeo Province of Cambodia.

Now he lacks the finances to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work and family use, therefore is requesting a loan. With the motorcycle from the loan, his family will be able to have better traveling conditions and reduce traveling expanses. For his future plans, Loy is going to save money to build a new proper house and send his two children to earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work and family use.

loans.name: Cherry Ann

texts.en:
Cherry Ann lives at Buntun. She is 34 years old, married and had a child.

Cherry Ann is selling peanut butter for income. She wants to improve the profits in her business; that is why she is asking for additional capital of PHP 9,000 to invest in her food-selling business. She will buy peanuts and plastic bottles for packaging.

She promises to pay back her loan, continue improving her sales and earn good profits for the family.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and plastic bottles to use in her peanut-butter selling business.

loans.name: Julio Andres

texts.en:
Julio is just 24 years old and lives in the municipality of Sahagun. In 2012 he decided to start his own raising cattle business, a job that he learned thanks to an uncle that taught him everything that he needs to know. He works the whole week because he enjoys taking care of his animals.

He wants to increase his profits so his business can be more successful and his family can have a better quality of life. That’s the reason why he’s asking for a loan so he can make some house improvements, buy cement, sand, stone, workforce and also some pigs.

He dreams with improving the conditions of his house because they’re not at their best, and he wants to give to his family a comfortable and safe place to live. You can help Julio to accomplish all his dreams with a loan, he would work hard for it too.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, stone, workforce and some pigs

loans.name: Mercedes Eloisa

texts.es: Mercedes desde muy joven aprendió a ganarse la vida, ahora a sus 55 años de edad, ella habita en vivienda de su propiedad desde hace 6 años, la cual ha logrado comprar con mucho esfuerzo. Mercedes se desempeña como pacificadora en una panadería de la zona, lo que le permite salir adelante y sostener su economía. La vivienda de Mercedes es muy humilde y sencilla, ya que está hecha de láminas deterioradas, como se observa en la fotografía, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para reparar su vivienda y cambiar las láminas de esta.
texts.en: Mercedes, when she was very young, learned how to earn a living. Now, at 55 years old, she lives in a house she has owned for 6 years, which she has managed to purchase with a lot of effort. Mercedes works as a baker in a bakery in the area, which allows her to get ahead and support her economic situation. Mercedes's house is very humble and simple, since it is made of deteriorated metal sheeting, as can be seen in the photo, so she is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, nails and wire to repair her house and replace the metal sheeting on it.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, nails, and wire to repair her house and replace the metal sheeting on it.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana was married and she has a very small kiosk, so she had an idea to request a loan from Tuba Rai Metin.

She wants to turn her kiosk into a bigger store in the future, but her capital is not enough so she is requesting a loan of $800 to improve her business. She will used this loan to buy more items including salt, candles, cigarettes, lighters, gambling cards, biscuits, candies, noodles, soft drinks and other things to sell.

She started her business in 2012 with her own working capital. She is taking this loan because she also wants to improve her management for her business so that she can increasing her income.

loans.use: to buy salt, candles, cigarettes, lighters, gambling cards,  biscuits, candies, noodles, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Kanha's Group

texts.en:
Kanha’s Group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia.

Kanha makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Nern's Group

texts.en:
Nern’s Group lives in a rural village in Kampong Thom province in Cambodia.

Nern makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Thol's Group

texts.en:
Thol’s Group lives in a rural village in Kampong Thom province in Cambodia.

Thol makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as repairing motors to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and woman to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El es un hombre casado y tiene 59 años de edad. Recibe una pensión mensual la que le resulta insuficiente por lo que también realiza trabajos de jardinería. Desde hace tiempo padece cataratas en su ojo izquierdo, por lo que ha perdido el 100% de su vista en ese ojo. Necesita urgentemente un implante de lente intraocular, operación quirurgica que  esta fuera de sus posibilidades económicas ya que sus ingresos son limitados.
texts.en:
His is a 59 year old, married man. He receives a monthly pension, which is not enough. Therefore, he also does gardening jobs.

For some time he has had cataracts in his left eye, and he has lost 100% of his vision in this eye. He urgently needs an intraocular lens implant. This surgery is beyond his financial possibilities because his income is limited.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Nern's Group

texts.en:
Nern’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Nern works as farmer, and he also does extra work as a construction worker to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Marco

texts.es: Marco vive en Olanchito, Honduras tiene 59 años y durante toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos, ha trabajado muy fuerte para darle a su familia formada por su esposa y siete hijos, la mejor calidad de vida posible ya que en la comunidad donde ellos viven no tienen acceso a energía eléctrica, por esta razón Marco adquirió anteriormente un sistema solar  el cual  les ha ayudado a tener una mejor iluminación. Pero lamentablemente un componente del sistema solar se ha dañado y esto ha afectado a la familia ya que nuevamente han tenido que iluminarse con velas y caminar largas distancias para tener acceso a cargar sus teléfonos celulares. Por esto Marco está solicitando  préstamo a Soluz Honduras para adquirir el componente (batería) que  su sistema solar necesita para que pueda volver a funcionar y que sus hijos que están en la escuela puedan tener buena iluminación al momento de realizar sus trabajos escolares y así mismo optimizar sus actividades de expulpación de café ya que tendrá más tiempo por las noches para poder realizarlas.
texts.en: Marco lives in Olanchito, Honduras. He is 59 years old and, for his whole life, he has worked growing basic grains. He has worked very hard to give his family, made up of his wife and seven children, the best quality of life possible since in the community where they live, they don't have access to electricity. For this reason, Marco previously got a solar power system which has helped them to have better lighting. But, unfortunately, a part of the solar power system is damaged and this has affected his family which has again had to light things with candles and walk long distances to have access to charge their cellphones. For this, Marco is asking Soluz Honduras for a loan to purchase the part (battery) that his solar power system needs so that it can function again and that his children, who are in school, can have better lighting when doing their school work, and also optimize his work depulping the coffee since he will have more time at night to be able to do it.

loans.use: to purchase a battery to reactivate his solar power system in his home and, in this way, improve his work in agriculture and at home.

loans.name: Ruzigul

texts.ru: Рузигул профессионал мастер швеи. Она занимается шитьем национальной женской одежды на заказ. Рузигул продвигает эту деятельность более 28 лет. Она целый день занимается шитьем, чтобы зарабатывать на жизнь. Ее муж тоже как Рузигул двигается. У Она мать четверых детей. Детям 25, 23, 20 и 11 лет. Дети уже взрослые и они самостоятельные. Рузигул хочет купить современную электронную швейную машинку, чтобы улучшить процесс своей работы. Ей не хватает денег купить желаемую машинку, и она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
Ruzigul is a professional seamstress, and makes Tajik women's clothing to order.  Ruzigul has been plying her trade for more than 28 years.  She makes clothing all day to earn her living.  Her husband, like Ruzigul, is also active. 

Ruzigul is the mother of four children ages 25, 23, 20 and 11.  Her children are already independent adults.  Ruzigul wants to buy a modern electronic sewing machine to improve her work process.  She lacks the money to buy the machine she wants, and has requested a loan.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Mabelle

texts.en:
Mabelle is 33 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Mabelle works very hard to provide for them.

Mabelle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like beverages, eggs, salts, personal care products, and other groceries.

Mabelle has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Mabelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like beverages, eggs, salts, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José de 25 años quien vive en Olanchito, Honduras es productor de café desde hace cinco años  esto le genera ingresos para sostener a su familia, ya que además cultiva granos básicos como el maíz y frijol. José es un hombre muy emprendedor, por esa razón desea convertirse en un buen productor de café y hacer todo lo que este a su alcance para que su hijo tenga una buena educación. Como productor de café el necesita tener una buena iluminación para expulpar el café por la noche, y así poder avanzar en la labor diaria, pero esto se le dificulta un poco, porqué en la comunidad donde vive no hay acceso a energía eléctrica, por esta razón José solicita financiamiento a Soluz Honduras para adquirir un sistema solar que le ayudara a mejorar sus labores como cultivador y productor y además en el futuro cuando su hijo asista a la escuela tendrá la iluminación suficiente para realizar sus tareas diarias.
texts.en:
José, who is 25 years old and lives in Olanchito, Honduras, has been producing coffee for five years. This generates enough income to provide for his family as he also grows basic grains such as corn and beans. José is a very hard working man and so wants to become a good coffee producer and do everything he can to give his son a good education. To process the coffee he needs good lighting to remove the pulp from the beans at night in order to continue the process during the day. However, this is difficult because there is no electricity in his community. For this reason José is requesting financing from Soluz Honduras to obtain a solar system which will help him be a better grower and producer and, in the future when his son goes to school, he will have enough light to do his homework every day.

José de 25 años quien vive en Olanchito, Honduras es productor de café desde hace cinco años esto le genera ingresos para sostener a su familia, ya que además cultiva granos básicos como el maíz y frijol. José es un hombre muy emprendedor, por esa razón desea convertirse en un buen productor de café y hacer todo lo que este a su alcance para que su hijo tenga una buena educación. Como productor de café el necesita tener una buena iluminación para expulpar el café por la noche, y así poder avanzar en la labor diaria, pero esto se le dificulta un poco, porqué en la comunidad donde vive no hay acceso a energía eléctrica, por esta razón José solicita financiamiento a Soluz Honduras para adquirir un sistema solar que le ayudara a mejorar sus labores como cultivado

loans.use: to buy a solar system that will improve living conditions in his home as well as avoid the contamination caused by traditional energy use.

loans.name: Miladis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Miladis, de 54 años de edad, es comerciante, vive junto a su hija y su pequeño nieto, su hija se dedica a la venta de tamales y pan.

Miladis, posee una pequeña tienda desde hace 3 años y fue su hija quien la motivó a que colocara una tienda en su pequeño hogar y es de ahí de donde provienen sus ingresos.

Miladis, solicita el crédito para comprar productos de la canasta básica como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar entre otros productos que son de importancia y de gran relevancia.

Su sueño es seguir manteniendo satisfechos a sus clientes, pues ella sabe muy bien que ellos soy el factor más importante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Miladis, 54 years old, is a saleswoman. She lives with her daughter and small grandson. Her daughter works selling tamales and bread.

Miladis has had a small store for the past 3 years, and it was her daughter who motivated her to locate a store in their small house and it is from there that they get their income.

Miladis asks for the loan to purchase basic pantry items such as rice, beans, sugar, and other products that are important and very relevant.

Her dream is to continue keeping her customers satisfied, since she knows very well that they are the most important factor in her business.

loans.use: to purchase basic pantry items such as rice, beans, sugar, and other products.

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en:
Kunthea is age 32 years old and a mother of three children, one of whom is in school. She is living in Siem Reap province. Being a tailor and electrician have been her main businesses to earn income for five years.

Due to having not enough working capital to support her current business, she is now leading a group of two members to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund. As a group leader, she is willing to manage her entire loan portion to buy more kinds of clothes used for tailoring to attract more customers.

She hopes this loan will help her to increase the number of sales and earn more income to save for future needs.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of clothes used for tailoring to attract more customers in order to increase the number of sales and earn more income to save for future needs.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Prasat Bakong district

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 33 years old, married, and a mother of 2 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from the training especially enterprise development.

She practices vegetables farming. She is taking a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and quality seeds so as to boost farming production. With increased income, she will be in a position to meet family expenses e.g. food and clothing.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and quality seeds hence boost farming production for increased income to meet family expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is 49 years old and married with four children. Maricar works very hard to provide for them.

Maricar runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like beverages, personal product care, and other groceries.

Maricar has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Maricar would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like beverages, personal product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Wilyn Rose

texts.en:
Wilyn Rose is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She has a fishing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like plastic-wares and fattening pigs.

Wilyn Rose dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Cristina works hard to support her family.

She has a carinderia (mini restaurant) business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Cristina is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like vegetables, spices, fish, etc., for her carinderia business.

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like vegetables, spices, fish, etc.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is ambitious, patient and a man with strong will power. He is retired from the army with a low pension. Omar is 57 years old, lives in Irbid and he is single father of three children.

After the death of his wife, he decided to stand up and start a new life, that’s why he started sells clothes and household supplies. He started his business with low quantity products because of the lack of money and now he wants to expand his work and buy better products to sell, therefore he applied for a loan to help him do what he wants and develop his work to increase his incomes to become able to help his family.

Omar hopes to save money to provide the best educate for his children and to insure a good life for them.

loans.use: to expand his clothing sales business and buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Nexhmedin

texts.en:
Nexhmedin is 51 years old and the father of three children. He is a very hardworking man who does much to improve life for his family and give his children what they need and want.

Currently, he is employed as a guard in a private company, and he also works in agriculture. He is always busy working, without any rest between his two jobs. He plants corn and wheat on his land and keeps a cow, so in his off hours as a guard he does much manual labor that is exhausting.

He has one cow right now but is requesting a loan to purchase three calves to raise and then sell at a higher price. The loan will help him to be able to add extra income to his family and expand his farm.

He is very happy about this opportunity and hopes that he will be able to continue to expand his farm and his family's future.

loans.use: to purchase three calves to raise and then sell at a higher price

loans.name: Kamae Gathirikari Self Help Group

texts.en:
Stephen is the man raising his hand in the photo. He is 52 years old, married and blessed with 5 children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in year 2014 to benefit from the trainings especially enterprise development.

He practices farming; mostly potatoes, kale and carrots. He is taking a Kiva loan to buy certified seeds and fertilizer hence boost farming production. This will enable him to earn more income hence be able to support his children's education with ease.

Stephen appreciates Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds and fertilizer to boost farming production for increased income to support children's education.

loans.name: Aishe

texts.en:
Aishe is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 Albanian Lek to build a stable for her goats." the goats live with the cow and horse in the same place, and it is intimidating for small stature animals to live with other large stature ones. this is why i really need to build a separate place for them," said Aishe in the interview.

Aishe is 59 and has three children, 22, 20 and 17 and they live in the rural south-central part of the country, in a very hilly area. For the past ten years, she’s been doing animal husbandry with the focus on goats, since the terrain is supportive of this type of animal. She also has a dairy cow and a horse that she uses it for transportation. In a little land her family owns, she plants feed for the animals such as fodder and corn. Her family’s income basically comes from the livestock; selling baby goats and also cheese and cottage cheese made from the goat milk.

loans.use: to build a stable for her goats

loans.name: Lagaali

texts.en: Lagaali is a 36 year old mother with 3 children, she runs a  convenience store in her village to earn a living. Lagaali requested for a loan to buy a freezer, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, box of sausage and plastic bags, to assist her run the business. She has been doing this for more than 4 years. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, box of sausage and plastic bags,

loans.name: Neda

texts.en:
Neda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Neda dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rita María

texts.es: Rita es una joven apasionada por la modistería que cuando niña elaboraba prendas de vestir para sus muñecas y en la medida que se fue haciendo una jovencita se interesó mucho más en este arte y logro incorporarse en una institución del estado en donde aprendió a confeccionar con todas las técnicas existentes.  No obstante continuó perfeccionando su costura al acceder a cursos de patronaje, tipos de camisas y camisetas, pantalones, escaldo y maquinas planas.  Su taller lo aperturó en el año 2012 y cuenta con amplia clientela a quienes confecciona todo tipo de prenda de vestir, camisas, pantalones, vestidos, uniformes de colegios, entre otros y realiza todas las operaciones de la confección, diseño, corte, preparación, ensamble, acabado de piezas y empaque de productos; sus clientes se han mantenido fieles con el pasar del tiempo, pues brinda un excelente servicio y elabora sus prendas sobre medida y a la vanguardia.  Con esta amplia gama de productos y demanda de pedidos, decidió que su negocio debía crecer mucho más,  por lo que está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en una maquina plana, una mesa de corte, una cortadora industria y materias primas. Esta inversión fortalecería su infraestructura técnica, su capacidad de producción y su capital de trabajo.  Su meta a futuro es ampliar sus confecciones y darles un mejor futuro a sus dos hijos al comprarles una vivienda.
texts.en: Rita is a young woman passionate about clothing design who, when she was a girl, made many outfits for her dolls and through this was making herself into a young woman who was a lot more interested in this art and managed to to get into a government school where she learned to sew with all the existing techniques. However, she continued improving her sewing by taking courses on designing patterns, all sorts of shirts and t-shirts, pants, scaling and straight stitch machines. Her shop was opened in 2012 and has a broad customer base for whom she sews all sorts of clothing, shirts, pants, dresses, school uniforms, and more, and she does all the tasks of sewing: designing, cutting, preparing, assembling, finishing the pieces, and packing the products. Her customers have stayed loyal over time, since she offers excellent service and makes their clothing to measure and in the latest style. With this wide range of products and demand of orders, she decided that her business should grow a lot more, so she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will invest in a straight stitch sewing machine, a cutting table, an industrial cutter, and raw materials. This investment will strengthen her technical infrastructure, her production capacity and her working capital. Her goal for the future is to expand her sewing and give her two children a better future by purchasing them a house.

loans.use: to purchase a straight stitch sewing machine, a cutting table, an industrial cutter and raw materials.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a first-year student at Kepler. He grew up on a farm near Rwanda's capital of Kigali. Due to his strong academic record, he was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year, and chose Kepler because it provides a focused curriculum based on developing demonstrable skills.

Vincent plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. He is the first in his family to attend college. After graduating he hopes to work in international trade and use his income to help other young people in pursing their education.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Igballe

texts.en:
Igballe is 35 years old and married with four children between the ages of 5 and 14 years old. Together, she lives with her family in the southern part of Kosovo.

She has been involved in agriculture, raising a cow and calves, while her husband is employed with a low salary with the army. Thanks to her work with her cows, she is able to cut expenses on milk and other dairy products for her family.

Her stable is very old and worn out by the weather conditions, so she is requesting a loan to renovate the stable. The loan will help her be able to provide a better environment for her animals and help them to produce more supplies. She will be able to continue to use the milk and products, and also plans on selling some in the neighborhood.

She promises to pay on time and thanks the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to renovate the stable

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en:
Makvala is 61 years old and a widowed woman from Tbilisi city. She takes care of her son alone and earns a living with the orphan's pension only; that is a very small amount for meeting even basic needs.

The family lives under poverty and requires any source of income. Makvala decided to be involved in her own business and requested a loan from local financial institutions. According to the above mentioned situation, she lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting business, as they require stable income and business experience.

The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Makvala to get a loan of 2,000 GEL and open a bakery on the first floor of her house. Makvala will purchase all the needed equipment and will start baking on her own and will get the business income.

After the bakery is opened, the family will have a stable income which will enable them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in the future.

With support of the Start Up program Makvala will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle the financial difficulties.

loans.use: to open a bakery and get her only source of income.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shenaz is 50-years old woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children.
Her husband is a turner by profession. He works over a lathe machine and manufactures and renews the spare parts of vehicles such as motorbike, motor car and auto rickshaw. He renews the interior parts of engines of vehicles, in corp-orators of bikes, renews the turbine and radiators. He has been doing this business for many years and till this time his business is much settled.

Due to continuously working over lathe machine some of important parts have depreciated which are urgently needed to be replaced. Without the replacement of the older parts, it is highly affecting the smooth running of the lathe machine.
Her husband is a poor person and does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy spare parts to fix the lathe machine and can buy cutting tools.

Therefore, Shenaz has requested a loan for her husband, so that he can buy spare parts for his lathe machine.
She hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: to buy lathe machine's spare parts and cutting tools for her husband's turner work.

loans.name: Sylvain

texts.en:
Sylvain is a first-year student at Kepler in Rwanda. After a rigorous application process based on grades, test scores, and personal interviews, he was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. He chose Kepler because he wants to learn the skills necessary to pursue a fulfilling career.

Sylvain plans to major in communications with a concentration in business, and he will graduate Kepler with a B.A. from an accredited U.S. university. After graduating, he hopes to found his own business or work in the private sector. At Kepler, he plans to focus on his communication, technology, and language skills.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a U.S. college degree.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
For Daisy and her husband Roben, the sea is a marvelous source of their family’s livelihood. It provides a lot of benefits to the people in their community in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo. Daisy owns a fishing boat and several fishing nets that her husband uses for fishing. Sometimes her neighbors rent it from her. She also earns from the sea by selling varieties of fish in the market. Their combined income provides for the usual needs and education of their four young children. 

As Daisy aspires to save more for the future, she plans to buy another pump boat which she can rent out to the neighborhood. She needs PHP 50,000 for this. She also intends to allot some amount for additional volume of fish in different varieties. She hopes to increase her income in this way. It will ensure the continuity of her business even during rainy season. 

Daisy dreams to see her children with a college diploma and a stable career in the future. She is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy another pump boat and different varieties of fish

loans.name: Brylle Angele

texts.en:
Brylle Angele is 28 years old, married and had two children. Her family lives at Buntun. She is selling processed food products such as hot dogs and tocino as a supplement to her husband's salary.

She wants to continue improving her sales to get more profits. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy more hot dogs to sell.

Additional revenue will be kept as the family's emergency funds.

loans.use: to buy more processed foods to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 49 years old and married with one child. Esther works very hard to provide for them.

Esther runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like dried fish, bread, junk foods, personal product care, and other groceries.

Esther has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Esther would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like dried fish, bread, junk foods, personal product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Zuleima Carolina

texts.es: Zuleima es una emprendedora mujer que estuvo vinculada durante varios años a las ventas de diferentes tipos de productos y gracias a esta experiencia tomó la decisión de iniciar su propio almacén misceláneo en el que ofrece productos de belleza, cosméticos, bisutería, papelería y juguetería.  Este negocio tiene siete años de funcionamiento en un barrio del municipio de Soledad y su horario de atención es de 7:30 a.m. a 8:00 p.m. todos los días, sus ventas en su gran mayoría se generan de contado sin embargo ella también ofrece facilidad de pago a sus clientes; vecinos, amigos y familiares.  Sus compras las realiza de contado a proveedores de la ciudad y como su capital es insuficiente para responder a la demanda actual, está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de  una vitrina para exhibir productos y mercancías en general como  prendas de vestir, accesorios y perfumería.  Zuleima tiene 26 años de edad y es madre de tres hijos menores de edad a quienes desea continuarles brindando bienestar, su meta a largo plazo es ampliar su negocio y tener su propio local comercial que le garantice un buen ingreso.
texts.en: Zuleima is an enterprising woman who was involved for some years in the sale of different types of products and, thanks to this experience, decided to open her own variety store in which she offers beauty products, cosmetics, costume jewelry, paper goods and toys. This business has been running for seven years in a neighborhood in the municipality of Soledad and her opening hours are 7:30 am to 8:00 pm every day. Her sales, in the great majority, are made in cash, however she also offers payment terms to her customers, neighbors, friends and relatives. She makes her purchases in cash from the providers in the city and as her capital is insufficient to respond to the current demand, she is applying for her first Kiva loan through the intermediary of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will invest in the purchase of a display case to show products and in general merchandise such as clothing, accessories and perfume. Zuleima is 26 years old and is the mother of three children who are minors and to whom she wants to continue offering well-being. Her long-term goal is to expand her business and have her own retail space which will guarantee her a good income.

loans.use: to purchase a display case to show products and to purchase general merchandise such as clothing, accessories and perfume.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es: Carlos emprendió su propio negocio al encontrarse en una situación difícil tras su desvinculación laboral, él encontró la manera de crecer comercialmente a través de su alquiler de lavadoras y comercialización de carne de cerdo; con la liquidación que recibió en la empresa donde laboraba compro los electrodomésticos que entrega en alquiler a sus clientes, en su gran mayoría son vecinos y residentes del sector en el municipio de Soledad, así mismo esta actividad la complementa con su venta de carne de cerdo, la cual es ofertada entre la misma comunidad que atiende. Todos los días a partir de las 7 a.m. hasta las 7 p.m. sus clientes pueden comprar carne de cerdo o acceder a sus servicios, en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual surtirá con carne de cerdo e introducirá a su oferta de productos lácteos  y mercancías varias.  Carlos es padre de dos hijas y reside con su cónyuge en el municipio de Soledad, su meta es continuar ampliando su negocio y seguir apoyando a sus hijas en sus estudios.
texts.en: Carlos undertook his own business upon finding himself in a difficult situation through his layoff from work. He found the means to grow commercially through renting washing machines and selling pork. With the settlement he got from the business where he worked, he purchased the appliances that he brings to rent to his customers. The great majority are neighbors and residents of the sector in the municipality of Soledad. He also complements this work with the sale of pork, which he sells in the same community that he serves. Every day, from 7 am to 7 pm, his customers can purchase pork or access his services. Currently, he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing that he is getting from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will stock up on pork and will introduce dairy products and a variety of merchandise to his offerings. Carlos is the father of two daughters and lives with his spouse in the municipality of Soledad. His goal is to continue expanding his business and continue supporting his daughters in their education.

loans.use: to stock up on pork and introduce dairy products and a variety of merchandise to his offerings.

loans.name: Dodo

texts.en: Dodo is 43 years old. She lives in Telavi with her husband and 2 children. Dodo is a sales lady at local shop and generates small monthly income. She wants to open a fitness center in Telavi and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan. With the received credit she will open a fitness center and will generate stable income. Dodo hopes that the business will be profitable and she awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a fitness center and generate income

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es:
María, de 47 años de edad, no pudo estudiar porque sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos, está acompañada y su pareja es jornalero, tienen 3 hijos, de los cuales sola una hija vive en casa y le ayuda con los oficios del hogar a su pareja.  

María, tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace 7 años, fue su pareja quien la motivo a colocarla, porque él toda su vida ha sido comerciante; pero además de eso tiene un año de vender tortillas,  su hija le ayuda y su horario de trabajo en la tienda es desde las 7:00 hasta las 6:00 p.m. y la venta de tortillas desde las 9: a.m. a 1:00 
p.m. 

María, necesita el crédito para comprar maíz para hacer las tortillas, porque debido a la sequía se está escaseando y se está poniendo car; también quiere surtir su pequeña tienda y comprar gaseosa, azúcar, jabón, legía y golosinas. 

Sus sueños son seguir trabajando para salir adelante y tener más clientes.
texts.en:
Maria is 47 years old and never went to school because her parents didn't have the financial resources necessary. She has a life partner who is a day laborer and three children, of whom only one daughter lives in her house and helps her with the couple's household chores.

Maria has been running a small store for the last 7 years. It was her partner who encouraged her to set up the shop, because he has been a salesman all his life; but, she has also been selling tortillas for the last year. Her daughter helps out, and her work schedule is from 7:00 am to 6:00 pm in the store, while the tortillas are sold from 9:00 am to 1:00 pm.

Maria needs this loan to buy corn to make tortillas, because the drought is making corn hard to find, and prices are going up; also, she wants to stock her small store with soft drinks, sugar, soap, bleach, and candy.

Her dreams are to continue working to support her family and to have more customers .

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Tuzamurane Sub Group A

texts.en:
Alexianne is a group leader; aged 34 years. She is married with 4 children aged between 1 and 11 years. 2 of them go to school. The group is called TUZAMURANE means “SUPPORT EACH OTHER” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future.

She owns a bar and has been running in a business for 6 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beer for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more beer for selling at her bar

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en:
A 42-year-old mother of three children, and two of whom are dependent children, Horn is living in Prey Veng province. Growing rice and raising pig are the main sources of her family’s income for twenty-three years. Due to these businesses, she is could earn about 13USD per day to complement her family’s needs. Drought and the depreciation in the pig price in the market are the main challenge for her in earning income to support her family’s living recently.

Horn has been with VisionFund for one cycle already and completely repaid her past loan, which has helped her to improve her standard of living. Now she is leading a group of six members to apply for a Kiva loan again and she will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer to increase her crop yield and take the rest of money to buy pig feed for feeding her piglets. She hopes to earn more income to be better support her family’s living and save for future need.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase her crop yield to raise up her income so that she can save for future need.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Ahlam is a 49-year-old, married women living in Jenin, Palestine. She has six children ranging in age from 17 to 33 years old, with one girl currently attending school.

Ahlam has been running her agricultural land for three years, and sells its products to the local families. She says that lately the main challenges she faces are the weather conditions and the current competitors in the same market.

Ahlam has a successful story with ACAD, previously completing two loans. She has now requested this loan to buy grape seeds and cultivate grapes in land next to her house. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business capital and invest in her business by expanding it, and that will contribute to improving her family's standards of living.

Ahlam plans to improve and expand her business by adding new crops to its land in the future.

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy grape seeds and cultivate grapes in a land next to her house.

loans.name: Felicidade

texts.en: Felicidade build her home in 2014, with her own working capital, and now her house has been completed, the money she took, she wants to use to paint the back of her house.  Because her money is not enough to buy more materials. So now she is requesting a loan of $ 1,000.00 from the Tuba Rai Metin to buy more paint, hand brushes, brush rollers and other materials to use. She is very hopeful with this money she could finish her house in a short time.

loans.use: to buy paint, hand brush, brush roller and other materials to use.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
A loan of IDR 10,000,000 helps Patricia to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to the community.

Patricia works as an instructor at a childhood education center in the village of Soe in West Timor, Indonesia. She also assists and educates pregnant mothers on a healthy pregnancy and lifestyle.

Patricia likes to promote Kopernik’s clean cookstove. Soe is located in a mountainous area and many people use open fires for cooking indoors. The cookstove is fuel efficient, expels less smoke than traditional three-stone fires and also works as a heater in the cooler areas.

Knowing that clean technologies bring more good than harm, Patricia loves the opportunity to be a green technology reseller in her community.

She will use the loan to buy stock and grow her business.

loans.use: to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to her community.

loans.name: Vangkor Group

texts.en: Mantid ’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Mantid  and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Mantid  and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Mantid ’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Consuelo Del Milagro

texts.es:
Consuelo tiene 33 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Consuelo se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Consuelo espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 33 years old, married, and lives with her husband and their two children in a rural zone of Oyotún district, which is located in Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. The people in this district work primarily in agriculture, raising animals, and business.

Consuelo works raising and selling small animals such as chickens, hens, ducks, turkeys, and more. Her business is located at her home. She has 10 years of experience in the business and has very good personal and work references in the zone. The loan that she is requesting will be used to purchase a greater quantity of animals such as chickens, ducks, turkeys, and more, and also to purchase balanced feed for them. With this, Consuelo hopes to offer a better product to her customers which will permit her to generate better income and in the end will increase her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of animals.

loans.name: Make Your Sleep Sweeter - N5Lthànhđhải Group

texts.en:
Mrs Châm is 44 years old and she is married. She has had a manufacturing business sewing bedding for 8 years. Châm lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Châm faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials for sewing more bedding to sell.

Before borrowing money from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution, she just sewed according to her boss' demand and received salary at the end of each month. In 2013, Châm joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. She used her loans to purchase machines and materials to sew at home, so that the income also increases.

Châm is the group leader of "Make your sleep sweeter - N5LThànhĐHải", which consists of 6 members.
With her business profit, Châm hopes to maintain a successful business, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase materials for sewing more bedding to sell.

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en:
Nisrine is a 22-year-old married mother of one child. Two years ago, she opened a beauty salon to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is a professional hairdresser and make up artist where she learned this domain in a institute.

Nisrine is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is trying hard to develop her salon, but she is facing an issue in her salon which is disrupting her business where the state electricity goes down during the day. Thus, today she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a generator for her salon to keep the electricity all the time which will facilitate her business and keep her customers' satisfied.

Nisrine hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a generator for her salon to keep the electricity constant which will keep her customers' satisfied.

loans.name: Charilyn

texts.en:
Charilyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Charilyn is 28 years old, and three of her children are in school.

Charilyn has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Charilyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed for her business.

Charilyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Charilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena has built her house already, and now she has plans to complete her house, but the money is not enough to buy more materials for her house to be completed.

She has a plan to plaster and to paint her house, so she is requesting a loan of $1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin to complete her house. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more materials such as sand, cement, ceramics, cement tile, paint, a hand brush, a brush roller and other materials to use.

She is very happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her, because with this loan, she hopes she can complete her house.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, ceramics, cement tile, paint, a hand brush, a brush roller and other materials to use.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 59 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Letecia works very hard to provide for them.

Letecia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like liquor, junk foods, personal product care and other groceries.

Letecia has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future, Letecia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like liquor, junk foods, personal product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Amy works hard to support her family.

She has a personal product retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Amy is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of personal products to sell.
