Amy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of personal products to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a first-year student at Kepler. She grew up with her three brothers in a rural area of Rwanda. After a rigorous application process based on grades, test scores, and personal interviews, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. Alice chose Kepler because it offers an international degree without her having to leave her home country.

Alice plans to major in business and communications, and will graduate Kepler with a B.A. from an accredited U.S. university. After graduating, she wants to work in communications or media, with an eye toward earning enough to support her mother and allow her to retire.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a U.S. college degree.

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en: Oun ’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Oun  makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Yanira Lisseth

texts.es: Yanira de 31 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos y los buenos preciso, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos como cosméticos, esmaltes, ganchos para el cabello, shampoo, tientes para el cabello, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Yanira, 31 years old, is a single mother who lives in her own house with her daughter. She works selling personal products. Her business is located in her home. She has many customers due to the variety of the products and the good prices. She is asking for a loan to purchase more products such as cosmetics, nail polish, hair clips, shampoo, hair dyes, etc., and so to be able to have more income.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, nail polish, hair clips, shampoo, hair dye, etc.

loans.name: Juan Vicente

texts.es: Juan de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, el se dedica al cultivo de granos basicos desde hace 20 años, vende sus prodcutos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de abono, veneno y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografia para tener una buena cosecha.
texts.en: Juan, 55 years old, lives in his own house with his daughter. He has worked growing basic grains for the past 20 years. He sells his products in the areas near to where he lives. With what he gets from his earnings, he manages to cover some of the household expenses. He is asking for a loan to purchase manure, pesticide, and to improve the land which is shown in the photo to have a good harvest.

loans.use: to purchase manure, pesticide and to improve the land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay hospital bills and buy medicine for a family member with very high medical expenses.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 60 years old and married.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Maria is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Maria has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is 62 years old and widowed with four children.

Paz works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store  in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages, junk foods, biscuit, home product care, and other groceries.

Paz has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store  for 25 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Paz aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages, junk foods, biscuit, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme célibataire et très dynamique âgée de 28 ans. Afi est sans enfant et vit à Baguida. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, Afi vend des caleçons pour gagner un revenu lui permettant d’assurer les charges. Afi vend sa marchandise en circulant dans les quartiers environnant et s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Afi a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter des douzaines de caleçons pour enfants, femmes et hommes afin de réaliser plus de revenus. Afi souhaite agrandir son activité pour bien réaliser ses prestations afin d’aider sa famille.
texts.en:
Afi is an unmarried woman, who is very energetic, 28 years old, without children, and living in Baguida. To meet the needs of her family, Afi sells clothing (boxer shorts) to earn an income enabling her to ensure her expenses are covered. She sells her merchandise by going from neighborhood to neighborhood nearby. She stocks up three times a month at the market.

Afi has need of this loan to purchase dozens of boxer shorts for children, women, and men in order to realize more revenues. She would like to expand her business and really provide a range of offerings, so as to help out her family.

loans.use: to purchase 5 dozen boxer shorts for children, 6 dozen for women, and 7 dozen for men.

loans.name: Exekennedy

texts.es:
El señor Exekennedy tiene 30 años de edad, vive con su esposa y tiene tres  hijos su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotería  y verdura y tiene 9  años de dedicarse  a este tipo de actividad, su negocio está ubicado en un lugar muy estratégico y de alto comercio.
Don Exekennedy esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de azúcar, huevos, frijoles, arroz, café, huevos etc. y así tener los suficientes productos y así tener un muy buen surtido para satisfacer la demanda de su clientela,  espera así mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros.
Uno de sus sueños es mejorar las condiciones de vida y tener una negocio mas grande que le permita tener más ingresos.

Trojes,  Honduras  - Julio del  2015
texts.en:
Exekennedy is 30 years old, lives with his wife, and has three children. His primary work is the sale of groceries and vegetables and he has been doing this type of work for 9 years. His business is located in a very strategic location with high business volume.

Exekennedy is asking for the loan to purchase sugar, eggs, beans, rice, coffee, etc. and, so, to have sufficient products and, so, to have a very good assortment to satisfy the customers' demands. He hopes to be able to improve his income and to cover his family expenses and financial commitments.

One of his dreams is to improve his living conditions and to have a larger business which will permit him to have more income.

Trojes, Honduras - July 2015

loans.use: to purchase sugar, eggs, beans, rice, coffee, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena, 38, from Barotac Viejo, Iloilo owns a tricycle for income. She has a regular driver who rents her tricycle on a daily basis. Basically she earns enough to support her family’s basic needs such as food and meager school allowances for her children. But when it comes to their tuition fees, Lorena has serious anxiety on where to get it. Her husband, Ruben, is a vendor who has irregular income.

Lorena is contemplating on how to expand her livelihood. She aims to buy another unit that she can rent out to another friend to augment her income; but that is a far target yet. For now, she desires to buy spare parts and tools necessary for troubleshooting. She wants to prepare for sudden mechanical problem, so as to avoid damage in her tricycle that could make it idle for days. She implores your kindness for a loan worth PHP 18,000 for the above purpose. She is determined to enhance her business and operate more units of tricycle someday. This will somehow ensure the future and education of her children.

Lorena meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God. * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools for troubleshooting

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Judith works hard to support her family.

She has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Judith is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy materials needed like bamboo stick, nipa leaves, etc. for her nipa roofing business.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like bamboo stick, nipa leaves, etc.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a married lady aged 36 years old and blessed with two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from the trainings especially enterprise development. 

She practices crop and poultry farming. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy poultry feeds and fertilizers to boost production. This will increase production to enable her provide better food and clothing for her family. 

Ann is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.  She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more poultry feeds and fertilizers hence boost production for increased income to provide better food and clothing for her family.

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Mère de deux enfants  et âgée de 49 ans, Akouavi est femme mariée qui habite à Baguida. Akouavi prépare et  vend de l’igname frit, des poissons frit et de la pâte bandée appelé « Akpan » à la devanture de son domicile. Akouavi s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et sollicite ce crédit pour commander le maïs, des ignames et des poissons afin d’avoir plus de revenus pour faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et aider son mari à subvenir aux charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: The mother of two children, Akouavi is 49 years old and a married woman living in Baguida. She makes and sells fried yams, fried fish, and a cornmeal dish called “akpan” in front of her home. She gets her supplies once a month at the market and is requesting this loan to order some corn, yams, and fish in order to have more income for coping with her children’s needs and helping out her husband to cover day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of rice, 2 loads of yams, and 10 kg of fish

loans.name: Kenia Suyapa

texts.es: Kenia, es una joven soltera, reside en una comunidad del municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara junto a sus padres y hermanas.  Solicitó un préstamo por la cantidad de lps.18, 000.00  siendo que desde hace 2 años tiene el negocio de venta de útiles escolares y trabajos secretariales por computadora. Su negocio está ubicado en la casa de habitación, y ofrece todo tipo de útiles escolares, hace un tiempo se dedicaba a estudiar. El préstamo que solicitó lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercadería como cuadernos, lápices, colores, marcadores, papel, folders, grapas, tintas etc. para vender y ofrecer el servicio secretarial y compra de una computadora. Considera que el préstamo le bastará para cubrir las exigencias de los clientes. Su objetivo es seguir creciendo en el negocio y colocar un ciber café.
texts.en: Kenia is a single young woman who lives in a community in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara with her parents and sisters. She asked for a loan for the quality of 18,000 lempiras, being that for 2 years she has had the business selling school supplies and secretarial work on computers. Her business is located in her house, and she offers all sorts of school supplies. A while ago, she was a student. The loan that she asked for she plans to invest in the purchase of merchandise such as notebooks, pencils, crayons, markers, paper, folders, staplers, ink, etc. to sell and to offer secretarial services and purchase a computer. She thinks that the loan will be enough to meet her customers' needs. Her objective is to continue growing in the business and establish a cybercafe.

loans.use: to purchase notebooks, pencils, crayons, markers, paper, folders, staples, ink, etc. to sell and to offer secretarial services and purchase a computer.

loans.name: Anjelika

texts.en: Anjelika is a 54 year old married lady with 8 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. She deals in the selling of produce like ground nuts and beans plus charcoal. With the experience in business for ten years, Anjelika has struggled to maintain the business and family with the little profits she gets. She has future prospects of expanding her business to new areas in order to raise more money. She has asked for a loan to buy ground nuts and beans for selling

loans.use: to buy ground nuts and beans for selling

loans.name: Abdukakhor

texts.ru: Абдукахор 51 летний мужчина в самом рассвете сил. Он отец шестерых детей и верный муж. Он вместе с женой живет на районе Шахритус. Его дети живут и работают заграницей. Абдукахор занимается животноводством. В этой сфере деятельности он работает уже 10 лет. Абдукахор хочет расширить деятельность, путем увеличения поголовья скотин. Но из-за нехватки капитала, он не может совершить задуманное. Абдукахор обратился за кредитом, с полной уверенностью, что его поддержат и его бизнес может расширится и он будет гордиться своими скотинами.
texts.en:
Abdukakhor is a 51-year-old man in his prime. He is the father of six children and a faithful husband. He and his wife life in the Shahrituz region. His children live and work abroad. He has been working in animal husbandry for 10 years.

Abdukakhor wants to expand his business by increasing his head count of cattle. But due to insufficient capital he is unable to achieve this. He is looking for a loan and trusts that he will get support and his business will be able to grow, and he will be proud of his cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in his genge.

loans.name: Mario David

texts.es: Mario de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol desde hace 25 años tambien trabaja en estructuras metalicas, inicio con capital propio, vende sus productos en los diferetes mercados entre los meses de diciembre a febrero, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de abono y veneno para poder tener una buena cosecha y asi ejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Mario is 44 years old and lives at home with his wife and four children. He has earned a living growing corn and beans for the last 25 years but he also does metal work.

He started up by using his own money and sells his products in different markets from December to February. He is applying for a loan to purchase fertilizer and poison in order to have a good harvest and improve his income.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and poison.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a motocarro (three-wheeled motorized cart.)

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Consolacion is 60 years old and has three children who are in school.

Consolacion has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. Consolacion requested a PHP 27,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more clothing to sell.

Consolacion has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Consolacion would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Bertha Iliana

texts.es: Bertha es una mujer trabajadora de 31 años de edad, vive junto a sus 2 hijos y su pareja en la localidad rural de Cocachacra, que está ubicado en Arequipa. Ella se dedica a la cría de animales de granja que sean orgánicos, poniendo mucha atención en el cuidado y la alimentación que les brinda a sus animales orgánicos, Bertha gusta de criar sobretodo ganado porcino orgánico. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar cerdos orgánicos y para la alimentación orgánica de su ganado. En el futuro Bertha espera poder mejorar su casa para que sus hijos puedan vivir cómodamente, además se esforzará mucho para que sus hijos reciban una buena educación y sean personas de muchos valores.
texts.en:
Bertha is a hard-working woman, 31 years old, who lives with her two children and her parents in the rural locality of Cocachacra, located in Arequipa. She is dedicated to raising farm animals organically, giving much attention to their care and strictly organic feeding. Bertha especially loves raising pigs organically.

She is requesting a micro-loan to be able to purchase organic pigs and organic livestock feed.

In the future, Bertha hopes to be able to improve her house so that her children can live comfortably, and she will make every effort to help her children receive a good education and to become persons with good values.

loans.use: buy organic pigs and organic feed for her new livestock.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly hopes that her variety store will improve, thus she exerts her best effort to make it stable. She lives in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo together with her husband Romeo and their four children. They are living in a community where people are quite familiar with each other. Therefore Julieta finds it difficult to refuse her neighbors who pay late for the goods they get from her store. This practice shakes the stability of her business. It’s one of the reasons why she also ventured into direct selling business to augment her family’s expenses. She buys cellphone accessories such as battery, casing, pouch, and also fashion wrist watches and sunglasses. While she looks after her store, her husband sells these items downtown. Sometimes he offers it house to house.

Now Merly is requesting for a PHP 50,000 additional capital mainly to buy additional merchandise for her store and more items for direct selling business. With this, she can continuously sustain their everyday needs and children’s expenses. In few years time, she will be relieved of huge educational expenses and her dream to enjoy a little comfort in life will come true.

Merly is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision to alleviate poverty and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Tuzamurane Sub Group B

texts.en:
Gaudance is a group leader; aged 42 years.She is married with 4 children aged between 3 and 16 years, 3 of them go to school. The group is called TUZAMURANE means “SUPPORT EACH OTHER” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future.

Gaudance has a shop and has been running in a business for 7 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to pay for medical insurance.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale.

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en: Ronnie is a resident of Amolatar in the Amolatar district. He is 28 years old and married with one child. He has a bar business, which especially sells all kinds of soft drinks. There is high demand for these drinks since Ronnie has few competitors. Ronnie takes care of his brothers and pays their school fees. He also supports his mother and father, because they are dependent on him. He has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from Ugafode Microfinance to boost his business. He is grateful to Ugafode and Kiva lenders for their financial boost and support.

loans.use: to buy beverages to sell.

loans.name: Yawavi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère d’un enfant, Yawavi est une femme âgée de 31 ans résidant à Baguida. Yawavi est une marchande de produits d’alimentations générales, du bois qui achète ses marchandises trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile dans sa boutique. Yawavi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de maïs et des cartons de macaronis en vue de stocker une plus grande quantité de marchandises et donc maximiser son profit afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de ses enfants et aux charges quotidiennes éprouvées.
texts.en: The married mother of one child, Yawavi is 31 years old and residing in Baguida. She sells grocery items and firewood, and she buys her merchandise three times a month at the market to resell at her shop at home. Yawavi is requesting this loan to order sacks of corn and boxes of macaroni with the aim of stocking up with larger amounts of merchandise, thus maximizing her profit in order to help out her husband in  providing education to her children and to cover proven day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of corn and 2 boxes of macaroni

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar portable kit for her clothes business, and she also wants to uplift her living standard.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 41 years old, married and blessed with 4 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from the training especially enterprise development.

Her main economic activity is vegetable farming. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides to improve farming. She hopes that this will double her production hence meet customers demands and also earn more income. She intends to use the profits to buy a water storage tank.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to improve farming and use profits to buy a water storage tank.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 26 years old, married and blessed with one child. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the 2015 to benefit from training especially enterprise development and financial management.

Her economic activity is vegetable farming. She also operates a beauty shop and she is borrowing Kiva loan to buy hair braids and weaves to add stock to the beauty shop. This will enable her meet customers demands.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy hair braids and weaves hence add stock to her beauty shop to meet customers demands.

loans.name: Eric Alexander

texts.es: erick de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijas, el se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, zapatos y cosmeticos desde hace 5 años e inicio con capital propio su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada por esa razon posee muchos clientes, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ropa y zapatos de segunda mano por mayor y asi continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en: Eric is 37 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and his three children. He has worked selling second-hand clothing, shoes and cosmetics for five years. He started his business with his own capital and it is located close to his place of residence in a busy area. For this reason he has lots of customers. He is requesting a loan to buy more second-hand clothing and shoes wholesale to be able to continue with his work.

loans.use: to buy more second hand clothing and shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Habil

texts.en:
Habil is 43 years old, married and his wife is helping him with his work. He has successfully built his business of selling animals in the local bazaar. He has started his business 15 years ago and has become famous in the town.

He is IDP and very hard-working person. At this point, he has built up a good number of customers and is making a good income to contribute to the family income.

Previously, with the help of Kiva, he was able to expand his business. Now he has applied for a loan of 1200 AZN and is planning to buy two calves. He hopes Kiva lenders will show their support for him

loans.use: to buy two calves

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 43 years old woman married with six children. She lives in a rural community near Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She owns a car and provide transport service within the Honiara town to earn her living. She has been doing this for one year.

Betty needs a loan to buy spare parts to maintain her car in good condition to provide good service for her clients. She plan to use her profit to buy a new car for her transport business and also provide better education for her children.

She has been a SPBD member since 2013 to gain access to financial services

loans.use: a loan of $6500 helps Betty buy parts for her car such as wind screen, corner lamps, head lamps, high tension lead lights and tires.

loans.name: Abadahigwa Group

texts.en:
Jeannette is a group leader; aged 35 years.She is married with 3 children aged between 6 and 16 years. They all go to school. The group is called ABADAHIGWA means “POWERFULL PEOPLE” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future.

Jeannette has a shop and has been running in a business for 7 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school of her children and to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale.

loans.name: Améyovi

texts.fr: Améyovi est une femme mariée âgée de 28 ans qui vit à Baguida. Ayant six  enfants à charge, Améyovi  se bat  pour gagner son revenu  en revendant   des produits d’alimentations générales. Pour s’approvisionner, Améyovi se rend cinq fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des paniers de tomates fraîches, des sacs de gingembres et des plateaux d’oeufs, Améyovi nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement.  Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Améyovi  va pouvoir aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de la famille et favoriser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: Améyovi is a married woman, 28 years old, living in Baguida. With six children in her care, she struggles to earn an income by selling grocery items. To stock up, she goes to market five times a month. To order baskets of fresh tomatoes, bags of ginger, and trays of eggs, Améyovi needs these funds to finance her supplies. With the resulting profit, she will be able to help out her husband in covering day-to-day family expenses and to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase 2 baskets of fresh tomatoes, 2 bags of ginger, and 7 trays of eggs

loans.name: Ear's Group

texts.en: Ear’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Ear makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Zindziswa

texts.en:
Zindziswa, 54, is a mother of 2. She sells chicken in her neighborhood. The business has not been performing very well owing to a lack of constant supply of high quality chicken. "We go very far to buy the chicken. They are high price and sometimes they are too small to sell" says Zindziwa about the challenges she and other vendors are facing.

Subsequently she would like to supply chicken as well as eggs to other vendors. She has borrowed space from her landlord and intends to breed chickens.
She is requesting for a Kiva loan to buy chicks as well as chicken feed. This chicks will be carefully fed and bred to ensure they remain good quality for meat. She will also get egg-laying chicken to breed for eggs.

"In 5 years, i would like to see my farm being called a company" said Zindziswa on being asked about her ambitions.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Souad

texts.en:
Souad is a 38-year-old married mother of two children. She started, two years ago, selling clothes from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their beloved children. Almost eight months ago, she opened her own clothing shop. 
Souad is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is trying desperately to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new collection of clothes to satisfy her customers' needs in the upcoming autumn season. 
Souad hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new collection of clothes to satisfy her customers' needs in the upcoming autumn season

loans.name: Dani Antonio

texts.es: Dani de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica al cultivo de granos basicos desde hace 15 años vende sus prodcutos durante todo el año en los alrededores de la zona donde reside y con las ganancias que obtiene es como logra salir adelante, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de fertlilizantes y abono para el cultivo ya si poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Dani is 35 years old and lives in his own house with his family group. He has worked selling basic grains for 15 years. He sells his product throughout the whole year in the areas surrounding where he lives. He manages to get ahead with the profits he obtains. He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and manure for his crops so he can obtain more economic revenue.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 51 years old and widow with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Loreta is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Loreta has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Florentine

texts.fr:
Florentine est une femme mariée, âgée de 37 ans. Elle a 3 enfants et vit à la campagne. Elle vend des produits locaux et à la fois elle tient une gargote près du marché. 
Cela fait maintenant 6 ans qu’elle exerce ces activités là. Avec ce prêt, elle compte augmenter son stock de produits locaux en achetant plus de riz et des haricots. Elle va aussi acheter des ingrédients pour la gargote : des légumes, de l’huile et de la viande. Grace aux prêts d’avant, Florentine constate une amélioration de sa vie de famille, elle a aussi acheté une rizière.
Les bénéfices de ce prêt vont être épargnés pour assurer l’avenir de la famille.
texts.en:
Florentine is a married woman aged 37. She has three children and she lives in the countryside. She sells local produce and at the same time, she runs a cafe near the marketplace.

She has been in these businesses for six years now. With this loan she intends to grow her stock of local produce by buying more rice and dried beans. She is also going to buy ingredients for her cafe: vegetables, oil and meat.Thanks to prior loans, Florentine has noticed an improvement in the life of her family and she has been able to buy a rice field.

The profits from this loan are going to be saved to ensure the family's future.

loans.use: to buy local produce such as rice and dried beans to resell near the marketplace.

loans.name: Gerly

texts.en:
Gerly is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gerly is 36 years old and has two children who are in school.

Gerly has a barber shop business in the Philippines. Gerly requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy equipment like combs, etc..

Gerly has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Gerly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy equipment like combs,  etc.

loans.name: Patricia Maribel

texts.es:
Patricia, es residente del municipio de Santa Rita, Yoro, tiene 39 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas. Trabajó por varios años en una maquila y al no tener trabajo decidió hace un año poner su propio negocio para vender variedad de comidas y obtener ingresos para ayudar al hogar. En su negocio ofrece pollo frito con tajadas, chuleta frita, pastelitos de maíz con carne, y otros. Decidió solicitar un préstamo de  21,000 Lempiras   con el fin de seguir con su negocio de comida, con el cual comprará maíz, carnes, bananos  para tajadas, repollo, salsas, especies, tomate, chile, cebolla, etc. para elaborar comidas.
El negocio está ubicado en su casa y cuenta con su clientela. El préstamo le ayudara a aumentar las ventas ya que actualmente tiene un contrato con varias personas que trabajan en un proyecto vial. Su meta es ayudar a sus hijas a que terminen sus estudios y darse a conocer más con las personas.
texts.en:
Patricia lives in the community of Santa Rita, Yoro. She is 39 years old and lives with her husband and her two daughters. She worked in a textile factory for several years, and when she didn't have a job she decided to start her own business to sell a variety of prepared food and generate some income to help with household expenses.

Her business offers fried chicken with plantains, fried pork chops, pastellitos with corn and meat, among other items. She decided to request a loan of 21,000 Lempiras to continue developing her food business. With the loan she will buy corn, meat, plantains for fried plantain chips, cabbage, sauces, spices, tomatoes, peppers, onions, etc., to use in preparing food.

She runs her business from her house and has a solid client base. The loan will help her increase sales, as she already has contracts with several people working on a road construction project.

Her goal is to help her daughters finish their education and to make sure more people know about her business.

loans.use: to buy corn, meat, plantains for fried plantain chips, cabbage, sauces, spices, tomatoes, peppers, onions, etc., to use in preparing food.

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en: Horn’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Horn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor and construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Gitithia 1952 Age Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Ziphora. She is 51 years old, married, and a mother of 5 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from the training especially enterprise development, savings mobilization and financial management.

She practices vegetable farming. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy fertilizers and quality seeds. This will boost farming production and hence earn more income to meet family expenses e.g food and clothing.

Ziphora is grateful to Kiva and their lenders. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and quality seeds hence boost farming production and earn more income to meet family expenses e.g. food, clothing.

loans.name: Kodjovi Beaugard

texts.fr: Marié, Kodjovi est un homme qui vit à Baguida avec sa femme. Sans enfant, Kodjovi se bat nuits et jours pour le bonheur de son foyer avec le commerce des matériaux électriques et des matelas. Pour s’approvisionner, Kodjovi se rend quatre fois par mois au marché. Kodjovi demande ce crédit pour commander des matelas en vue de répondre aux attentes de certains clients qui sont nécessiteux et ainsi donc épargner avec le bénéfice qui en résultera.
texts.en: Kodjovi, a married man, lives in Baguida with his wife. Without any children, he struggles day and night to achieve happiness at home through his business selling electrical supplies and mattresses. To stock up, he goes to market four times a month. Kodjovi is asking for this loan to order mattresses with the aim of responding to the expectations of certain customers, who are in need, and thus put the resulting profits toward savings.

loans.use: to purchase 3 units of mattresses

loans.name: Delinne

texts.fr:
Delinne est une femme battante de 36 ans. Elle vit avec son mari et ses trois garçons dans un quartier un peu éloigné de la ville. Elle est éleveuse de porcs depuis 5 ans tandis que son mari tient une petite gargote. 
Delinne a connu Vahatra depuis 2 ans. Les bénéfices des prêts antérieurs lui ont permis de cultiver les terres à la campagne. Elle n’avait plus besoin d’acheter du riz durant cette année, car la récolte a suffi. 
Pour ce prêt, elle compte acheter 6 porcs et 1800 Kg de farine alimentaire pour la nourriture des porcs. Son expérience dans l’élevage porcin lui permettra d’arriver à terme de cet élevage  et de gagner beaucoup de bénéfices. Elle envisage de construire une maison pour sa famille plus tard.
texts.en:
Delinne is a woman of 36 years old and a real fighter. She lives with her husband and her three sons in a suburb a bit far from the town. She has been raising pigs for five years, while her husband runs a little cafe.

Delinne has known about Vahatra for two years. The profits from prior loans allowed her to cultivate some fields in the countryside. This year she has not needed to buy rice, because her harvest provided enough for them.

With this loan, she intends to buy six pigs and 1800 kg of feed for them. Her experience in pig-raising will allow her to come to grips with this business and earn a lot of profit. She hopes to be able to build a house for her family later on.

loans.use: to buy six pigs and feed to fatten the pigs.

loans.name: Valbona

texts.en:
Valbona a 43-year-old mother and her 11-year-old daughter, the younger of her two children are dressed up for the photo occasion and this is the rule in their tradition. Agriculture/livestock is the activity that she’s been practicing these past ten years; she has orchards such as pears, peaches and cherries, plants beans and onions and other seasonal veggies and has a dairy cow, 2 sows and 15 chickens. From all this, she sells beans, onions and fruits and also eggs, chickens, baby calves and piglets.

Rural activity is the only source of income for their family. She is applying for this loan to build a fence around the orchards because other villagers’ animals damage her trees.

loans.use: to build a fence around the orchards so that other villager's animals don't damage her trees

loans.name: Ma. Jasmin

texts.en:
Ma. Jasmin is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Jasmin is 46 years old and all three children who are in school.

Ma. Jasmin has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Jasmin requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Ma. Jasmin has been in this business for six years. In the future, Ma. Jasmin would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is a 50-year-old mother of two children and one of them is in school, living in Kampong Speu province. Nowadays, she grows rice on 1.5 hectare of farmland since she was 18 years old. Her crop has not grown well because of drought and it caused her to earn a very low income.

Sokha has been with VisionFund for three cycles already and completely repaid her past loans. Those previous loan help her to have better living conditions. Due to having not enough capital to support her child’s studying, she is now applying for this new Kiva loan in order to pay for her child’s school fee. She hopes that this loan will help her child to become a well educated person and get a good job after graduate.

loans.use: to pay for her child’s school fees so that her child will be a well educated person and get a good job in the future.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Miray

texts.en:
Miray is a 36-year-old single lady who struggles to develop her living. She works as a police officer with a limited monthly salary, and at the same time runs her own grocery store.

Miray is a well-known lady in her region with a good reputation, and works hard to develop her living. She is an ambitious lady who puts great effort into developing both her living and business.

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to maintain her car which will facilitate her life. Miray hopes to expand her business more in the future to stay capable of satisfying her needs.

loans.use: to maintain her car which will facilitate her life

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maiz y frijol desde hace 15 años, vende sus productos durante todo el año, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de insumos agricolas fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: The youth who has his face pixelated is 27 years old and lives in a high risk area. He has worked in agriculture growing corn and beans for 15 years. He sells his product throughout the year and with what he obtains as profit he manages to pay some of the household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc. and in this way  obtain greater economic income.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
This hardworking entrepreneur is Nancy from Barotac Viejo, Iloilo. She is married to Lidio, a delivery man, and they have children.

Nancy wakes up very early in the morning to buy fish and seafood from wholesalers and sell it in the market. She also owns a fishing boat that her neighbors rent from her. When it’s raining and income from the sea is elusive, she has an alternative source which is meat and frozen goods She’s determined to adapt to any situation and improve her business so as to increase her profit.

Now she longs to obtain additional capital of PhP 17,000 that she will use to buy different varieties of fish and seafood in volume. She will also add more chicken meat, pork, ham and other frozen goods. Part of the loan will also pay for the repair of their fishing boat. All of these will contribute to the enhancement of her business to slowly attain her dream of completing her children’s studies. She shares her aspiration with her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to strengthen each other through the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy different varieties of fish and seafoods in volume

loans.name: Kafui

texts.fr: Kafui  est âgée de 36 ans et est une femme mariée. Kafui  vit avec son mari à Baguida où elle prépare de la bouillie faite à base du maïs accompagner des beignets  pour ses consommateurs qui trouvent satisfaction dans son activité. Kafui  s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de maïs, de l’huile et de carton de viva lait afin de répondre favorablement et efficacement aux attentes de ses clients et prendre la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera pour bien réorganiser son activité qui est rémunératrice.
texts.en: Kafui is 36 years old and married woman. She lives with her husband in Baguida, where she makes porridge from corn served with beignets for her customers, who are satisfied with her business. She gets her supplies three times a month at the market and is requesting this loan to order sacks of corn, some oil, and a box of Viva Lait [milk product] in order to respond favorably and effectively to the expectations of her customer and to make a resulting profit for reorganizing her business, which is profitable.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of corn, a container of oil, and a box of Viva Lait

loans.name: Marion

texts.en:
Marion is 33 years old, married and a mother of five children. She joined Hand in Hand so as to benefit from the trainings especially enterprise development.

She practices vegetable farming as her economic activity. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and quality seeds to boost farming production.  This will increase her sales hence more income and therefore be able to provide better food and clothing to her family members.

Marion is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.  She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and quality seeds to boost farming production for increased income to provide better food and clothing to her family members.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lourdes is 56 years old now.

Lourdes has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of fish to sell.

Lourdes has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a Solar Energy Solution for her sewing center

loans.name: Dan

texts.en:
Dan is a first-year student at Kepler. He grew up on a farm near the Congolese border with his mother and three sisters. Due to his strong academic record, he was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. Dan chose Kepler because he wants to learn the skills necessary to become a successful entrepreneur.

Dan plans to major in communications with a concentration in business, and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. He doesn't have precise plans for his life after graduating, but he would like to have internships at several banks during his time at Kepler, so he can consider a career in finance.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Jean

texts.fr:
Jean est un jeune homme dynamique de 23 ans. Il est marié et a une petite fille de 2 ans. Depuis 5 ans, il tient une épicerie qui se trouve dans le grand marché d’Antsirabe. 
Jean est emprunteur chez Vahatra depuis 3 ans. Les prêts d’avant lui ont permis de constituer beaucoup d’épargne afin de subvenir aux imprévus et d’assurer l’avenir de sa fille. 
Avec ce prêt, il compte acheter 2 sacs de farine, 17 bidons d’huile, 10 sacs de sucre et 100 Kg de café qu’il pense écouler en une semaine.
Son rêve est de construire une belle maison pour sa famille et avoir une voiture.
texts.en: Jean is a young, dynamic 23 year old man.  He is married and has a 2 year old little girl.  For 5 years, he has owned a grocery store in the big Antsirabe market.  Jean has been receiving loans from Vahatra for 3 years.  His previous loans have allowed him to create enough savings to cover any unexpected costs and to ensure a good future for his daughter.  With this loan, he hopes to buy 2 sacks of flower, 17 containers of oil, 10 bags of sugar and 100 kilograms of coffee which thinks he will sell in one week.  His dream is to build a beautiful house for his family and to have a car.

loans.use: to buy some flower, oil, sugar and coffee to sell at the big Antsirabe market

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cardboard and metal in quantities for resale

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julian continúa con su negocio de extracción y venta de material de construcción. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque su negocio tuvo buen movimiento. Su negocio continúa generando ventas constantes, “pretendo ampliar mi negocio comprando 2 motores…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son constantes, la desventaja es la falta capital para la compra de motor para la maquina lavapiedras.  Su sueño es mejorar su negocio, él desea realizar la compra de 2 motores para la máquina lavapiedras. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que desarrolla esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Julian solicita un préstamo para la compra de 2 motores para la máquina lavapiedras para trabajar todo el tiempo.
texts.en:
Julian continues with his business extracting and selling construction materials.  His repayments were punctual because his business had good activity.  His business continues generating steady sales.  

He says, “I expect to expand my business, buying two motors….” His business’s advantage is that his sales are steady.  His disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy a motor for the rock-washing machine.  

His dream is to improve his business.  He wants to complete the purchase of two motors for his rock-washing machine.  This is his second loan cycle with the institution in his three years of doing this work on his own.  It is because of this that Julian is asking for a loan in order to buy two motors for his rock-washing machine, in order to work all the time.

loans.use: to buy two motors for his rock washing machine in order to work all the time.

loans.name: Sokly's Group

texts.en:
Sokly’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sokly does work as a farmer to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Hanitriniaina

texts.fr:
Avec le bénéfice du prêt, Hanitriniaina a pu acheter deux porcs à engraisser et à vendre qui augmentera ses revenus au bout de six mois. Avec son commerce, elle a eu beaucoup plus de clients car ses produits sont très diversifiés. Elle a pu subvenir à tous les besoins familiales. 
Pour le prêt suivant, Hanitriniaina profite de la rentrée scolaire pour vendre des fournitures scolaires telles que des cahiers, des stylos, des cartables. Elle préfère vendre en ambulant à la campagne car c’est là où il y a moins de concurrences. 
Elle espère gagner encore plus de bénéfices avec ce prêt afin d’augmenter son épargne qui servira à acheter  un terrain pour construire une maison dans l’avenir.
texts.en:
With the profits from the loan, Hanitriniaina was able to purchase two pigs to fatten and sell, which will augment her revenues in six months. With her business, she had had many more customers, since her products are highly diversified. She has been able to cover all family needs.

For the next loan, Hanitriniaina is taking advantage of the academic school year to sell school supplies, such as notebooks, ballpoint pens, and school bags. She prefers to sell by going door to door in the countryside, since that is where there is less competition.

With the profits, she hopes to earn even more profit with this loan in order to increase her savings, which will be used to purchase a plot of land for building a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies, such as school bags, notebooks, and pens, which she will sell door to door

loans.name: Claude

texts.en:
Claude is a first-year student at Kepler. He grew up with his family on a farm in rural Rwanda. After a rigorous application process based on grades, test scores, and personal interviews, he was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. The first in his family to attend university, Claude chose Kepler because of its academic rigor and focus on practical skills.

Claude plans to major in Communications with a concentration in Business, and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, he hopes to work in the media, possibly as a journalist or in public relations for an NGO.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 33-year-old single lady. Ten years ago she started working as a teacher to cover her needs and expenses. She is an independent lady who is truly loved by her students. Hanan loves teaching as much as she loves children, but her limited salary is depriving her of many things.

Today, Hanan is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy some necessary bridal stuff and pay for her wedding expenses. She is very excited for building her new family, and she hopes to stay capable of improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy some necessary bridal stuff and pay for her wedding expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: ELLA ES UNA JOVEN AMA DE CASA QUE PRESENTA PROBLEMAS SEVEROS DENTALES, SUFRE DE EROSIÓN EN SUS PIEZAS DENTALES POR LO QUE TIENE DIFICULTAD PARA ALIMENTARSE. NECESITA ATENCIÓN INMEDIATA PORQUE DE NO RECIBIR TRATAMIENTO PUEDE LLEGAR A PERDER PIEZAS DENTALES. ELLA TRABAJA PARA APOYAR CON LA ECONOMÍA FAMILIAR, SIN EMBARGO SUS INGRESOS SON LIMITADOS.
texts.en: This borrower is a young housewife who has severe dental problems.  She suffers from tooth erosion and so it is difficult for her to eat.  She needs immediate attention, because if she does not receive treatment she could lose her teeth.  She works to support her family.  However, her income is limited.

loans.use: for dental treatment

loans.name: Lark 5 Group

texts.en: Hom understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Hom knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Hom purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Hom is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata who is in her late 40s, is married with two kids who are still at school. She has been a food vendor for eleven years now. She works from 5am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Fortunata’s 27th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy tins of cooking oil, charcoal for cooking, increased her food stock, started a grocery store and has paid back all her loans successfully. She is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profit to pay school fees, make her loan repayments, bought a plot of land, built her own house, bought a TV set, a radio and covered her household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in the food store and to increase the genge's stock. She dreams of expanding her business.

Fortunata will share this loan with her loan group Ujamaa which consist of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in the food store and to increase the genge's stock.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en: Sopheap’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Sopheap makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Erica

texts.en:
Erica is a 22-year-old woman from the Muzarabani District of Zimbabwe. She is a source of inspiration to young people in her community because she is determined to succeed. Erica often volunteers at the local secondary school as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills to young students.

Erica operates a grocery shop that she intends to expand with the loan that she is requesting from Kiva. This would increase her profit margins and this increase would make her create employment for her community and also improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kyee Hnint Pin Village Group 2

texts.en:
Featured borrower, Nwe is 45 years old and married with two children. She takes good care of house chores and ducks and her husband works on their crop farm. Since the family has 100+ ducks, they plan to expand more and purchase the feed with the Proximity's loan. Nwe is an expert when it comes to ducks, as she has years and years of experiences. Her children want to be well educated and be schooled till graduation. The parents are working very hard enough to cover family's living cost and for savings to fulfill children's wishes.

Above are the members from Kyee Hnint Pin Village Group 2, named Nwe, Aung, Aung M, Tin and Thein. The loan will help 24 group members and generally, they plan to expand their ducks and feeds. To be well looked after, cared and balanced foods are very crucial. Duck raisers work very hard for their ducks.

This village is located in Kyee Hnint Pin Village in Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy River, Delta Region. Besides duck farming, for business, villagers do fishing, tailoring and agricultural production. But most of every households raise animals as livestock or business.

loans.use: to purchase more ducks and feeds.

loans.name: Merline

texts.fr:
Merline est une femme simple mais travailleuse de 48 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont un déjà marié et les deux autre suivent des formations. 
Cela fait 20 ans que Merline exploite son activité de vente de pistaches. Elle a déjà effectué d'autres activités avant comme boucherie et gargote mais elle trouve que la vente des pistaches lui portait chances. Elle est un peu superstitieuse, mais en fait, il semble qu'elle dit la vérité. 
Elle achète des arachides brutes et puis elle les fait frire et les vendre enfin. Les pistaches sont des amuses bouches très appréciées dans le pays surtout mélangées avec les chips ou caca-pigeons. Elles font parties aussi des ingrédients très utiles dans les préparations de plusieurs plats.
Merline a déjà une maison mais encore en bois et son rêve est de pouvoir la reconstruire en dur.
texts.en:
Merline is an uncomplicated woman and hard-working. She is 48 years old and the married mother of three children, of whom a son is already married, and two others are getting training.

For twenty years, Merline has benefited from her business selling pistachios. She has done other work, such as in butcher shops and in retail stalls, but she finds that selling pistachios brought her luck. She is a bit superstitious, but in fact, it seems she is telling the truth.

She purchases raw nuts, fries them, and then sells them. Pistachios are a much-appreciated tasty treat in the country, especially when mixed with chips or caca-pigeons [a snack made from chick peas and pepper]. Pistachios are also one of the useful ingredients in making several dishes.

Merline already has a house, although still made of wood. Her dream is to be able to build a solid one.

loans.use: to purchase pistachios

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn has a jolly personality that made her customers became her friends as well. This is one reason why she still has the business and she’s not just working but also loves what she’s doing which is one good personality that an entrepreneur should possess.

Rosalyn has a food cart business where she is selling different kinds of snacks like sticky rice or in the Philippines it is also known as “kakanin” which is one of the country’s native delicacies. She also sells bottled drinks and other street foods. She has the food cart business located along the side walk.

Rosalyn is a member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and she wants to extend her warmest appreciation for the lenders and Kiva for their monetary support. The previous loan was used to buy additional products for her business. She wants to thank most of all, the Lord for sending angels in human form to help new entrepreneurs like her.

She is persevering each day in running the business since she has two children that she’s supporting in high school. She considered heavy rains and flood as the greatest challenge in the business since it also affects her daily sales. With this, she applied for another loan of P20, 000 to upgrade her food cart and add stocks of bottled drinks and ingredients in making snacks for the business. May the Lord touch he hearts of the people who will read her story.

Being a long time member of CCT, Rosalyn has been consistently attending CCT fellowship group that consist of 15 to 30 members where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners, this made Rosalyn become strong spiritually and dependent to God on every occasion.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: ELLA ES UNA MUJER DE 47 AÑOS DE EDAD, VIUDA CON DOS HIJOS QUE AUN ESTÁN ESTUDIANDO. RECIBE UNA PENSIÓN YA QUE SU ESPOSO FALLECIÓ EN UN ACCIDENTE LABORAL. UNO DE SUS HIJOS SUFRE DE MAL ALINEAMIENTO DE SUS PIEZAS DENTALES LO QUE LE PROVOCA COMPLICACIONES EN LA MANDÍBULA, APARTE DEL EVIDENTE PROBLEMA ESTÉTICO. A ELLA LE GUSTARÍA APOYAR A SU HIJO CON EL TRATAMIENTO DE ORTODONCIA QUE TANTO NECESITA.
texts.en: This borrower is a 47 year-old woman.  She is a widow who has 2 children who are still in school.  She receives a stipend because her husband died in a work accident.  One of her children suffers from badly aligned teeth, which is causing problems in his jaw and also affects his appearance.  She would like to help her son by providing him with the orthodontic treatment that he really needs.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment

loans.name: Aren

texts.en:
Aren lives with his wife and their two children in Nalbandyan village of Armavir region. An electrician by profession, Aren works at the local electric company. Besides that, Aren also run a farm. It includes two piglets and cultivation of different fruits and vegetables. Aren's wife helps him with farming activities, and their hard work provides them income which is vital for sustaining family's costs.

Aren has now applied for this loan to purchase three oxen and hire workers for organizing harvesting and cultivation processes. This is not his first loan.He has taken a loan from a financial institution before, but because of the family's poor conditions, Aren wasn't able to pay it back. However, over these years of tireless work, he was able to own a farm, which is profitable enough to cover monthly payments.

Aren has now been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have bad credit history behind them and have no access to credit products. Let's help this hard-working family to prove that everybody can overcome life’s difficulties through hard and devoted work.

loans.use: to pay for three oxen and hire workers for organizing harvesting and cultivation processes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 450 chicks and 7 sacks of feed

loans.name: Zoila America

texts.es: Zoila de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella posee un negocio de venta de ropa ubicado en el mercado mercado municipal desde hace 20 años, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Zoila is 50 years old and lives in his own house with her husband and their daughter. She has a business selling clothing, which has been located in the city market for 20 years. With the earnings she gets, she is able to cover some household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy more clothing wholesale, so that she can continue with her sales and, thus, have a better income.

loans.use: to buy more clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Vimbai

texts.en: Vimbai, is a 20-year-old woman living in the Muzarabani District, Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, working with students at local schools to help improve their learning. She operates a shop in a local commercial center where she sells clothing accessories and shoes. Her current profits are meeting the basic needs of her family and she would like to expand the business using the loan that she is requesting from Kiva. This will enable her to provide for herself. Vimbai's hope is to grow the business and create employment in her community, as well as further her education.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Keneth

texts.es: Keneth de 21 años es un joven emprendedor que inició su propio negocio de comercialización de perfumes y fragancias, motivado por percibir ingresos adicionales a los que sus padres le proporcionaban y poder auto solventarse en sus gastos personales. Invirtió en fragancias que sus conocidos y amigos acostumbran a usar y que consideró que sería una excelente oportunidad de negocio. En la actualidad cuenta con dos años de funcionamiento y todos los días de la semana atiende las solicitudes de pedidos de sus clientes, por lo que es muy importante que cuente con una liquidez determinante para responder a la demanda de sus clientes, por eso está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar splash, cremas perfumadas y perfumes de diferentes casas. Con esta inversión considera que obtendrá descuentos y podrá dar una mejor oferta a sus compradores.  Su meta a futuro es realizarle adecuaciones a la vivienda de sus padres y abrir un local o una isla en un centro comercial.
texts.en:
Keneth, who is 21 years old, is an enterprising young man. He started his own business selling perfume and fragrances, so that he could earn income in addition to the money his parents provide him and so that he could cover his own personal expenses. He invested in fragrances that are well-known and that his friends are used to using; he considered this to be an excellent opportunity for a business.

At present, his business has been operated for two years. Every day of the week, he takes care of the requests and orders of his clients. Because of this, it is very important that he has a supply ready to respond to the demand of his clients.

For this, he is applying for his first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy splash, scented lotions, and different brands of perfumes. With this investment, he will be able to get discounts on the products and will be able to offer a better selection to his clients.

His goal for the future is to make repairs to his parents' home and to open a location or kiosk in a shopping center.

loans.use: to buy splash, scented lotions, and different brands of perfume.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine! This is 34-year-old Ahmad from Bazaria neighborhood in Nablus. He is married with two children, 2 and 4 years; Both of them are currently attending nursery.

Ahmad runs a car workshop where he repair car bodies and paints them. He has been running this business for three years. Ahmad says that the main challenge to his business is the stoppage of car's spare parts supplies. Ahmad required this loan in order to buy new equipments for car's body repair. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to expand and improve his business and the workshop.

In the future, Ahmad plans to buy a new garage with wider area than the current one and increase his project capital. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for car body repairs.

loans.name: Martha Gladis

texts.es:
Martha, no estudio, está casada, su esposo se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura y tiene 2 hijos de 27 y 25 años de edad.

Martha, desde hace 15 años lava y plancha ropa ajena, anteriormente también tuvo una pequeña venta de platos, cucharas y tazas, pero después no pudo seguir con ese negocio.

Martha, necesita el crédito para comprar trapeadores, tazas, escobas, cepillos y platos para la venta.

El sueño de Martha es, mejorar su vivienda y darles un mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Martha did not go to school. She is married, and her husband works in agriculture. She has two children who are 27 and 25 years old.

For 15 years, Martha has been washing and ironing clothing for other people. In the past, she also had a small business selling plates, spoons, and cups, but she was not able to continue that business.

Martha needs this loan to buy mops, cups, brooms, brushes, and plates to sell.

Martha's dream is to improve her home and give her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy mops, cups, brooms, brushes, and plates to sell.

loans.name: Tambacoumba Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 19 octobre 2001. Ce groupe est composé de femmes qui font le commerce comme activité. Madame Arabietou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 35 ans et mère de six enfants dont une fille. Elle s'active depuis une année dans la vente des denrées de premier nécessité. Elle va acheter avec le prêt sollicité des denrées de premiers nécessité. elle a de bon clients qui lui sont fidèle. Les bénéfices vont servir à participer à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en: The 'banc villageois' was inaugurated on October 19, 2001. This group is composed of women who work in commerce. Ms. Arabietou, at the right in the photo with a hand raised, is the group's representative. She is married, 35 years old, and the mother of six children, including a girl. She has been active for a year selling basic necessities. With this loan, she is going to purchase basic supplies. She has good customers, who are loyal to her. The profits will be used to help cover family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase basic supplies

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: ELLA ES UNA JOVEN SEÑORA DE 35 AÑOS, MADRE DE UNA PEQUEÑA DE 3 AÑOS Y TRABAJA COMO SECRETARIA. NECESITA CON URGENCIA UNA COLECISTECTOMIA LAPAROSCOPICA YA QUE DESDE HACE TIEMPO SUFRE DE FUERTES DOLORES EN LA PARTE SUPERIOR DERECHA DEL ABDOMEN DEBIDO A LA FORMACIÓN DE CÁLCULOS BILIARES EN LA VESÍCULA  QUE YA LE PROVOCARON UNA FUERTE INFECCIÓN. DESAFORTUNADAMENTE NO CUENTA CON EL APOYO DE UNA PAREJA, YA QUE ES MADRE SOLTERA.
texts.en: This borrower is a young, 35 year-old woman who is the mother of a 3 year-old little girl.  She works as a secretary.  She urgently needs to have a laparoscopic cholecystectomy, because for some time she has been suffering from severe pain in the upper right part of her abdomen due to the formation of gallstones in her gallbladder that have already cause a serious infection.  Unfortunately, she does not have the support of a partner, as she is a single mother.

loans.use: to pay for medical treatment

loans.name: Azizi Group

texts.en:
Grace, who is is in her late 30s, is single with one son who is still in school. She has been running a genge business for five years now. She works from 8am to 7pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Grace's 24th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the genge's stock and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan, bought a plot of land, built her house, bought a TV set, a cupboard, bought beds, mattresses and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in her genge store. She dreams of opening a poultry business.

Grace will share this loan with her loan group Azizi which consists of eight members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in her genge store.

loans.name: Shakir

texts.en:
Shakir is a 31-year-old man from Khan Younis City, in the Gaza Strip, which is a difficult place to live due to the Israeli economic blockade, in place since 2007. He is married and lives with his wife in a small house. Shakir works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income.

He wants to improve himself and be an entrepreneur and his business idea is to sell motorcycle parts and provide repair service. Shakir took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy tools for repair of motorcycles in his shop and so to start his own business. He hopes that, by taking this loan, Shakir will be able to improve his family's conditions. Shakir appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy tools for repair of motorcycles for his shop, so as to start his own business.

loans.name: Dúo Vencedoras Por Fe Group

texts.es:
Dúo Vencedoras por fe
El señor jose Claudio es una persona que se dedicaba a la siembra de verduras, pero debido a que la verdura últimamente ha bajado mucho de precio la situación económica se vio muy afectada, eso lo obligo a cambiar de negocio y buscar otro que le deje un poco mas de ganancias, es por eso que decidio poner una venta de repuestos para mototaxi, ya que en la comunidad no hay muchas ventas de repuestos y hay demanda de mototaxis, de esta forma  estará apoyando a su familia, y poder darles lo mejor a sus hijos y darles una mejor educación, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de repuestos para mototaxis.
texts.en:
Dúo Vencedoras por Fe

José Claudio has worked growing vegetables, but since the price of vegetables has dropped sharply, his economic situation has suffered greatly. This forced him to change professions and look for something that would provide a bit more income. That is why he decided to start a business selling parts for motorcycle taxis (mototaxis).

In his community there is not much sales of parts, but there is demand for mototaxis. In this manner he will be able to support his family and give the best to his children, and give them a better education. He is seeking this loan to buy parts for mototaxis.

loans.use: to buy parts to sell for motorcycle taxis.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a married woman with six children. Angela is 49 years old and two of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Angela has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for twenty years. Angela requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Angela would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Idis

texts.es:
Rosa, de 39 años de edad, no pudo ir a la escuela pero aprendió a leer y a escribir; actualmente está acompañada, su pareja vive en Estados Unidos y trabaja en la construcción, juntos tienen 4 hijos de 20, 18, 14, y 11 años de edad, todos van a la escuela y solo ellos viven en casa.     

Rosa, se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería desde muy pequeña, sus padres le enseñaron como cultivar la tierra, ella también tiene vacas.- Rosa, camina 30 minutos para llegar a sus cultivos, los hijos también le ayudan cuando no están en la escuela, ella se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. para preparar el desayuno y también los de sus hijos. 

Rosa, necesita el dinero para comprar un motor para regar sus cultivos y para comprar una ternera.

El sueño de Rosa, siempre a sido que sus hijos se superen y que no tengan que depender del trabajo del campo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 29 years old, and she couldn't go to school but learned to read and write. At present, she is in a relationship; her partner lives in the United States and works in construction. Together, they have 4 children, who are 20, 18, 14, and 11 years old. All of the children go to school, and only they live in the house.

Rosa has been dedicated to agriculture and livestock since she was very young. Her parents taught her how to cultivate the land; she also has cows. Rosa walks 30 minutes to get to her crops. Her children also help her when they are not in school. She wakes up at 5:00am to prepare breakfast for herself and her children.

Rosa needs the money to buy a motor to water her crops and to buy a calf.

Rosa's dream has always been that her children improve themselves and don't have to depend on farm work.

loans.use: to buy a motor to water her crops and to buy a calf.

loans.name: Susana Gertrudis

texts.es:
Susana, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada, su pareja es jornalero, tiene 2 hijos que viven con ella y van a la escuela.

Susana, se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 2 años, antes trabajaba en una tienda del cantón donde vive, ahora en la venta de tortillas le ayuda su hija que tiene 15 años de edad y su horario de venta es desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta las 2:00 p.m. 

Susana, solicita el crédito para comprar 8 quintales de maíz y leña para el negocio.

El sueño de Susana es,  poder ayudar a su hija con los estudios y también mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Susana, 33, has as 9th grade education.  She has a partner who is a day worker, and they have 2 children that live with them and attend school.
