Susana has had a business selling tortillas for 2 years.  Before, she used to work in a store in the canton where they live.  Now she sells tortillas with the help of her daughter, who is 15 years old.  She sells from 7am until 2pm.

Susana is requesting a loan to buy 8 100-lb. sacks of corn and firewood for her business.  

Susana dreams of being able to help her daughter with her education and making some improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy 8 100-lb. sacks of corn and firewood for her business

loans.name: Ravy's Group

texts.en: Ravy’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Ravy makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and woman to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 26 years old and single. He lives alone in Tulkarem. He runs a grocery store in the same city. He works with two other part time employees in his grocery store.

Mohammad has been in this business for five years, and he sells all home necessities like food and cleaning materials. The grocery store is the only source of income for Mohammad.

Mohammad says that the challenges for his business are the high cost of living, so people buy their stuff on credit, and difficulty in getting the goods from the suppliers. He requested the loan to buy necessary goods for the store. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve his living status.

In the future, Mohammad would like to expand his grocery into a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy necessary goods for the store

loans.name: Phorng's Group

texts.en: Phorng’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Phorng makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for ophthalmic treatment

loans.name: Idup

texts.en:
Idup, 38 years old and married. She lives with her husband and her two sons and one daughter. Idup and her husband are drapers for 25 years. She and her husband pull together to increase their family income.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 6.800.000 rupiah. This loan will be used to buy and build a toilet in their home to improve access water and sanitation for their family. Her family income is still not enough to build toilet and water sources by cash, but they are able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all of lenders.

loans.use: to buy and build a toilet at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Robelyn

texts.en:
In the Philippines, you can find variety stores located in every barangay, municipalities or cities. Products here are measured by piece, kilo or by volume. Compared to supermarkets, products in a variety store are much cheaper. They are known as “sari-sari” stores which means “to have many choices”. You can see there grills instead of glass as a protection against theft. Many housewives preferred to manage this type of business since this can be established in the comfort of their own home while taking care of their families, like Robelyn, a sari-sari store owner for many years now. Every month, she earns about PHP 15,000 enough to sustain her daily needs.

Robelyn is grateful that she became a member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) since they provide seminars and coach new entrepreneurs on how to manage their business correctly. They also tell aspiring business owners how Kiva can help them grow their business since there are lenders all over the globe willing to help entrepreneurs that are otherwise financially incapable.

Robelyn applied for a PHP 10, 000 loan since she really wanted her variety store business to flourish for the future of her children. The money will be used to buy additional grocery items and different types of rice. She’s hoping that Kiva lenders will consider her story. She’s thanking God that there are people with compassionate hearts that are willing to help.

On a weekly basis, Robelyn regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of grocery items and varieties of Filipino rice.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 41-year-old married father of two. He started working as a guard in a hospital five years ago to cover his family's needs and expenses. He is a hard worker and a sacrificing father who insists on providing his children with the best education level despite his limited salary. Today, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his children's school tuition fees. He hopes to open a grocery shop in the future to increase his income and stay capable of providing his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Heide

texts.en:
This is Heide, 61 years old, married to Alonie, a farmer. They have three children who are already working. They live in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo. At her old age, she can still manage to run a small canteen or food stall. For almost eight years, her business has been a very helpful source of additional income for her family. 

Small canteen is commonly known in the Philippines as “carenderia”. Most of Filipino families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal.  But if there is only one or two family members present for dinner, they would prefer to buy cooked viand or food. This is a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one or two people when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. This is the reason why Heide’s carenderia business is considered valuable. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community, students and working people. 

But the presence of other carenderia threatens her business. She needs to improve her place to make it more appealing to customers. She is praying for a PhP 50,000 loan to buy materials needed to repair her canteen. Part of the loan will be allotted for additional quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. 

She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from her studies of the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to repair her canteen; to pay for additional quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings.

loans.name: Dúo Cantares Group

texts.es:
Dúo Cantares
La señora Zoila Irene,de 53 años de edad vive en la comunidad de Ciudad Vieja, Sacatepéquez.es una persona trabajadora, Zoila tiene tres hijos quienes estudian en el colegio de la misma comunidad, Anterior mente vendía producto de perfumeria, pero no le dejaba mucha ganancia por lo que decidio ampliar su negocio comprando ropa, juguetes, muy bonitos y ampliar asi su local y tener mejores ventas, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa y juguetes para vender.
texts.en: This is the communal  bank "Duo Cantares."  Zoila Irene, 53, lives in the community of Ciudad Vieja in Sacatepéquez.  She has 3 children who attend school in the same community.  Before, she used to sell perfumes, but this did not generate very good earnings so she decided to expand her business buy purchasing very nice clothes and toys to sell.  This way she can expand her store and have greater sales.  At this time, Zoila Irene is requesting a loan to buy clothing and toys to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothing and toys to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for dental treatment

loans.name: Tatiana Marcela

texts.es: Tatiana de 24 años, reside con su cónyuge e hijo en Arjona un municipio del Departamento de Bolívar, ella es una comerciante de calzado deportivo que se inició esta actividad, cuando identificó que en su grupo de compañeros de trabajo prevalecía el uso de este tipo de cazado,  así que no desaprovecho esta oportunidad e invirtió su pequeño capital.  Hoy en día cuenta con una clientela fidelizada a quienes les ofrece facilidad en sus pagos, sin embargo no cuenta con el capital suficiente para responder oportunamente a la demanda y para mitigar esta situación está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar nuevos modelos de calzado.  Su meta es tener un almacén grande donde pueda ampliar su gama de productos y ofrecerlos a crédito y por libranza.
texts.en:
Tatiana is 24 years old and lives with her husband and son in Arjona, a municipality in the Department of Bolívar. She sells sports shoes and began this business when she noticed that a lot of her colleagues wore this type of footwear. She therefore invested her small capital so as not to miss this opportunity. Today she has a loyal customer base and offers them ease of payment.

However, she doesn't have sufficient capital to respond quickly to demand and, to mitigate this situation, she is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to buy new models of shoes. Her goal is to have a large store where she can expand her product range and offer them on credit and to order.

loans.use: to buy new models of shoes.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilyn is 54 years old now.

Marilyn has a buy and sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a Solar Solution for her business and increase her family's income.

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 50-year-old married mother of three children. For twenty one years ago, she started preparing and pasting paper bags to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. Nada is a sacrificing mother who is working hard to improve her children's life.

Thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to help her son start a business and buy prepaid mobile cards for him, as she wants to maintain her car.
Nada wishes her son a successful future in this business, and she hopes to open her own business in the future to stay capable of satisfying her family's needs.

loans.use: to help her son start a business and buy prepaid mobile cards for him and to maintain her car.

loans.name: Magona Group

texts.en:
Salma, who is in her late 30s, is single with one children who is still in school. She has been selling fish for four years now. She works from 8am to 6pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Salma’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her fish stock and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is so grateful with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees, reinvest in her business, make the loan repayments and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to increase her stock of fish and to buy cooking oil and charcoal for cooking. She dreams of being an international business woman.

Salma will share this loan with her loan group Magoma which consist of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on fish, to buy cooking oil and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is an old client of this institution who is married with children who attend school. He deals in farming and particularly sugarcane and banana selling in his village of Kaboobo cell in Buhunga subcounty. He was constrained by capital and decided to apply for a loan of UGX 800,000 to mulch and prune his sugarcane plantation so that he would be able to increase the yields to earn more income and sustain his family's financial needs. He is grateful to UGAFODE for the financial support rendered.

loans.use: To mulch and prune his sugarcane plantation

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en:
Rosaline is 34 years old and has three children. Rosaline is married and has three children who are in school.

Rosaline is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosaline requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to use in her business.

Rosaline has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosaline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to use in her business

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
Joel es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, y por medio de su carrera quiere abrirse al mundo laboral y poder ayudar a sus seres queridos de esa forma.
Comenta que pese a los inconvenientes está esforzándose para poder ganarse la vida a través de sus conocimientos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Joel is from the city of San Ignacio, and is studying accounting. Through his studies, he wants to open himself up to the working world and be able to help his loved ones in this way. He comments that in spite of his obstacles, he is striving to be able to earn a living through his knowledge.

His is asking for this loan in order to pay his university fees, and in this way be able to continue his studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Repaja

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Repaja works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell coconut wine business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Repaja is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional gallons of coconut wine to sell for her buy and sell coconut wine business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Repaja has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional gallons of  coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Tubiburukundo Group

texts.en: Tubiburukundo is a group led by Ancilla, who is 39 years old. The group name means “Lovely” in English. She is married and has six children aged between 2 and 15 years. She sells food stuffs and has been doing this business for the past 10 years. The group members sell different items and they have the same idea for changing their lives. With this loan, she would like to buy more potatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Euzelie Christelle

texts.en:
Euzelie is a first-year student at Kepler in Rwanda. She grew up with her brother and sister in Rwanda's capital, Kigali. Because of her exceptional academic record and dedication, she was accepted out of over 6,000 applicants this year. Euzelie chose Kepler because it offers the opportunity to take both online and offline courses.

Euzelie plans to major in communications with a concentration in business, and will graduate from Kepler with a B.A. from a U.S. accredited university. After graduating, she would like to pursue starting her own business, hopefully earning enough to support her family.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia, who is a 49-year-old married woman from Tbilisi, lives with her husband, son and daughter. She has a high education and works at the local kindergarten. Her husband and daughter are also involved in private activities. However, the family income is hardly enough to meet all daily costs and that's why Lia plans to increase the productivity of her work. She needs financial support to purchase a stock of supplies and all needed equipment for opening her own kindergarten.

Lia has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Lia has great experience in this kind of work and will make her own business profitable.

The loan will greatly assist Lia and she will be able to improve her economic situation and give her family a better style of life. She awaits support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and open her own kindergarten.

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty is a married businesswoman and mother from the district of Muzarabani in Zimbabwe. She operates a grocery shop at the local business center in her village. This business has made her become a role model to the other young women in her community because she is now financially independent.  She has also diversified to selling clothes at a mall and at a market in her community. With the loan that she is requesting from Kiva, she intends to expand her clothing business. Beauty intends to increase her family’s standard of living. She also intends to help vulnerable children in her community.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raul está estudiando la carrera de Administración de Empresas y al mismo tiempo trabaja en una empresa familiar que se dedica a la venta de polietileno.
Él es una persona luchadora que estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo, y comenta que es muy sacrificada hacer ambas cosas al mismo tiempo, pero lo hace para poder ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de la carrera que sigue.
texts.en:
Raul is studying Business Administration and is working at the same time in a family business that sells polyethylene. He is a persevering person who is working and studying at the same time. He comments that it is very demanding to do both things simultaneously, but he does it in order to be able to be someone in life.

He is asking for this loan to pay the fees for his continuing studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a hardworking woman who has been involved in managing a variety store business for seven years now. Rebecca admits that she still needs guidance on how to make the business grow. With this, she takes advantage every time there are seminars for entrepreneurs conducted by Center for Community Transformation (CCT).

She has been a longtime member of CCT, and she’s grateful that aside from the seminars, they were able to approve her previous loan; she wants to thank CCT as well lenders all around the globe for providing financial support, which made a vast impact on the business. The amount was used to add grocery items for the business.

Rebecca wants to add products to her current business. Basically, she is aiming to manage a one-stop shop. For this, Rebecca is applying for a PHP 20,000 loan this year to buy grocery items, school supplies, and bottled drinks. Through determination and perseverance, she believes that the business will grow and indeed, with the help of God. She is hoping that her request will be approved by CCT and is praying that the Lord may touch the hearts of every lender who reads her story.

Rebecca believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship groups for CCT partners; these consist of 15 to 30 members and are where she gains spiritual strength from members' life-changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays microfinance loans, and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to add heaps of grocery items for her sari-sari store business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings and irrigation pipes for the greenhouses to start her own business.

loans.name: Yani

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Yani. Yani is 30 years old and married. She lives with her husband and her children. She has two sons. Yani is a housewife and her husband has been an employee of a plastic factory for 20 years. She and her husband pull together to increase their family income.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 7,200,000 rupiah. This loan will be used to buy and build sanitation at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family. She wants to have access to safe sanitation and a water source for families. Her family income is still not enough to build toilets and water sources by cash, but they are able to repay loans received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to buy and build sanitation at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is from Byuravan village where he lives with his parents, wife and two kids (in the photo).

Armen is farmer with many years of experience in running a farm. He cultivates fruit and vegetables on the arable land near his house and sells the harvest in local markets. He works hard on the farm and is able to provide his family with basic needs.

Armen now asks for this loan to purchase some farming supplies and develop his farm. He wants to purchase fertilizer and two pigs, and cover other farming costs (fuel for the farming work, transportation costs). He has taken a loan from a financial institution before, but because of the family's poor conditions, Armen wasn't able to pay it back. However, over these years of tireless work, after income started to appear, Armen thinks that it is high time to develop the farm, which is profitable enough to cover monthly payments.

Armen has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history behind them and have no access to credit products. Let's help this hardworking man with his farm and future goals to develop it.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, buy two pigs, and cover other farming costs (fuel for the farming work, transportation costs).

loans.name: Divine

texts.en:
Divine is a first-year student at Kepler in Rwanda. After an application process that considered her grades, test scores, and a personal interview, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants. Divine chose Kepler because of its academic quality and the ability to earn a degree from an international institution.

Divine plans to major in Health Care Management and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, she hopes to manage a community health organization. Divine is committed to improving the wellbeing of her fellow Rwandans, while also supporting her family.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a first-year student at Kepler. He is 19 years old and grew up on a small farm in Rwanda. Because of his incredible academic performance in secondary school, Francis was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year.

He plans to study Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, Joseph hopes to work in international business, while donating a percentage of his income to his community.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia desea llegar a ser una buena doctora, es por ello que se está esforzando para poder salir y ser una profesional capacitada.
Quiere ser una profesional que ayude a las demás personas por medio de sus conocimientos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar los gastos de estudios, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder alcanzar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Florencia wants to become a good doctor, which is why she is making every effort to get ahead and become a trained professional.

She wants to be a professional who helps others through her knowledge.

She is requesting this loan so that she can pay her tuition fees and therefore continue with her studies. She is grateful for this opportunity to pursue her dreams.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
El Sr. Ricardo  vive con sus padres y a su vez trabaja como Policía y por la noche estudia  gracias a su trabajo él puede costear sus estudios. Es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a sus estudios y a su familia, aspira a ser una buena profesional y seguir estudiando y servir a las personas.
Está estudiando para poder ser un buen veterinario y de esa manera poder ser un buen profesional que ayude a los pequeños animales.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios, y no tener que pasar por privaciones.
texts.en:
Ricardo lives with his parents and works as a Police Officer. At night he attends university and thanks to his job he can fund his studies.

He is a very responsible person and is dedicated to his studies and to his family. He aspires to be a good professional and continue studying and serving people.

He is studying to be able to be a good veterinarian and in this way be able to be a professional that helps small animals. He is asking for this loan in order to be able to pay the fees for his studies and in this way he can continue on with his schooling, and not have to suffer hardship.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Operating a side car transportation business and managing a variety store are Loida’s sources of income. Being a side card operator is not an easy job since on a daily basis she needs to check if something needs to be repaired and she also needs to educate bicycle drivers on how to properly take care of the vehicle. Every time something needs to be repaired is a challenge and an expense for her business.

She is grateful that lenders were able to help her financially with the business. She was able to buy grocery items for her variety store and had supplementary capital for the maintenance of her side car units. She wants to thank dear lenders for the monetary support they have provided.  

Since being sick nowadays can't be avoided, every time a driver needs to take a leave for being sick is one challenge that she considers in the business  since it will also affect her income. Loida applied for a P15,000 loan and she is more focused on her side car transportation business. She wants to have each bicycle repainted and do an upgrade. 

Loida believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group meetings for CCT partners, which consists of 15 to 30 members. This is where she gains spiritual strength from members' life changing testimonies, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays micro-finance loans, and hears God’s word, which is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of their side car unit and to buy grocery items for her variety store.

loans.name: María Montserrat

texts.es: Montserrat tiene 44 años y vive con su esposo en Jalisco, una ciudad que representa muy bien la cultura mexicana y todo lo que es México como sus tradiciones, bebidas, comidas y festividades. Desde hace más de 5 años Montserrat decidió convertirse en una mujer emprendedora esto lo hizo dando clases de inglés en su casa, ella es una persona muy paciente y con un enorme don de enseñanza ella ayuda a las personas que quieren aprender el idioma y esto lo hace gracias a la pedagogía y a la teoría de las inteligencias múltiples, ella analiza y conoce a todos sus alumnos para que de acuerdo a sus habilidades pueda enseñarle la forma más eficaz y aprendan muy rápido. Con un  préstamo de MXN 12,000 ella podrá comprar un pizarrón, libros y material didáctico para poder volverse la mejor opción en cuanto a enseñanza de inglés se refiere. Ella está muy agradecida con todas las personas que podrán colaborar con su causa y que le ayudaran a expandir su negocio.
texts.en:
Montserrat is 44 years old and lives with her husband in Jalisco, a city that well represents the Mexican culture and everything that is Mexico, such as its traditions, drinks, foods and festivals.

More than 5 years ago, Montserrat decided to become an entrepreneurial woman and she did this by giving English classes in her home. She is a very patient person with an enormous gift for teaching. She helps people who want to learn the language and she does this thanks to her knowledge of pedagogy and the theory of multiple intelligences. She analyses and gets to know all her students so that, in accordance with their abilities, she can teach them in the most efficient way and they learn very rapidly.

With a loan of MXN 12,000 she will be able to buy a chalkboard, books and educational material in order to be able to become the best option as far as teaching English is concerned. She is very grateful to all of the people who will be able to collaborate in her cause and will help her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a chalkboard, books and educational material

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is the age of 40 and a mother of five children living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She engages in embroidery to earn an income. She started her embroidery business 20 years ago because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses.

Naseem buys materials such as Hand-Embroidery kit, Ribbon, Needles, and Embroidery Machine from market. Another person handles her transactions with her customers. She has decided that she would like to sell her embroidery items directly in the market so that she can earn better profits for her family. She has become an expert in the embroidery business. So, Naseem demanded a loan so she will be able to buy raw materials from the market.
Naseem will be thankful to KIVA and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy embroidery material for herself

loans.name: Eutiquio

texts.en:
Basically, the term "sari-sari" store means a business found in the Philippines that means “variety”. Most Filipinos prefer to have this type of business, since this can be done in the comfort of their own homes while earning money and still be with their families. That’s why Eutiquio, a 45-year-old businessman, and husband of Jesicca from Parola, Philippines, established his own sari-sari store. He started the store in 2011 and continually manages the business.

Eutiquio dreams to expand his store to have a wide array of product choices. Eutiquio is continually formulating marketing strategies for the business’ success, since this really helped him sustain their daily expenses and other basic needs.

Eutiquio wants to thank Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for their untiring support for every new entrepreneur like him, since they also conduct lectures on how to manage the business properly. He’s earning about PHP 2,500 daily, which is enough for their day-to-day expenditures.

Eutiquio really wants to have complete products to sell, which will increase his daily sales. With this, he applied for a PHP 10,000 loan, which he will use to buy a variety of grocery items, school supplies, and other products to add to the business.

Despite being busy managing the business, Eutiquio spares time attending CCT group fellowships, which consist of 10-15 individuals. This is where he can gain strength spiritually and where he hears testimonies from other CCT partners, is able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy a variety of grocery items, school supplies, and other products to add to the business.

loans.name: Marinero Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres y un hombre todos muy emprendedores, que se organizaron hace 2 meses, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus pequeño negocios de venta de queso, fritanga, pulpería y carnicería, así poder mejorar también sus ingresos que les permita poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.

Yuris Rene: Es un hombre luchador de 30 años de edad, con cualidades de líder, pertenece a la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas, casado con 3 hijos menores de edad que estudian su primaria. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a su familia y contribuir con los gastos del hogar y educación de sus hijos, ha estableció una carnicería en un tramo que alquila, pagando una mensualidad de C$ 3,200 (Tres mil Doscientos Córdobas Netos). Está solicitando financiamiento para surtir su negocio y vender pollo, carne de res, de cerdo, carne molida y verduras. Sueña en construir su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
This loan group is made up of three women and one man; all of them are very entrepreneurial. It was formed two months ago with the purpose of accessing financing in order to improve their small businesses selling cheese, running a small restaurant, a grocery store, and a butcher's shop. This way they can also improve their incomes which allow them to cover the basic needs of their home, assure the education of their children, and expand their businesses.

Yuris Rene is a determined man that is 30 years old with leadership qualities. He is of the Miskito ethnicity in the city of Bilwi in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. He is married, and has 3 young children that are studying in elementary school. In order to move his family forward and contribute to the home expenses and his children's education, he started a butcher's shop in a rented space paying $3,200 NIO monthly. He is requesting a loan to supply his business and sell chicken, beef, pork, ground beef and vegetables. He dreams of building his own house.

loans.use: to supply his business and sell chicken, beef, pork, ground beef and vegetables.

loans.name: Junior

texts.es:
Junior proviene de una familia humilde desde la ciudad de Caacupé, demuestra predisposición y ganas de seguir estudiando, es estudiante de la carrera de enfermería, trabaja en una carpintería con su padre, su madre se dedica a la venta de comestibles.
Él es una persona muy luchadora que quiere ser alguien en la vida, y que se está esforzando para poder salir adelante y abrirse camino como profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de sus exámenes y también pagar la matrícula de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Junior comes from a humble family in the city of Caacupé. He demonstrates an aptitude for and desire to continue studying. He is a student in the Nursing program, and works in a carpenter's shop with his father, while his mother works in food sales.

He is a very persevering person who wants to be somebody in life and is striving to be able to get ahead and open up a path as a professional.

He is asking for this loan to be able to pay fees for exams and also for enrollment fees.

loans.use: to pay university testing and enrollment fees.

loans.name: San Miguel 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Miguel 2 forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una está poniendo su esfuerzo para poder ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. Ellas desean capacitarse e ir mejorando en el emprendimiento que cada una hace.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Emilce, quien se dedica al humilde trabajo de venta de frutas y de carbón, comenta que le está yendo muy bien en sus ventas, ya que a través de su esfuerzo tiene los medios para poder dar a sus seres queridos lo que necesitan una vida digna y honesta. Ella es una persona sacrificada que agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones para poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de frutas y de carbón para la venta, y de esa manera poder seguir con su pequeño emprendimiento luchando por poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
The San Miguel 2 Group is part of the poverty eradication program, where each member is putting in effort to improve living conditions for herself and her loved ones. They want to receive training and progressively improve in each of their undertakings.

One of the group members is Emilce, who does the humble work of selling fruits, vegetables, and charcoal. She tells us that her sales are good, as her work is the reason she has the means to give her loved ones what they need, a dignified and honest life. She is a selfless person who is thankful for the opportunity she has received to be able to improve her conditions and keep helping her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy fruits and charcoal to sell so she can maintain her small business and keep working to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fruits and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is a first-year student at Kepler in Rwanda. He grew up on a farm in southern Rwanda. He was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. He chose Kepler because it offers the opportunity to gain work experience while also earning a prestigious degree.

An outstanding student, Jonathan plans to major in communications with a concentration in business and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. He also hopes to improve his fluency with technology and communications skills. After graduating, his dream is to manage his own business.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fresh fruit to sell.

loans.name: Saidakram

texts.en:
Saidakram is a generous boy. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1997. He is single and lives with his parents. He graduated from high school with excellence and wanted to enter university. He has a dream of being a diplomat and getting a higher education degree at the National University of Tajikistan. His parents are workers. He passed exams and entered university. Recently, he studies with excellence and is active during classes. He wishes to be helpful to his motherland and local residents.

Saidakram came to IMON and asked for a loan to pay for his tuition fee to study. He awaits Kiva lenders' kindness and support.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee to study.

loans.name: Higidia Victoria

texts.es:
La socia Higidia pertenece al banco comunal “Los Diamantes” .
La socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de desayunos de forma ambulatoria como mates, jugo de quinua y huevo cocido, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, leche, pan entre otros.
L a socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Higidia belongs to the Los Diamantes Communal Bank.

She alternates her daily activities with working at her business selling door-to-door breakfasts, such as mate, quinoa juice, and hard-boiled eggs. She is a responsible and hardworking person. She has had her business for a good while and it satisfies her on a personal level as it is the way she is able to provide for her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy sugar, milk, bread, and other items.

She is thankful for the loan she has received and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, bread, and other items.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 
La socia sigue  dedicándose al negocio de artesanía, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia se siente agradecida con KIVA por el apoyo y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aretes, anillos entre otros.
texts.en:
Adelaide belongs to the LOS DIAMANTES Communal Bank from the city of Cuzco, Peru.

She still has her handicraft business. She has had her business for a good while and it is doing well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She is thankful to KIVA for its support and she promises to make her payments. She is a responsible and dedicated person, which is how she is able to provide for her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy earrings, rings, and other items.

loans.use: to buy earrings, rings, and other items.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, 57, runs a variety store with an adjacent canteen in Fatima, General Santos City. Just like other business owners, she experiences stiff competition and lack of capital. Sometimes it hampers the smooth operation of her busines, and consequently affects her income.

If she can obtain enough capital, she is confident that she can improve her business. She desires to become a dealer of softdrinks and other beverages in the near future. For the meantime, she would like to borrow PHP 12,000 to pay for added items to sell in her store. She will also cook more meal choices in her canteen.

Her profit will sufficiently provide for her family’s usual expenditures, while her husband’s income as a laborer is allotted for their youngest child’s college expenses. They were able to provide for their eldest, who is already working as of now. We hope you can extend your generous support to her. You may be assured that she can faithfully repay her loan because she has developed the virtue of being a responsible entrepreneur.

She prays for a growing business, good health and more blessings for her whole family. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for added items to sell in her store

loans.name: Tuzamurane Sub Group B

texts.en:
Drocelle is a group leader, aged 50 years. She is married with three children aged between 15 and 21 years. They all go to school.

The group is called Tuzamurane, which means “Support each other” in English. They sell different products, and they wish to expand their businesses for changing their futures for the better.

Drocelle has a shop and has been running a business for eight years. With the loan, she would like to buy more wedding clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more wedding clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.en:
Anastacio, 70, wakes up very early in the morning and goes to sleep late at night because he has to look after his “sari-sari” (variety) store located in Fatima, General Santos City. Some customers buy as early as 4:30 a.m. or as late as 10:30 p.m., and he has to meet their needs or else his business will fail due to competition within the area.

He is a widower with a daughter, who is already working. As much as possible, he doesn’t want to depend on her, as she is also starting her own family.

He knows that he has to save more for emergency purposes and medical needs. He also intends to repair his house in time for the rainy season. He would like to ask for PHP 8,000 in financial support to buy additional inventory. May God knock at your kind hearts to lend him this amount. He would surely appreciate it so much.

Anastacio is a faithful member of CCT Credit Cooperative and he regularly meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es: María es una microempresaria que reside en compañía de su cónyuge e hijos en el municipio de Barranquilla y desde la comodidad de su hogar emprendió sus polifacéticos negocios; venta de minutos y recargas, venta de golosinas y elaboración de postres, con los cuales ha fortalecido el ingreso familiar.  Día tras día los residentes y transeúntes del sector, llegan hasta la terraza de su casa solicitando servicio de minutos y recargas de los diferentes operadores de telefonía celular y tan pronto como se les otorgan el servicio, se antojan en degustar alguna golosina de las que comercializa; rosquitas de queso, bocadillos, gomitas, bolitas de caramelo entre otros y como en el barrio saben que María elabora unos deliciosos postres caseros le solicitan por encargos.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en paquetes de recargas, golosinas e ingredientes para la elaboración de los postres.  Esta inversión permitirá que María continué consolidada en sus negocios al recibir una inyección de capital.  Su meta a futuro adecuar un local y comprar su casa propia.
texts.en: María is a small business owner who lives with her partner and children in the municipality of Barranquilla and from the comfort of her home she started her multifaceted businesses--selling minutes and phone credits, selling snacks, and baking cakes--with which she has strengthened her family income.  Day after day the residents and passers-by in the neighborhood come to the terrace of her home to request minutes and phone credits from different cell phone providers, and as soon as they've received this service they are tempted by one of the snacks she sells: cheese pastries, sandwiches, fruit chews, caramels, etc.  Also, as the neighborhood knows that María makes delicious homemade desserts, they place orders.  She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in cell phone reload packages, snacks, and ingredients to make desserts.  This investment will allow María to strengthen her businesses by injecting capital.  Her goal for the future is to set up a shop and to buy her own home.

loans.use: to buy cell phone reload packages, snacks, and ingredients to make desserts.

loans.name: Abunzubumwe Sub Group A

texts.en: Marthe is a group leader, aged 31 years. She is married with 4 children, aged between 3 and 12 years. Three of them go to school. The group is called Abunzubumwe, which means “United” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business to make a better future. Marthe sells clothes and has been running a business for 5 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more t-shirts and trousers for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees of children and to pay medical insurance.

loans.use: to buy more t-shirts and trousers for sale.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 24-year-old man from Ramallah City. He is single and lives with his family in a small house. Muhammad works as an employee in the construction sector, where he gets a low income.
He wants to improve himself and be an entrepreneur. His business idea is to open an Internet cafe. Muhammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy some computers and furniture to start his own business. He hopes that by taking this loan he will be able to improve his family's conditions. Muhammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy some computers and furniture to start his own business.

loans.name: Iris

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal "LOS DIAMANTES".
La socia Iris alterna sus actividades diarias con su labor como docente de educación primaria en una de las escuelas de la ciudad,  la socia es una persona responsable, la socia  lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo  el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales para el dictado de sus clases.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This is a member of the LOS DIAMANTES Communal Bank.

Iris alternates her daily activities with her work as a primary school teacher in one of the city's schools. She is a responsible person. She has had this job for a good while and it satisfies her personally. She wants to keep working so she can keep supporting her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy dictation materials for her classes.

She is thankful for her loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy dictation materials for her classes.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La socia Celia pertenece al banco comunal "LOS DIAMANTES".
La socia continua  dedicándose al negocio de venta alimentos y bebidas en su restaurante, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia se siente agradecida con KIVA por el apoyo y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, menestras, carnés entre otros.
texts.en:
Celia belongs to the "Los Diamantes" (Diamonds) communal bank. She continues to work in her restaurant, selling food and drinks. She has run this business for a long time, and it is doing well thanks to the determination she puts in each day.

Celia is thankful to Kiva for the support, and she promises to pay back the loan on time. She is a responsible and tenacious person, and she wishes to keep working in order to keep supporting her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy rice, vegetables, meats, and other things.

loans.use: to buy rice, vegetables, meats, and other things.

loans.name: Irene Aimee

texts.en:
Irene is a first-year student at Kepler. Her father has a small farm in Rwanda, and because of Irene's impressive academic credentials, she was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year. Irene chose to attend Kepler because of its focus on providing the skills she'll need to compete in a competitive labor market.

Irene plans to major in Communications with a concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited U.S. university. After graduating, she hopes to start her own business that employs people from her community.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop necessary for pursuing a U.S. college degree.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is from Geghanist village where she lives with her big family of six: her parents-in-law, husband and three children.

Hasmik and her husband are teachers by profession, working in the local village school. Unfortunately, their salaries are not enough even to cover daily needs. Their main income comes from agricultural activities. The family keeps livestock (cows, calves, two pigs and hens) and they also grow wheat, potatoes, carrots, cheries, apples and pears.

Hasmik's husband takes the harvest to the market and earns income for the family by selling it. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs make for a number of difficulties for people developing their businesses in the Shirak region, where Hasmik and her family live.

Shirak is considered a poor region, where the unemployment rate is very high and living standards are quite low. Hasmik's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of Shirak region to help them access the market and earn a living.

Despite the bad socioeconomic conditions in the village, Hasmik says she wants to stay in her motherland and be an example for all the young families to work and develop their country.

Hasmik wants to purchase a pig, fertilizer and feed for the livestock.

loans.use: to pay for a pig, fertilizer and feed for the livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy added items such as ready-to-wear clothes, school supplies and cellphone accessories.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es: La señora Zoraida y su esposo Johnny viven en Cochabamba provincia chapare tienen 23 y 25 años de edad respectivamente, son convivientes más de 8 años, económicamente son independientes, ambos se dedican a la actividad de agricultura siembran papa, haba y papaliza. En una superficie de 4 hectáreas. Para la venta de sus productos cuenta con un mercado consolidado la feria semanal de Sacaba, la señora Zoraida requiere el préstamo para la compra de abono orgánico, semilla de papa y productos, ya que sus ahorros lo invirtieron en la compra del terreno agrícola.                                                                                                                                                                       Por último, señora Zoraida y su esposo se sintieron contentos al tener la oportunidad de acceder al préstamo, además de poder contar con la ayuda  porque con la compra de abono orgánico, semilla de papa y productos agroquímicos va tener mejores ingresos e incrementará su patrimonio familiar y de esa manera podrá mejorar su nivel de vida en beneficio de su familia hacia futuro.
texts.en:
Zoraida and her husband Johnny live in Cochabamba, which is in the Chapare province. They are 23 and 25 years old, respectively, and have been living together for over 8 years. They are economically independent, both working in agriculture. They grow potatoes, fava beans, and ulluco [a tuber similar to a potato] in a 4 hectare plot. They are able sell their products in a consolidated market at the Sacaba weekly farmer's market.

Zoraida needs the loan to buy organic manure, potato seeds, and agrochemical products, since she already used her savings to buy the farm land.

Finally, Zoraida and her husband are happy to have the opportunity to access this loan, and to be able to rely on the help. Purchasing organic fertilizer, potato seeds, and agrochemical products will give them better income, and will increase their family assets, thereby enabling them to improve their living standards and benefit their family going forward.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer, potato seeds, and other products in order to improve her production and obtain better income for her family.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is a 43-year-old married father of five children, four of whom are still attending school. He sells coffee and has a retail shop which he has operated for 20 years. Augustine has taken previous loans from Ugafode which have enabled him to sustain his business and meet his family's financial needs, including school fees.

Augustine has requested a loan of ugx2,500,000 to buy soap, rice, soda and more coffee. He hopes to expand his business using the financial facility from Ugafode. Augustine thanks Ugafode for its ongoing financial support, which has enabled him to sustain his business and meet all of his family's financial obligations.

loans.use: To boost his retail trade business

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a resident of Obutwelo in Lira district. He is 37 years old and married with four children. He sells cooking oil in Lira town. There is high demand for cooking oil in Lira. Simon supports his children's education and his family with the help of the woman. He has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from UGAFODE Microfinance to boost his business. He is grateful to UGAFODE and Kiva funders for their help.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Gem

texts.en: Gem is a resident from Carles, Iloilo. He is a married man with three children. The oldest child is 18 years old while the youngest child is seven years old. Gem and his wife buy and sell fish meal. This fish meal is used by some fisherman to trap the fish and so they will catch them. Gem has supported his family through this business for eight years. He is 36 years old and dreams of improving their livelihood in the future. With this, he is asking for a loan to buy more fish meal to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish meal

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a 39-year-old resident of Manila, Philippines and the wife of Joejean. Together they’re managing a direct selling business where they sell personal products such as soap, lotion, powder and different kinds of footwear. Angelita and her husband are also involved in selling processed meats. They earn about PHP 15,000 each month from both businesses.

Their main goal is to support their children’s education until they finish college and to have enough savings for their family’s future. Though running the business is not easy because of the competition on the same business line and other challenges, Angelita manages to persevere in making the business grow since God uses Center for Community Transformation (CCT) as a medium of help for her business. She takes advantage every time they conduct free lectures and seminars for business aspirants.

Since Kiva has partnered with CCT to help new entrepreneurs with their businesses, Angelita applied for PHP 40,000 to buy additional stock of personal items for her direct selling business so that she’ll have items on display and customers will not wait for weeks just to have the products. Product availability will increase her daily sales.

Angelita believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gains spiritual strength from the members' life changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays microfinance loans and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of personal items for her direct selling business.

loans.name: Hripsime

texts.en:
Hripsime, her two children, father-in-law and husband moved from Gyumri to Hovtashen village in the Shirak region of Armenia last year. They started farming and currently keep two oxen, ten sheep and thirty hens. Near their house Hripsime also cultivates potatoes, carrots and garlic which they sell in local markets.

Shirak is considered a poor region, where the unemployment rate is very high and the living standards are quite low. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions and high costs are a great hindrance for people developing their businesses there.

Because Hripsime’s farm is new, she needs some financial support. She has applied for a 400 USD loan to buy forage for the livestock and cover transportation costs. Her loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

Hripsime hopes for help from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy forage for the livestock and cover transportation costs.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar lives with her husband and son in the village of Saralanj in the Shirak region. Her elder son is a migrant worker in a neighbouring country. Gohar runs their family farm with the help of her husband. The farm includes cows, calves and hens and also cultivates wheat, potatoes, carrots, garlic and beets. Their family income is derived from selling their harvest in nearby open markets.

Gohar has requested this loan to develop her farm through the purchase of forage and seeds for the farm. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions and high costs create a number of difficulties for people trying to develop their businesses in the Shirak region. Gohar's loan has been approved through the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, in order to help them gain market access and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for forage and seeds for the farm

loans.name: Joanna

texts.en:
Joanna and her family were the victims of a fire that ravaged a large part of their community last November, but with her faith in God she managed to rise up and move on with her life. She continued operating her sari-sari, or small variety store, to help her husband Ardy, an auto mechanic, earn a living for their family.

Joanna is truly thankful for the previous 21,000 PHP loan she received through Kiva's field partner CCT, which she used to restock her store with groceries and other items. She successfully repaid it but still needs additional capital to continue growing her business. She would be greatly appreciative if she were granted a 25,000 PHP loan for this purpose.

For Joanna, life has to go on for the sake of her children who are still in school. She works hard to fulfill this dream despite the challenges. Joanna and all CCT community clients are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to restock her store with groceries and other items.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en: Gulnora is a lighthearted woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1972. She is married and has four children. She is working at a medical clinic. She has a daughter that has health problems. She worries about her and wishes for her daughter to be healed. In order to be treated, she needs to have a surgical operation. Gulnora and family members love her very much. She is asking for a loan to pay for the surgery for her daughter. This loan will help her to stabilize her daughter’s health.

loans.use: to pay for a surgical operation for her daughter.

loans.name: Elsira Esther

texts.es: Elsira se vinculó a la vida comercial con la finalidad de estar más tiempo con sus hijas y poder ofrecerles una crianza y educación estable. Inicio su propio almacén de variedades en el que ofrece productos de belleza, cosméticos, bisutería, papelería y juguetería, hace quince años en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla y diariamente apertura a primera hora de la mañana, de este modo transeúntes, vecinos y amigos del sector pueden realizar sus compras. Como su capital es insuficiente para responder a la demanda actual, está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá surtido en general; accesorios, perfumería, cremas corporales, cosméticos y demás.  Su meta de negocio es fortalecer su capital de trabajo y contar con los recursos pertinentes para educar a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Elsira got involved in the commercial life with the purpose of spending more time with her daughters and to be able to give them a proper life and stable education. She opened up her own warehouse 15 years ago in a neighborhood of the municipality of Barranquilla. In it she offers beauty products, cosmetics, costume jewelry, stationery, and toys.

She opens early every morning so that passersby, neighbors, and friends in that area can make their purchases. As her working capital is insufficient to keep up with current demand, she is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use this loan to invest in general supplies: accessories, perfumes, body creams, cosmetics, and more.

Her business goal is to strengthen her working capital and have the appropriate resources to be able to educate her daughters.

loans.use: to invest in general supplies: accessories, perfumes, body creams, cosmetics, and more.

loans.name: Eliab

texts.en: Eliab is an old client of UGAFODE Microfinance. He is married and has four children who attend school. He deals in cattle trading in a major cattle market. He is constrained with limited capital to buy more cows for trade so that he can meet his financial needs and look after his family. He therefore applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings to buy more cows to sell. He will be able to increase his cattle stock and therefore sales and profit. He is grateful for the financial support that UGAFODE rendered to him.

loans.use: To buy cattle for trade

loans.name: Yitirga Group

texts.fr: Brigitte est une femme âgée de 40 ans mariée mère de 4 enfants. Elle exerce son activité de restauration depuis 16 ans. Ce qui fait marcher sa restauration c’est qu’elle fait bien le repas, elle respect ses clients, dynamique, battante et aussi la propriété de son restaurant. Elle veut le prêt pour acheter 1 bidon d’huile de 13 250, 1 sac de farine à 19 250 f, 1 sacs de riz à 18 000 f, haricot 1 sac à 27 500 f, un sac d’attiéké à 19 000, poissons à 20 000 f, 1 sac de charbon 6 000 et le reste dans les condiments. L’utilité du prêt de renforcer son activité. Elle à déjà reçu le prêt 1 fois a rembourser à la date prévue.
texts.en:
Brigitte is a 40-year-old woman who is married and the mother of four children. She has been running a restaurant for 16 years. Her restaurant runs well as a result of well-made meals, her respect for her customers, her energy, as well as the cleanliness of her restaurant.

She is requesting this loan to buy 1 container of oil at 13,250 francs, 1 bag of flour at 19,250 francs, 1 bag of rice at 18,000 francs, 1 bag of beans at 27,500 francs, 1 bag of attiéké at 19,000 francs, fish at 20,000 francs, 1 bag of charcoal at 6,000 francs, and the remainder for condiments.

The loan will be used to strengthen her business. She has already received a loan once and repaid it on time.

loans.use: to buy oil (13,250 francs), flour (19,250 francs), rice (18,000 francs), beans (27,500 francs), attiéké (19,000 francs), fish (20,000 francs), charcoal (6,000 francs), and condiments (with the remainder).

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is newly married and a new UGAFODE client. For the past four years he has driven a boda-boda, or motorcycle taxi, to earn a living.

Julius, however, has been driving someone else’s motorcycle all this time. He decided to join Kiva's field partner UGAFODE in order to apply for a 2,000,000 UGX loan to buy his own boda-boda.

Julius thanks UGAFODE for enabling him to realize an asset such as his motorcycle. He encourages the institution to continue supporting low-income earners, especially young people, since it helps improve their standards of living.

loans.use: to buy his own boda-boda, or motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Cleofe Eufemia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS DIAMANTES.
La socia Cleofe continua ayudando  a su esposo en la carpintería, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua  fabricando ataúdes para los clientes que soliciten, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar madera, pinturas entre otros.
texts.en: This member belongs to "LOS DIAMANTES" communal bank. Cleofe continues helping her husband with the carpentry. She has had this business for some time and it is going well thanks to the hard work she puts into her business every day. She continues making coffins for the customers that need them. This is how she supports her family. She seeks a loan to buy wood, paint, and other items.

loans.use: to buy wood, paint, and other items.

loans.name: Misael

texts.es: Misael  de  30 años vive junto con su familia en Olanchito, Honduras, donde se dedica a la agricultura de hortalizas, cafés y granos básicos, es una actividad muy productiva, ya que pueden producir sus propios alimentos lo que le ayuda muchísimo a su economía y de la misma manera vende parte  de lo que cosecha, lo cual  le ayuda con el sustento del hogar. Misael desea ser un productor más próspero para que su familia y sobretodo que  sus tres hijos obtengan la mejor educación y puedan llegar a ser profesionales y tener las oportunidades que el no tuvo. Sin embargo cuando los niños tienen que estudiar por las noches o hacer sus deberes de la escuela se les dificulta  debido a que en la comunidad donde viven no hay acceso a energía eléctrica y los niños deben iluminarse con velas o lámparas a base de kerosén lo que produce que no tengan buena iluminación y su salud se vea afectada por los humos tóxicos a los que están expuestos. Es por esta razón que Misael solicita este préstamo a Soluz Honduras para adquirir un sistema solar que le ayudara a toda su familia a tener una vida mejor con una iluminación que les permitirá a los niños realizar sus tareas sin peligro alguno y al resto de la familia una oportunidad para entretenerse viendo televisión después de un largo día de trabajo y además tener siempre con carga sus teléfonos celulares.
texts.en:
Misael is 30 years old and lives with his family in Olanchito, Honduras, where he grows crops, coffee, and basic grains. It is very productive work as they can produce their own food which helps his financial situation a lot. He sells part of his harvest, which helps support his household.

Misael wishes to be more prosperous so that his family thrives, and above all that his children have the best education possible and they become professionals resulting in opportunities he never had. Nonetheless when the children have to study during the evening or do their homework it is difficult because in the community where they live there is no access to electricity. The children need to use candles or kerosene lamps but these do not have good illumination and their health is affected from the toxic fumes that these items expel.

There Misael seeks a loan from Soluz Honduras to buy a solar power system that will benefit and improve his family's living conditions with light that will permit his children to complete their homework without any danger, and enable the rest of the family the opportunity to entertain themselves by viewing television after a long day at work. In addition they will be able to charge their cell phones.

loans.use: to buy a solar power system that will benefit and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.name: Romina

texts.es:
Romina esta estudiando y trabajando al mismo tiempo, es una persona muy sacrificada y emprendedora, que se viene esforzando para poder ser una buena profesional y de esa manera poder seguir luchando por ser alguien en la vida. Comenta que su préstamo anterior le ha sido de mucha ayuda, ya que pago su matricula y otros gastos que son de su universidad.
Ella pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas por adelantado de su carrera, y de esa manera poder continuar con su lucha de ser alguien profesional y agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Romina is studying and working at the same time. She is a very self-sacrificing and enterprising person, who has been striving to be a good professional, and thereby to continue fighting to be someone in life. She says that her previous loan has been very helpful because it paid for tuition and other expenses at her university.

Romina is asking for a new loan to be able to pay her university fees prior to receiving her degree, and thus to continue with her fight to be someone professional. She gives thanks for this new opportunity that enables her to continue growing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La socia Carmen  pertenece al banco comunal LOS DIAMANTES.
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de  venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de abarrotes, la  socia se siente agradecida por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia continua vendiendo productos de primera necesidad, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia Carmen solicita el préstamo para comprar aceite, gaseosas, arroz, azúcar entre otros.
texts.en: The member named Carmen belongs to "LOS DIAMANTES" communal bank. She continues her business selling basic needs items in her grocery store. She is thankful for the loan and promises to make payments on the established schedule. She is a responsible person. Carmen continues selling basic staple groceries in order to support her family. Carmen seeks a loan  to buy oil, soda pop, rice, sugar, and other items.

loans.use: to buy oil, soda pop, rice, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a victim of fire that burned her entire house last July. However, her faith in God strengthened her so she could move on for the sake of her family. She has seven children, four of whom are in school.

She immediately resumed her food business, selling fruits, vegetables, and some grocery items in her "sari-sari" or variety store. While in the process of recovery, she needs additional capital to buy these products to sell in retail. A loan of PHP 20,000 will greatly help her continue with her business to provide for her family's needs and sustain the education of her children. It is her dream to see her children finish their studies and have a good future.

Anita meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy fruits, vegetables, and groceries for her variety store

loans.name: Los Retonos Group

texts.es:
Natalia es una mujer de 46 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 8, 17 y 20 años de edad, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, independiente y muy responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ que surgió a raíz de unas graves inundaciones en donde numerosas familias quedaron sin sus hogares y fueron asentadas en este barrio marginal. 
Natalia es de tez morena, baja estatura y físico robusto, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español (la segunda de la derecha viste, pantalón floreado). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de madera con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su sueño por mejorar su negocio la llevaron a liderar la banca de personas con negocios como; venta de empanadas, venta de refrescos, bicicletería,  venta de cosméticos por catálogo, venta de verduras, atención de salón de té, pintado de uñas y venta de pescado. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano como, pantalones camisas, poleras y otros, “vendo ambulantemente en zonas comerciales y a diario…” comenta. la ventaja de su negocio es su mercadería se vende continuamente, la desventaja es la falta de capital para surtir la mercadería. Su sueño es tener negocio surtido y consolidado, ella desea realizar la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para surtir su negocio y mejorar la oferta. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de manera independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Natalia solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para surtir su negocio y mejorar la oferta.
texts.en:
Natalia is as 46 year old woman, lives with her husband, has three children ages 8, 17, and 20. Her business is selling second-hand clothing. She is a good mother, independent, and very responsible.

Her business is located in the "plan 3000" neighborhood, which grew after some severe floods where numerous families were left homeless and displaced to this marginal neighborhood.

Natalia has a dark complexion, is short, and physically robust. Her first language is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish as well. In the photo she is second from the right in floral pants. Her husband works in construction and her children study in school. They live in their own home build of wood with a corrugated iron roof and earth floor. It has basic services.

Her dream to improve her business led her to lead this communal bank. The members have businesses such as: selling turnovers, selling refreshments, bicycle shop, selling cosmetics by catalog, selling vegetables, tea cafe, nail shop, and selling fish. Her business is selling second-hand clothing such as pants, shirts, and other items. "I sell on the street in commercial zones, daily..." she comments. The positive for her business is she sells her merchandise continuously; the challenge is the lack of capital to stock her business.

Her dream is to have a stocked and consolidated business. She wishes to buy second-hand clothing at wholesale in order to stock her business and improve sales. This is the second sequence of loans with the institution in 6 years that she has been developing this business independently. It is for these reasons that Natalia seeks a loan to buy second-hand clothing at wholesale in order to stock her business and improve sales.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing at wholesale in order to stock her business and improve sales.

loans.name: Soledad
