texts.es:
La socia Soledad pertenece al banco comunal LOS DIAMANTES, la socia  sigue dedicándose a la docencia de educación inicial, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, a la vez la socia sigue elaborando prendas de vestir para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia Soledad solicita el préstamo para comprar lanas, agujas, botones entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Soledad belongs to the “Los Diamantes” [The Diamonds] communal bank. She is continuing to work as a pre-school teacher, and at the same time continues making clothing for customers who request them. She is a repsonsible and tenacious person who wishes to keep working to support her family.

Soledad is requesting this loan to buy wool, needles, buttons, and other items. She feels thankful for the loan, and promises to pay the established fees.

loans.use: to buy wool, needles, buttons, and other items.

loans.name: Nazli

texts.en:
Nazli is married and a mother of two. She started Tupperware sales with advice from her friend, and has been successful in it for ten years.

Many things have changed in her life since she started this business. Her social life has developed, and she has gained confidence in herself and has made lots of friends.

With the help of her fourth loan, she is planning to buy more products and increase her sales. Her aim is to reach to a certain sales level to get the benefits of Tupperware gifts and trips, and also to increase the number of her subgroups.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Nazlı Hanım evli ve iki çocuk annesi. Bir arkadaşının tavsiyesi ile girdiği Tupperware satış işini on yıldır başarı ile yapıyor. Bu işe başladıktan sonra hayatında çok şey değişmiş. Sosyal hayatı gelişmiş, kendine olan özgüveni artmış, bir çok çevreden arkadaş edinmiş. Aldığı dördüncü kredi ile ürün alıp satışını arttıracak. Hedefi belli bir satış gerçekleştirip Tuppeware’n hediyelerinden ve gezilerden yararlanmak. Alt gruplarını daha da çoğaltmak.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Ancleta

texts.es:
La señora Anacleta y su esposo Liborio viven en Cochabamba provincia chapare tienen 49 y 45 años de edad respectivamente, convivientes más 15 años, económicamente son independientes, ambos se dedican a la actividad de agricultura siembran papa. papaliza y haba envaina verde. En una superficie de 5 hectáreas. Para la venta de sus productos cuenta con un mercado consolidado la feria semanal, la señora Anacleta requiere el préstamo  para la compra de abono orgánico, semilla de papa y productos agroquímicos. 
Por último, la señora Anacleta se sintie contenta al tener la oportunidad de acceder al préstamo, porque con la compra de abono orgánico, semilla de papa y productos agroquímicos va tener mejores ingresos y incrementará su patrimonio familiar y de esa manera podrá mejorar su nivel de vida en beneficio de su familia hacia futuro.
texts.en:
Doña Anacleta and her husband Liborio live in Cochabamba, Chapare Province. They are 49 and 45 years old, respectively, and have been together for more than 15 years. They are economically independent; both work in agriculture. They grow potatoes, green beans, and the traditional tubers called papa liza on an area of 5 hectares (a little over 12 acres). For the sale of her products she has a well-established clientele at the weekly market. Doña Anacleta needs the loan for the purchase of organic fertilizer, potato seeds and agrochemicals.

Lastly, Doña Anacleta is happy to have the opportunity to access the loan, because with the purchase of organic fertilizer, potato seeds and agrochemicals, she will have higher earnings and she will increase her family’s patrimony. And in this way she can improve her standard of living for the future benefit of her family.

loans.use: buy organic fertilizer, potato seeds and agrochemicals to improve her production and improve her family income.

loans.name: Gülhayat

texts.en:
Gülhayat is married and the mother of two. She has been selling Tupperware for 18 years. She became Tupperware's district distributor. She has approximately 250 members. With the help of her third loan, she is planning to buy more products. She says that she has reached everything she aimed to in her life. She is supporting women in three districts by leading them to make financial contributions to their lives. She wants to reach women who sit at home doing nothing to improve their lives and enable them to earn their own money. She wants to reach as many women as she can and make their lives better.
_______________________________
Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Gülhayat Hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. On sekiz yıldır Tupperware satışı yapıyor. Tupperware bölge distiribütörü oldu. Altında iki yüz elliye yakın üyesi var. Aldığı üçüncü kredi ile ürün alacak. Hayatında hedeflediği her şeye ulaştığını söylüyor. Üç bölgede kadınlara liderlik yaparak hayatlarına ekonomik olarak katkı sağlamak için destek oluyor. Ev de hiçbir iş yapmayan kadınlara ulaşarak hayatlarını iyileştirmek, onların da kazanç elde etmelerini sağlamak olduğunu belirterek bir çok hayata dokunup iyileştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy Tupperware products for resale.

loans.name: Hava

texts.en: Hava is married and a mother of four.  Her children are going to high schools and universities.  She has been selling Tupperware for nine years to contribute to the family budget and her children's school  needs.  Last season she made a high sale and won a trip.  She is very happy to go to a trip which she would  never have done without this job.  With the help of her third loan she is planning to buy products in promotion, increase her sales and double her gains.  Her only aim is that her children complete their education.

loans.use: to buy promotional items and raise her profits

loans.name: Özlem

texts.en: Özlem is married and has one child.  In order to make her own money and to contribute to the family budget she started selling Tupperware on the advice from her friend.  She has been selling Tupperware to her friends and neighbours for four years.  With the help of the third loan, she is planning to buy products on promotion, sell them and increase her gain. She loves this job, and her social environment has expanded. She loves the gifts and trips. She wants to improve in this business and help her son with his education.

loans.use: to buy promotional items and increase her sales

loans.name: Shirnaz

texts.en: Shirnaz is 44 years old. She lives in Lagodekhi with her son and daughter-in-law. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of land where they grow different kinds of vegetables. Shirnaz wants to start a husbandry business and has requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 5,000 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase cows and will start her husbandry business. Shirnaz will produce dairy products to sell locally at a good price. She hopes that the business will be profitable and will improve her family's living conditions with increased income.

loans.use: to purchase cows and start husbandry business

loans.name: Dalgys Del Carmen

texts.es: Dalgys es habitante de un barrio ubicado al sur de Barranquilla en el cual funciona su negocio de Droguería, cuando finalizo sus estudios de auxiliar de farmacia decidió ser una empresaria independiente y proporcionarle a los habitantes del sector una droguería cercana a sus hogares, puesto que el sector presentaba carencia de este tipo de negocio.  Inicialmente su surtido era exclusivamente de medicamentos, pero con el trascurrir del tiempo incorporó nuevas líneas de productos, cuenta con una serie de medicamentos de alta rotación y una serie de productos para la nutrición, cuidado de la piel e higiene personal, que se encuentran a disposición inmediata para sus clientes que en su gran mayoría son vecinos o transeúntes del sector y quienes pueden comprar de contado en los horarios de 7 a.m. a 8 p.m.  Dalgys está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en nuevo surtido de medicamentos y productos de aseo.  Esta inversión mejorará el stock y la diversidad, con el propósito de que el cliente encuentre todos los productos que solicita en las marcas de su preferencia. Dalgys es una microempresaria de 43 años y desea que su negocio sea altamente competitivo, que siempre se encuentre surtido y que con las utilidades pueda comprar su casa propia.
texts.en:
Dalgys is a resident of a neighborhood located in the south of Barranquilla, which is where she runs her drugstore. When she finished her studies to be an assistant pharmacist, she decided to start her own business in order to provide the residents of her area with a drugstore near their homes, since the area lacked this type of business.

Initially, her selection was exclusively medicines, but over time she incorporated new lines of products. She now has a series of high demand medications, a series of nutrition products, skin care products, and personal hygiene products, which are at her customers' immediate disposal from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m.

Dalgys is applying for her first Kiva loan via Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest the loan in a new selection of medications and cleaning products. This investment will improve her stock and diversity, so that her customers may find all the products they are looking for in their preferred brands.

Dalgys is a 43-year-old small business owner, and wishes for her business to be highly competitive and always well-supplied, so that with the profits she may buy her own house.

loans.use: invest in a new selection of medication and cleaning products.

loans.name: Aynur

texts.en:
Aynur is married and the mother of two. First she was a user of Tupperware products; then she became the seller. She started this sales business in order to have an additional income for her home and children, and now she has successfully been doing it for nine years. She says that she is easily paying for her children's educations. With the help of her third loan, she is planning to buy more products from promotions and increase her sales and income. She loves this job and recommends it to every housewife.
_________________________________
Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Aynur Hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. Aynur Hanım kullanıcı olarak başladığı Tupperware ürünlerinin satıcısı olmuş. Ek bir gelir sağlamak, çocuklarının ve evinin ihtiyaçlarını daha rahat karşılamak için başladığı Tupperware işini dokuz yıldır başarı ile yapıyor. Çocuklarının eğitimi masraflarını bu iş sayesinde rahatlıkla karşıladığını söylüyor. Aldığı üçüncü kredi ile promosyonlu ürünler alıp satışını ve kazancını arttıracak. Bu işi çok seviyor ve tüm ev hanımlarına tavsiye ediyor.

loans.use: to buy Tupperware products for resale.

loans.name: Josee

texts.en:
Josee is a first-year student at Kepler. Because of her tremendous academic performance and hard work, she was selected from over 6,000 applicants this year. Josee chose Kepler because of the program's competitiveness and the internship opportunities its affords to students.

Josee plans to major in Health Care Management and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, she hopes to work in the health industry and perhaps manage a hospital one day.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Vazgen

texts.en:
Vazgen is from the Getap village of the Shirak region where he lives with his parents, wife and two children. He is a farmer, and in the evenings, using his own car, he drives a taxi. He works hard to have a good harvest in his farm, which he sells to get income for his family's basic needs.

Vazgen applied for this loan to purchase forage for feeding the livestock. The lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions and high costs creates a number of difficulties for people trying to develop their businesses in the Shirak region. Vazgen's loan has been approved through the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, in order to help them to gain market access and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding his livestock.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: For the last seven years, Gloria and her husband have earned a living by fishing. Gloria is 59 years old and lives with her husband and eight children in Carles, Iloilo. Her goal for the future is to increase her income and have a better life. To do this, she wants to borrow money to maintain her boat. She will also use part of the loan to buy rice to eat, and feed to use to raise some pigs.

loans.use: to maintain her boat and buy rice and feed.

loans.name: Gülser

texts.en:
Gülser is a single woman who lives by herself. She came to the city to go to university. After graduation, she settled down in the city and opened a hair and beauty saloon. With help from an earlier loan, she bought hair dyes and wax materials to use to earn money. She is requesting a second loan to buy more supplies in bulk and thereby increase her income.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Gülser hanım bekar yalnız yaşıyor. Üniversite öğrencisi olarak geldiği şehirde okulunu bitiriyor ve yerleşiyor. Kuaför ve güzellik uzmanı olarak dükkan açıyor ve çalışma hayatına başlıyor. İlk aldığı mikro kredi ile saç boyası ve ağda malzemesini toptan alarak müşterilerine kullanıyor ve para kazanıyor. İkinci aldığı mikro kredi ile de toptan saç boyası, ağda malzemesi alarak para kazanmayı ve işini geliştirmeyi hedefliyor.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her beauty salon

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando tiene 43 años es un hombre muy trabajador que se dedica a la agricultura de hortalizas y granos básicos con lo cual lleva el sustento a su hogar. Él quiere ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida,  pero hay algo que no ha podido realizar hasta el momento y es poder contar con  energía eléctrica en la vivienda ya que en la comunidad de Olanchito, Honduras donde vive con su esposa y seis hijos  no hay acceso a este servicio lo cual le ocasiona problemas ya que no pueden expulpar el café por las noches además deben caminar largas distancias y pagar para tener acceso a la carga de celulares, es por esta razón que Rolando ha decidido  solicitar un préstamo a Soluz Honduras para adquirir un Sistema Solar para su hogar que le ayudara a tener todos los beneficios que la energía eléctrica ofrece y podrá tener junto a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rolando, 43, is a very hardworking man who farms vegetables and basic grains, by which he supports his household. He wants to offer his family a better quality of life. But there is something that he has not been able to do up till now, and that is to have electricity in the home, since in the community of Olanchito, Honduras, where he lives with his wife and six children, there is no access to this service.

This causes them problems because they cannot remove the pulp from the coffee beans at night. In addition, they also have to walk long distances and pay for access to a cellphone charger. It is for this reason that Rolando has decided to apply for a loan from Soluz Honduras to acquire a solar power system for his home. It will help him have all the benefits electricity offers and he, together with his family, can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy a solar power system and thus eliminate the pollution caused by the use of candles and kerosene and have a better quality of life.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar energy system for her business.

loans.name: Kattya Otilia

texts.es: Kattya es una mujer trabajadora de 25 años de edad, vive junto a su pequeño hijo en la localidad rural de Cogri, que está ubicado en Moquegua. Ella trabaja como ayudante de cocina y también se dedica a la cría de cerdos orgánicos, poniendo mucha atención en el cuidado y la alimentación que les brinda. Kattya solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar cerdos orgánicos y para la alimentación orgánica de estos. En el futuro Kattya espera poder mejorar su casa para que su hijo viva cómodamente, además se esforzará mucho para que reciba una buena educación y sea una persona de muchos valores.
texts.en:
Kattya, age 25, is a hard-working woman. She lives with her small son in the rural area of Cogri, which is located in Moquegua. She works as a kitchen helper. She also raises pigs organically, and she puts a great deal of attention into their care and feeding.

Kattya is requesting a micro loan to be able to buy pigs raised organically and to buy organic feed for them.

In the future Kattya hopes to be able to improve her house so that her son lives comfortably. She will also put forth a great deal of effort so that he receives a good education and becomes a very principled person.

loans.use: to buy pigs raised organically and organic feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Nuray

texts.en:
Nuray is married and a mother of two. Both of her children are going to universities. With advice from her friend, she has been selling Tupperware for nine years in order to make a contribution to the family budget and to help her children with their school needs.

Now she has many customers and she is comfortable with it. As long as she is healthy, she is planning to continue this job, and she wants her children to finish their schooling. With the help of the third loan, she is planning to buy products on promotion, sell them, and increase her gain.

.
Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Nuray hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. İki çocuğu da üniversite de okuyor. Ailesine katkı sağlamak ve çocuklarının eğitim ihtiyaçlarını karşılamak için bir arkadaşının önerisi ile dokuz yıldır Tuppurware satışı yapıyor. Artık belirli müşterileri var ve satış da zorluk yaşamıyor. Sağlığı el verdikçe işini devam ettirmek ve çocuklarının eğitimini tamamlamasını istiyor. Aldığı üçüncü kredi ile promosyonlu ürünler alıp satışını arttıracak.

loans.use: to buy promotional material and to buy and sell Tupperware products.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.es: Rudy de 29 años  y su esposo se dedican a la agricultura, siembran frijol, maíz, hortalizas y café en la comunidad de Olanchito, Honduras desde hace 7 años. Es un trabajo donde se han tenido que esforzar bastante ya que desean que a sus hijos no les haga falta lo básico y darles el mejor de los estudios para que en el futuro lleguen a ser profesionales, pero lamentablemente en esta comunidad no hay acceso a energía eléctrica por lo cual su hijo que asiste a la escuela tiene dificultades a la hora de hacer las tareas o estudiar por las noches, también ellos sufren la falta de energía ya que gran parte de su trabajo lo realizan por ventas telefónicas y para esto deben caminar mucho para tener cargados sus celulares, además como familia les gustaría tener un tiempo de esparcimiento y entretenimiento con la televisión después de las largas horas  de trabajo en el campo. Por estas razones Rudy ha  solicitado financiamiento a Soluz Honduras para poder adquirir un Sistema Solar que sin duda le proporcionara a ella y su familia todos los beneficios de los que ahora carecen.
texts.en:
Rudy, age 29, and her husband devote themselves to agriculture. They have been growing beans, corn, vegetables, and coffee in a community in Olanchito, Honduras for seven years. It is a job that they have had to put a lot of effort into because they do not want their children to lack any of the basics. They want to give them the best education so that they become professionals in the future.

Regrettably, this community does not have access to electricity. Therefore, their son who goes to school has trouble when it is time to do his homework or study at night. They also suffer from the lack of electricity because they conduct a big part of their work through telephone sales. To do so they need to walk a lot in order to charge their cell phones. Also, as a family they would like to have time for recreation and entertainment with the television after the loan hours of working in the field.

For these reasons Rudy has requested a loan from Soluz Honduras to be able to get a solar system. Without a doubt it will provide her and her family with all of the advantages that they now lack.

loans.use: to buy a solar system, which will bring better living conditions to her household and will allow for better communication access.

loans.name: Çiğdem

texts.en:
Çiğdem is single and living with her mother. She is a tailor and also she is selling ready-made clothes. With the help of this loan, she is planning to buy fabrics for making accessories, hats and scarves. She hopes to increase her sales and business.
_______________________________
Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Çiğdem hanım bekar annesi ile beraber yaşıyor. Hazır giyim ve terzilik yapıyor. Aldığı mikro kredi ile kumaş alarak aksesuar, bere ve fular dikerek satışlarını artırmak istiyor. İşini geliştirmeyi hedefliyor

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Zehra

texts.en:
Zehra is single and lives with her parents and brother. She works as a hairdresser and also sells cosmetics and beauty products via a network system. With her first loan she bought cosmetics and beauty products, made good sales and earned money. She is requesting a second loan to buy more cosmetics and beauty products in bulk, make good sales, earn money, and improve her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Zehra hanım bekar annesi, babası ve kardeşi ile beraber yaşıyor. Zehra hanım kuaför olarak çalışıyor ve netwörk ürünlerinde kozmetik ve güzellik ürünleri pazarlaması yapıyor. Kullandığı ilk kredi ile kozmetik ve güzellik malzemeleri alarak ve satarak para kazandı. İkinci kredi ile de kozmetik ve güzellik malzemelerini toptan alarak para kazanmak ve işini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy health and beauty products

loans.name: Maria Orbelina

texts.es: Maria, tiene 27 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio del Progreso, Yoro. Lleva 4 años de tener su propia actividad de negocio para vender camisas, pantalones, trajes de niños, short, sandalias, blusas, faldas etc. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y por encargos. con el fin de seguir trabajando con su negocio y tenerlo surtido ha solicitado un prestamo por 10,000 Lempiras, con el cual va a comprar ropa de niños y de mujer como trajes, blusas, pantalones, vestidos, camisetas y otros. Con las ganancias piensa terminar su casa y que sus hijos terminen de estudiar.
texts.en:
Maria is 27 years old and lives in a common law marriage with her husband. They have two children and live in a small village in the Progreso municipality of Yoro. For 4 years her primary job has been selling shirts, pants, children's suits, shorts, sandals, blouses, skirts, etc. She carries out the sales door-to-door and by order.

In order to keep working with her business and have it well-stocked, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 Lempiras to buy clothing for women and children such as suits, blouses, pants, dresses, t-shirts, and others. With the earnings she plans to finish her house and have her children finish school.

loans.use: to buy clothing for women and children such as suits, blouses, pants, dresses, t-shirts, and others to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a first-year student at Kepler. He grew up in difficult circumstances, moving between Rwanda and Congo as a child. Because of his impressive academic credentials and hard work, he was accepted at Kepler from a field of more than 6,000 applicants this year. Joseph chose to attend Kepler because of its focus on providing the skills he'll need to compete in Rwanda's labor market.

Joseph plans to major in Communications with a concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. His only desire after graduating is to secure a job and to help support children who grew up in situations similar to his own.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Reciel

texts.en:
Reciel, 43 years old, is a fish vendor while her husband, Noli, is a fisherman from Barotac Viejo, Iloilo. They both work diligently to support their five children who are studying in college and high school. It’s not easy to raise five children especially in their case with irregular income. The rainy season gives them difficulty to earn enough for their family. It’s dangerous for her husband to go fishing because their boat is small. Only big fishing boats can endure those not-so-heavy rains in the midst of the sea. The scarcity of fish makes its price higher and fish vendors like Reciel can hardly afford it.

This is the reason why she wants to avail of additional capital worth PhP 50,000 to augment her buying power for volume and different varieties of fish. It can keep her business running even during rainy days. Her income from this will continuously sustain their daily needs and children’s education. Eventually her goal is to make her business prosper, acquire sturdy fishing boats and nets, complete her children’s education, and enjoy a better living condition someday.

Reciel is a dutiful member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy volume and different varieties of fish

loans.name: Mayra Gladys

texts.es: Mayra cuenta con 20 años de edad y vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su padre, al que apoya con todos sus gastos ya que el por su avanzada edad ya no puede trabajar. Mayra presta sus servicios en un comedor desde hace 3 años y es gracias a ello que logra llevar el sustento a su hogar. Mayra desea encementar el corredor de su vivienda, y para ello ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso de su vivienda y evitar las enfermedades respiratorias en los miembros de su familia, ya que el piso de esta es de tierra.
texts.en:
Mayra is 20 years old and lives with her father in a house that she owns. She supports him with all his expenses, since he can no longer work because of his advanced age. Maria has been working in a dining room for three years, and it is thanks to this that she manages to bring sustenance to her household.

Mayra wants to cement the veranda of her home, and to do this she has decided to apply to FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, and gravel in order to cement the floor of her home and avoid respiratory illnesses in members of her family, since the floor is made of dirt.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, and gravel to cement the floor of her home and avoid respiratory illnesses

loans.name: Nebahat

texts.en:
Nebahat is married and a mother of four. She has been selling Tupperware for three years. She lives in a village and is raising livestock. She makes dairy products. At first she was a Tupperware user but she started selling because of her neighbours' demands for it.

She gets up early in the morning, milks the cows and feeds them, then she returns to her daily work and supplies the Tupperware orders. She attends Tupperware meetings once a week. She enjoys working and became a role model for her brides. She encourages them to sell Tupperware.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Nebahat Hanım evli dört çocuk annesi. Nebahat Hanım üç yıldır Tuppurware satışı yapıyor. Köyde yaşıyor ve aynı zamanda hayvancılık yapıyor. Süt ve süt ürünleri yapıp satıyor. İlk olarak Tuppurware kullanıcısı olarak başlıyor. Daha sonra çevresi de isteyince satmaya başlıyor. Sabah erken kalkıp ineklerine bakıp sütünü sağdıktan sonra günlük işlerine dönüyor ve tuppurware siparişlerini satmaya başlıyor. Haftanın bir günü de tuppurware toplantılarına katılıyor. Çalışmayı çok sevdiğini söylüyor. Gelinlerine de örnek olmuş. Tuppurware satmaya teşvik etmiş.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell through her Tupperware business

loans.name: Obra Group

texts.en:
Obra is a group made up of six members and is led by Sampson (who is standing third from the left in the photo). People in this group sell bread, millet, beans, plantains, groceries, foodstuff and clothing. Sampson is a 31-year-old man who is married to a 24-year-old trader. They are blessed with two children: Borketey age two and Bortia age one.

For the last three years, Sampson has run a bakery to support his family. His wife is helping sell the bread that he bakes, so this business has become the family's main source of income. Sampson wants to expand the business but cannot get a bank loan because he does not have any collateral. Therefore, with his friends in the Obra Group, they have submitted a loan application to ID-Ghana for GHS 4,900.

Sampson will spend his share of the loan to buy flour, margarine, eggs, sugar and other items he needs to bake bread to sell to his customers. The members will also spend their loans to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy flour, margarine, eggs, sugar and other items to bake bread to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en: Ny’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Ny makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Phy's Group

texts.en: Phy’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Phy makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor and construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Amelia Sandra

texts.es: Amelia tiene 40 años, es una madre soltera que trabaja muy arduamente para sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos que aun están estudiando. Ella se dedica a trabajos múltiples, como peonaje agrícola y cultivo de palta orgánica; así pues, ahora busca incursionar en la crianza de ganado porcino orgánico, con lo que espera incrementar sus ingresos económicos. En el futuro espera poder darles a sus hijos estabilidad económica y las necesidades básicas que necesitan, su mayor anhelo es que dentro de unos años pueda ver a sus hijos como unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Amelia is 40 years old. She is a single mother who works very hard to raise her three children, who are still in school. She does several kinds of work, such as agricultural labor and raising organic avocados. Now she is looking into beginning to raise organic pork, with which she hopes to increase her economic income.

In the future, she hopes to give her children economic stability and the basic necessities that they need. Her greatest desire is that in a few years she can see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy four organic pigs

loans.name: Shahnozai

texts.ru: Шахнозаи молодая девушка из не большого городка Исфара. Она замужем и имеет 1 ребенка. Муж работает строителем. Шахнозаи дома занимается шитьем и продажей штор и занавесок. Для этого она просит кредит. Шахнозаи намерена на заемные деньги купить ткани и материалы, сшить занавеси и шторы после продать их. Шахнозаи возлагает надежды на кредит и надеется, что ей помогут.
texts.en:
Shahnozai is a young woman from the small city of Isfar. She is married and has one baby. Her husband works as a builder. Shahnozai works at home by sewing and selling curtains and drapes.

Shahnozai has requested a loan for her work. She intends to buy fabric and sewing supplies with the money she borrows, sew curtains and drapes, and then sell them. Shahnozai is placing her hopes in a loan, and hopes that she will find help.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 29-year-old married mother of three children. Four years ago, she opened a grocery shop to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She has a good reputation among her region and has her loyal customers.

In order to develop her business, today she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car which will facilitate her business and life, she will become able to transport goods in a easy way.
Fatima hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and stay capable of providing her children with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a car which will facilitate her business and life

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.en:
Zarrina was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1997. She is single and lives with parents. This year she graduated high school with excellence and wants to enter to university. She applied to university and passed the exams. She is goal-oriented, clever and honest person.

She wishes to have profession in the Customs Department of her country. She appealed to IMON asking a loan to pay her education costs at university. She awaits Kiva lenders kindness and support.

loans.use: to pay her education costs at university, in order to make a career in the Customs Department.

loans.name: Enrico

texts.en:
Selling of charcoal is very common in the provinces of Iloilo and Negros because it is used in grilling “chicken inasal” or barbeque chicken which is one of the icon products of these provinces due to its savory taste and aroma. It is also used in household cooking as alternative to LPG and electric stove.

Enrico buys sacks of charcoal and retails it per kilo. At times, he himself does the charcoal making to earn higher profit. He’s been in this business for almost twenty years and it really provides for his family’s needs. His wife, Corazon, is a laborer who supplements his income. Their children are no longer dependent on them so they can focus their attention to improving the business.

Enrico aspires to increase his income to buy simple pleasures like television, electric fan and other household appliances. For a long time, his income was utilized for his children’s needs and education. You might be a blessing to him through PhP 10,000 loan that he will use to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. He dreams of a more comfortable life in the near future. 

Enrico meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla is a 48-year-old mother of five dependent children and four of them are in school, living in Kampong Speu province. Nowadays, she grows rice since she was 18 years old and she works as a construction worker to earn additional income to support her family. Her crop has grown not well because of drought and insect, which causes her to earn a very low income. Phalla has been with VisionFund for six loan cycles already and fully repaid her past loans. Those previous loan help her to have a better living condition.

Due to having not enough capital to support her children’s studying, she is now applying for this new Kiva loan in order to pay for her children’s school fees. She hopes that this loan will help her children to be high educated and get a good job after they graduate.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s school fee so that her children will enable to continue their studying and get good job in the future.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Arlene works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store and selling pre-paid mobile load. Arlene is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like milk, sugar, canned goods, meat, eggs, vegetables, etc. for her restaurant business.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients  like milk, sugar, canned goods, meat, eggs, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Sevgi

texts.en:
Sevgi is married and has a child. Her husband works at a factory. Sevgi paints wooden mirror frames, coffee tables, and decorative handicrafts.

With the help of the loan, she is planning to buy raw wooden items to paint and more wood paints in order to improve her business. She wants to make a contribution to the family and country budget.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Sevgi hanım evli bir çocuk annesi. Eşi fabrikada çalışıyor. Sevgi hanım ahşaptan ayna çerçevesi, sehpa ve dekoratif duvar süsleri yapıyor. Aldığı mikro kredi ile ahşap ve ahşap boyasını toplu alarak üretip satarak para kazanmak ve işlerini geliştirmek istiyor. Aile ekonomisine ve ülke ekonomisine katkı sağlamak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy raw wooden items to paint and more wood paints

loans.name: Palmira

texts.en:
Palmira is applying for a loan of $ 1000.00. She is married and she has a kiosk where her husband will very support her to run her business. She said, if we want to open a business with our own money, then our efforts will not run properly, because we can't know to count the money coming in and money going out.

So she has the idea to taking a loan from the Tuba Rai Metin. She is taking this loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk including soaps, noodles, biscuits, cooking oils, candies, detergents, shampoo, including soft drinks and other things to sell. She started her business in 2011 with a working capital of $ 50.00. She hopes to open a big store in the future.

loans.use: to buy soaps, noodles, biscuits, cooking oils, candies, detergents,  shampoo, including soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Eva Rosa

texts.es: Eva Rosa, se encuentra dedicada a las ventas mediante guías especializadas de productos por catálogos a través de los cuales promueve los artículos de su oferta; inició esta actividad al encontrarse en una situación difícil tras su desvinculación en el restaurante para el que trabajó durante cuatro años. Una amiga la vinculó como consultora de productos de belleza, labor en la que cuenta con seis años promoviendo ventas entre sus conocidos y amigos en diferentes barrios del municipio de Barranquilla.  Sus ventas son estimuladas a través del catálogo que lleva cada quince días hasta los lugares de residencia de sus clientes e inicia su labor a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 3 p.m.  Eva Rosa ha mantenido un excelente comportamiento comercial y desea ampliar la gama de productos que ofrece, para ello está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de una vitrina que surtirá con prendas de vestir; jean, suéteres, calzado y bolsos. Esta inversión promete incrementar las ventas y el número de clientes que actualmente atiende.  Eva Rosa es viuda y madre de tres hijos mayores de edad, su meta familiar es terminar de construir su casa y adecuar un local con visibilidad para la terraza de su casa.
texts.en:
Eva Rosa works in catalogue sales using specialized product guides, through which she promotes the items she offers. She started this activity upon finding herself in a difficult situation after her separation from the restaurant for which she worked for four years. A friend set her up as a consultant for beauty products, work in which she has six years of experience, promoting sales among her acquaintances and friends in different neighborhoods of the city of Barranquilla. Her sales are stimulated through the catalog that she takes every fifteen days to her customers’ places of residence. She works from 8 am to 3 pm.

Eva Rosa has maintained an excellent commercial performance and wishes to expand the range of products she offers. To that end she is applying for her first Kiva loan, through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo (the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation), which she will invest in the purchase of a showcase that she will stock with clothing: jeans, sweaters, shoes and handbags. This investment promises to increase sales and number of customers she currently serves. Eva Rosa is a widow and mother of three adult children. Her family goal is to finish building her house and to set up a visible space on the terrace of her house.

loans.use: buy a showcase that she will stock with clothing: jeans, sweaters, shoes and handbags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new sheep and expand his business.

loans.name: Nigorakhon

texts.ru: Нигорахон живет и работает в славном городе Худжанде, Ей 28 лет. Она замужем и имеет одну прекрасную дочку. На протяжении 8 лет Нигорахон занимается шитьем.  Секреты портновского искусства она приняла от своей матери. За это время она обзавелась постоянной клиентурой. Многие  в округе заказывают только у нее. Из-за плотного графика заказов ее швейная машинка сломалась.  К сожалению, для покупки новой современной швейной машинки у Нигоры не хватило денежных средств. Она обращается к Вам с надеждой, что Вы одобрите ее намерение и поможете с покупкой новой машинки.
texts.en:
Nigorakhon lives and works in the renowned city of Khujand. She is 28 years old. She is married, and has one wonderful daughter. Nigorakhon has been sewing for the last 8 years. She learned the secrets of the tailor's art from her mother. In this amount of time, she has acquired a permanent clientele. Many in the area order only from her.

Because of the constant demand for orders, Nigorakhon's sewing machine has broken. Unfortunately, she doesn't have the funds to buy a new, modern sewing machine. Nigorakhon has applied to you in the hopes that you will approve her plans, and help her to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Claire

texts.en: Claire is 22 years old, married and had a young child. She opened up a store and sell grocery items to the people in her neighborhood. This help add up her spouse income. She is now asking for a loan of P6,000 to buy more goods to sell. She will buy canned goods, breads, biscuits, and soap to sell. This will help improve her sales and profits as well.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, breads, biscuits, and soap to sell

loans.name: Las Brisas Group

texts.es:
REVISADO
En cierta comunidad oaxaqueña World Vision en conjunto con VF México otorgó huertos de doble propósito y estufas ahorradoras de leña para que los lugareños pudieran mejorar su calidad de vida. De dicha comunidad es originario el grupo Las Brisas, cuyo nombre refiere al agradable rocío de agua que precede a toda lluvia.
    Las integrantes son: Isidora quien invierte en medicamentos y regalos; Felipa, comida, refrescos y servicio de molino; Mauricia, tamales, dulces y botanas; Eva, refrescos y tamales; Yolanda, cosméticos y Floriberta, ropa y comida típica. 
   Doña Felipa es una mujer muy trabajadora que ha sabido aprovechar las oportunidades que la vida le ha presentado. Es madre de cinco hijos, de los cuales una hija fue patrocinada por World Vision durante nueve años. Desde hace 20 años se ha dedicado a la venta de refrescos y con las ganancias obtenidas pudo establecer un negocio de antojitos típicos. Al inicio sólo vendía los fines de semana pero debido al éxito generado ahora ofrece sus deliciosos platillos toda la semana. Por otro lado se asoció con un familiar para comprar un molino en donde los habitantes de la localidad acuden a convertir sus granos y semillas en harina. 
   Las actividades de Doña Felipa comienzan a las 5 de la mañana ya que a dicha hora los clientes del molino se dan cita; posteriormente prepara todo lo necesario para atender a los comensales que diariamente comen sus guisados tradicionales dentro de su negocio. “Estoy feliz con mis actividades, por el apoyo de mi familia y los préstamos que me han sido otorgados, gracias a cada una de las personas  que hacen esto posible”, son palabras de Felipa quien con la oportunidad del crédito podrá invertir en carne, maíz, aceite y refrescos para incrementar su productividad. Por otro lado, en un futuro planea adquirir una fonda más amplia además de poder comprar y estableces un molino propio.
*La fotografía muestra a Doña Felipa quien viste blusa color melón y un pantalón pesquero azul.
texts.en:
In a certain Oaxacan community, World Vision in conjunction with VisionFund México, granted dual purpose orchards and firewood-saving stoves so that the villagers could improve their quality of life. Native to this community is the "Las Brisas" group (The Breezes Group), whose name refers to the pleasant mist that precedes every rain.

The group members are: Isidora who sells medicines and gifts; Felipa, who sells food, drinks and runs a service mill; Mauricia, who sells tamales, candy and "antojitos" (Mexican street food - literally: "little cravings"); Eva who sells sodas and tamales; Yolanda, who sells cosmetics; and Floriberta, who sells clothing and customary meals.

Doña Felipa is a hardworking woman who has taken advantage of the opportunities that life has presented her with. She is the mother of five children, of whom one daughter was sponsored through World Vision for nine years. For 20 years she has made a living by selling soft drinks, and with the proceeds she was able to establish a street food ("antojitos") business. At the beginning she only sold on the weekends, but due to the success it generated, now she offers her delicious dishes throughout the week. Meanwhile, she associated with a relative to buy a mill where the locals come to grind their grains and seeds into flour.

Felipa begins her work at 5 AM, because that’s when the mill customers arrive; then she prepares everything necessary to meet the needs of her daily diners, who eat their traditional stews at her business. "I'm happy with my businesses, for the support of my family, and for the loans that have been granted to me. Thanks to each and every one of the people who make this possible," are the words of Felipa, who with the opportunity of this loan will invest in meat, corn, oil and soft drinks to increase her productivity. Additionally, in the future she plans to acquire a larger establishment and to be able to buy and establish a proper mill.

* Doña Felipa is shown in the photograph, wearing the watermelon-colored blouse and blue fishing pants.

loans.use: to buy meat, corn, oil and soft drinks.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is a 55-year-old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is widow with 11 children. Four of these children are still in school aged years, ages 21, 19, 16 and 14 years old. Isabelita works hard to earn a living. She is doing a pig raising business to support the needs of her children. Aside from raising pigs, she is also engaged in selling food snacks.

Thus, she is requesting a loan to buy food ingredients like glutinous rice, coconut milk and sugar. Part of that loan also is to buy piglets and feed. She also wants to repair her piggery. In the future, she wishes to improve her business to increase her livelihood. She also dreams to send all her children to school to finish their degrees.

loans.use: to buy glutinous rice, coconut milk, sugar, piglets, feed and for piggery repair

loans.name: Sophorn's Group

texts.en: Sophorn’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Sophorn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Yorn's Group

texts.en: Yorn’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Yorn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor and construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Denyse

texts.en:
Denyse is a first-year student at Kepler (a non-profit university in Rwanda). Because of her tremendous academic performance and hard work, she was selected from over 6,000 applicants this year. Denyse chose Kepler because of the job-related skills and internships it offers to students.

Denyse plans to major in Health Care Management, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, she hopes to work in the health industry, perhaps being an administrator at a hospital in Rwanda.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in: metal sheeting, beams, doors and windows to provide security for her children and fulfill her dream.

loans.name: Norafel

texts.en:
Norafel is from Manila, Philippines. She has four children and is the wife of Elipidio. Her husband is a vendor, while Norafel is selling different meats for breakfast, lunch and even dinner in the street of Tondo. Norafel loves to cook that made her run this kind of business. She earns for about P15, 000 every month and she’s been doing the business for 10 years now.

She is doing her her best to earn more profit, so that she’ll not just sell meats on one table and uses an umbrella as a protection against rain and sunlight. She also wants to have her own food stall or canteen in the future to give an even better service.

Though a P15, 000 monthly earning is just enough to sustain their monthly needs; Norafel is determined to succeed on her current business and contemplating ways on how to attract more customers. Since she is a dedicated member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) she tried to apply for a loan of P25, 000 so that each day she’ll have supporting capital to buy ingredients for her mini food stall business.

Norafel is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and hear God’s word that was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her mini food stall business.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Every entrepreneur’s goal is to see their business succeed or grow. Liza One of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) partner, who was granted a previous loan amount of P 20, 000 and was able to use the amount for her Sari-sari store business. She’s very grateful since lenders helped her a lot in the business. The money was used to buy additional stocks like bottled drinks, grocery items, school supplies and other products.

Sari-sari store is a Filipino term which means ‘variety’ it is usually found in every barrios, cities, neighborhood or baranggays where items or products are being sold by volume, kilo or by piece.

Liza aims to have a one stop shop where she’ll have all of the items needed by the consumers. She is aware that competitions on this line of business are rampant. That’s why she is still contemplating of ways on how to attract buyers/consumers. Turning her Sari-sari store to a grocery store is one of her goal. Since it is her bread and butter, Liza exerts her effort and hard work for the business since this really helped her sustain her family’s needs and support her children’s education. Added capital will help her business flourish. That’s why Liza decided to apply for another P25, 000 this year to buy additional stocks such as laundry products,drinks, toiletries, canned goods, school supplies and other items.

Liza believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony , share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and hear God’s word that was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Modelyn

texts.en:
Modelyn is engaged in running a variety store which is also known as “Sari-sari store” in the Philippines. The typical sari-sari store has grills and most of the products are hanging up to be more appealing to customers. But for Modelyn, she’s just using one table to put all of her products and an umbrella as a protection against rain and sunlight. She’s able to earn for about P12, 000 each month. While her husband, Sammy is a driver. They’re four in the family and they’re supporting two kids.

Modelyn‘s aim is to have her own variety store where she can offer complete products to customers. With the help of Center for Community Transformation (CCT), Kiva and lenders all around the world, she’s hopeful that it will be possible. She’s a mother who’s aiming well for her children’s future that’s why she’s determined to succeed in the business.

With this, she applies for a loan of P13, 000 to buy additional products for her variety store. She wants to add bottled drinks, snacks and other grocery items.

Despite of being busy managing the business, Modelyn spares time attending CCT group fellowship that consist of 10-15 individuals where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hear testimonies from other CCT partners and able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans

loans.use: To buy additional products for her variety store. She wants to add bottled drinks, snacks and other grocery items.

loans.name: Arriza

texts.en:
Arriza is 43 years old and married. She has seven children, three of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Arriza runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like shampoo, soy sauce, oil, sugar, groceries, etc. to sell.

In the future, Arriza would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like shampoo, soynsauce, oil, sugar, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Eda

texts.en:
Eda is 52 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines.

Eda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Eda has been farming rice for ten years. She also earns additional income from selling rice grains and through direct selling of personal collection products.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Dieudonne

texts.en:
Dieudonne is a first-year student at Kepler. He grew up in difficult family circumstances, having lost his parents in childhood. Due to his tremendous work ethic and academic ability, he was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. He is the first in his family to attend university.

Dieudonne plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, Dieudonne hopes to work in a field at the intersection of business and technology.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Unidos Al Futuro Group

texts.es: Guísela tiene 29 años de edad es soltera con una hija dependiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas. Y a la vez trabaja en una casa hogar. Años atrás se dedicaba al cuidado de su hija. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas golosinas chupetines caramelos chocolates chicles. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Guísela es la segunda persona sentada del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
Guísela is 29 years old, single, and has a small daughter. She makes a living selling snacks and candies. She also works in a home.

Years ago she started working to take care of her daughter. She will use the loan to buy more snacks, lollipops, candies, and chewing gum.

The group is very grateful to Kiva's investors for providing the loan. Guísela is the second person sitting on the left side.

loans.use: to buy more snacks and candies to sell.

loans.name: Elvera

texts.en:
Elvera is a dedicated member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT). She’s blessed that her previous loan of P50, 000 was granted which was an additional capital for the business. Currently, she’s managing a sari-sari store, a Filipino word which means “variety” where it’s somehow similar to a convenience store but it has grills instead of walls or glass where the items are being displayed and products are measured by kilos, piece and volume.

She also owns a junk shop which is considered a “Dirty Business” since it is buying and selling of scrap materials. You’ll get your hands dirty but scrap will turn actually into profit.

Elvera aims to have a one one-stop-shop where she can offer products on demand and complete items. She also dreams of expanding the business. However, most of her customers are her neighbors, that’s why she could not avoid to lend products. To compensate, Elvera decided to apply for another loan of P50, 000 this year to add stocks of items such as: bottled drinks, school supplies and grocery items. Elvera is hopeful that CCT will once again grant her request for her business to have wide variety of choices.

Despite of being busy managing the business, Elvera spares time attending CCT group fellowship that consist of 10-15 individuals where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hear testimonies from other CCT partners and able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages, to resell in her business.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina and her two daughters live in Agarak town in the Meghri region of Armenia. Valentina is engaged in farming. She keeps two cows and two piglets. Currently, those are the only things she has on her farm.

To be able to develop her farm, Valentina wants to purchase three more cows and start dairy production. She has taken a loan from a financial institution before, but because of the family's poor conditions, she wasn't able to pay it back. However, over these years of tireless work, she was able to own her farm, which is profitable enough to cover monthly payments.

Valentina has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have bad credit history behind them and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for three cows

loans.name: Arpine

texts.en:
Arpine lives with her parents in Getashen village of Armavir region. Her parents are laboratory workers and Arpine is a teacher working at a school. Besides their main work, all family members are also running the farm. Their farm includes livestock (a cow, calves, three piglets and hens) and also cultivation of fruit trees (peach, apricot, cherry, plum and grape).

Arpine asks for this loan to purchase farming supplies that she and her parents need for developing their agribusiness. They plan to purchase two calves, fertilizer and organic pesticides for land cultivation.
Arpine has taken a loan from a financial institution before, but because of the family's poor conditions, she wasn't able to pay it back. However, over these years of tireless work, she was able to own her job, which is profitable enough to cover monthly payments of a loan.

Arpine has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have bad credit history behind them and have no access to credit products. Let's help this hard-working family to prove that everybody can overcome life’s difficulties through hard and devoted work.

loans.use: to pay for two calves, fertilizer and organic pesticides for land cultivation

loans.name: Flores Marie

texts.en:
Flores Marie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable farming business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers for her vegetable farming business.

Flores Marie has been in this business for nine years. She earns additional income from selling vegetables.

Flores Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is a resident of Angwete in Lira district and he is 35 yrs old, married with 3 children. He deals in the business of selling spare parts for cars and motorcycles in Lira town and there is high demand for spares parts since there are many people having cars and motor cycles - he is therefore assured of the market and bigger sales.

Jimmy pays for his children's education and the family with the help of the wife. He has applied for a loan UGX2,000,000 million in Ugafode microfinance to boost his business and he is grateful to Ugafode and Kiva funders for their support.

Pictured is Jimmy and the Ugafode Credit officer -standing on the right

loans.use: to stock more parts for motorcycles

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en: Ra’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Ra makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Hern's Group

texts.en: Hern’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Hern makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor and construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Leona

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Leona works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Leona is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional bundles of fishing net for her fishing business.

Leona has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of fishing net.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 61 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, soap, vinegar, sugar, dozens of eggs, groceries, etc..

Liza has been in this business for six years.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, soap, vinegar, sugar, dozens of eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Asli

texts.en:
Aslı is 37 years old and has one child. She bakes cakes and muffins for special days, birthdays and weddings. She also designs and makes jewelry which she started as a hobby. Her jewelry was appreciated a lot so she started to get orders. Aslı made a good portfolio of customers so she started to make organizations for birthdays. This is her fourth loan from MAYA. She wants to open an organization firm.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Aslı Hanım 37 yaşında ve bir çocuk annesi. Doğum günlerine, özel günlere ve düğünlere şeker hamurundan kurabiyeler ve ayrıca takılar yapıyor. Bu işe hobi olarak başlayan Aslı Hanım ürünlerinin beğenilmesiyle sipariş almaya başlamış. Belirli bir müşteri çevresine sahip olan Aslı Hanım doğum günü organizasyonları da yapmaya başladı. MAYA’dan 4’üncü kredisini kullanan Aslı Hanım organizasyon şirketi açmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy bırthday decoration material.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana is 53 years old. She is a married mother who lives very happily with her two sons, ages 20 and 25, who are schooling. Joana is a very hardworking and responsible mother who wants to give a good future to her children.

From the very early hours of the morning, Joana works baking bread to sell to customers door-to-door, work that she does every day. This is how she offers the necessities to her children.

Joana is applying for a loan to be able to buy margarine, sugar, flour, and spices to bake bread to sell to customers door-to-door. Thus, she will be able to improve her income and give a promising future to her children.

loans.use: to buy margarine, sugar, flour, and spices to bake bread to sell to customers door-to-door.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a first-year student at Kepler. He grew up with his sister in a remote village in eastern Rwanda. Due to his impressive academic record and high test scores, he was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year.

Emmanuel chose to attend Kepler because he wants to have the opportunity to pursue an international degree. He plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, Emmanuel hopes to work in a field where he can combine business with the creative arts.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is a first-year student at Kepler (a non-profit university in Rwanda). He grew up on a farm in a rural area of southern Rwanda. Because of his impressive academic credentials, he was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year. Evariste chose to attend Kepler because he wants an internationally competitive degree while staying in Rwanda.

Evariste will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. A hard worker, Evariste hopes to work in business and plans to support children from his hometown to pursue their educations.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en:
Fanny is a first-year student at Kepler. She grew up in Rwanda's capital of Kigali with her mother, a receptionist. The first in her family to attend university, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year due to her tremendous academic performance.

Fanny plans to major in communications with a concentration in business, and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. At school, Fanny hopes to improve her professional and technology skills.

After graduating, she hopes to start her own business or perhaps work for an NGO whose work she admires.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Munirajon

texts.ru: Мунирачон уроженка города Худжанд. Ей 46 лет, она замужем и имеет 2-х детей. Мунирачон энергичная и доброжелательная женщина. Она по специальности журналист. Однако параллельно они с мужем занимаются предпринимательством в сфере косметологии.  Мунирачон очень хорошо знает свою продукцию, и дает каждому клиенту индивидуальные советы по тем или иным вопросам. В данный момент она хочет расширить ассортимент и закупить новые виды косметики. Именно с этой целью она обратилась за кредитом и надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Munirajon is a native of Khujand.  She's 46, married and has two children.  Munirajon is an energetic woman with a pleasant personality.  She's a journalist by trade, but also operates a cosmetics business together with her husband.  She knows her products very well, and gives every client advice individually for whatever questions they have.  At present, she wants to stock up on new kinds of cosmetics and expand her offering.  With this goal in mind, she's requested a loan, and is counting on your support.

loans.use: buy new kinds of cosmetics

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Lydia works hard to support her family.

Lydia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from a general store. Lydia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase buckets of fish and other fishing materials for her fish vending business.

Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase buckets of fish and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Tubiyage Group

texts.fr:
Jacques  fait partie du groupe  Tubiyage et  habite à  Bujumbura. C’est un veuf de  43 ans. Il a 3 enfants âgés de 8 à 13 ans, tous  étudient.

Il fait le commerce du riz, du sucre, du soulier, du savon ,...dans  sa  boutique   depuis  20 ans. 

Il est à son troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz, de sucre, et de souliers  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Jacques is a member of the group Tubiyage and lives in Bujumbura. He is a widower of 43 years old. He has three children ages 8 to 13, all of who are in school.

He has been selling rice, sugar, shoes, and soap in his shop for 20 years.

He is on his third loan with Turame. Withthe KIVA loan he receives, he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of rice, sugar, and shoes to resale for profit.

In the upcoming years, he would like to see his children in school.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of rice, sugar, and shoes for profit resale.

loans.name: Rosa Angela

texts.es: Rosa es una microempresaria que inició su negocio al afrontar una situación familiar difícil, ella estaba en proceso de separación y las circunstancias le exigieron buscar un medio de sustento para su familia.  Un tío que se dedicaba a la venta de pasabocas y jugos naturales, le cedió este negocio y así mantuvo a los clientes antiguos y adquirió nuevos comensales. Alterno a esta actividad promueve productos por intermedio de catalogos especializados entre sus clientes y vecinos del sector.  Todos los días a partir de las 5 a.m. están a disposición de los comensales los deliciosos pasabocas también conocidos en la región caribe como fritos al ser sofreídos en aceite bien caliente; arepas de huevos, papas rellenas, empanadas de queso, carne o pollo, patacones, deditos, así como jugos naturales de todo tipo de frutas preparados en leche o agua. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en materias primas y artículos del catálogo.  Con esta inversión podrá responder a sus pedidos y continuará ofreciéndoles bienestar a sus tres hijos menores de edad. Su meta a futuro es ampliar su negocio y en lo personal desea que sus hijos tengan un mejor porvenir.
texts.en:
Rosa is a small businesswoman who started her business while dealing with a difficult family situation; she was in the process of separation and circumstances demanded that she seek a means to support her family. An uncle who used to sell snacks and raw juices ceded this business to her and she thus kept the old customers and acquired new diners. In addition to this occupation she also promotes products through specialized catalogs among her customers and area residents.

Every day from 5 am available to diners are the delicious snacks also known in the Caribbean region as "fritos", having been fried in hot oil. These include egg arepas; stuffed potatoes; turnovers filled with cheese, meat or chicken; fried plantain slices; cheese sticks; as well as raw juices made from all kinds of fruits prepared with milk or water.

She is currently applying for her first Kiva loan, through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo (the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation), to invest in raw ingredients and catalog items. With this investment, she will be able to fill her orders and she will continue providing for the welfare of her three minor children. Her goal for the future is to expand her business, and on the personal side she wishes for her children to have a better future.

loans.use: invest in raw ingredients and catalog items.

loans.name: Magnolia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Magnolia works hard to support her family.

She has a welding shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from hand tractor services. Magnolia is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like welding rods, iron, etc. for her welding shop business.

Magnolia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like welding rods, iron, etc.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 52 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as shampoo, sugar, soft drinks, noodles, etc.

Marilou has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from buying and selling gasoline.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as shampoo, sugar, soft drinks, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Tunagurane Group

texts.fr:
Bénoît fait partie du groupe  Tunagurane et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 35 ans et est marié à Jeanine, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 2 à 10 ans, dont 2 étudient. 

Il est tailleur et fait le commerce d'habits   depuis  2 ans. 

Il est à son troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait   voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Bénoît is a member of the group Tunagurane and lives in Bujumbura. He is 35 years old and is married to Jeanine, a businesswoman. They have four children together, ages 2 to 10 years old, two of whom are in school.

He is a tailor and has been in the clothing business for 2 years.

He is on his third loan with Turame. With the loan he receives from KIVA, he is going to increase his capital and buy a lot of clothing to resale for a profit.

In the upcoming years, he would like to see his children in school.

loans.use: to increase capital and to buy a lot of cloths to sell for a profit.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell bananas and root crops business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of bananas and root crops to sell for her business.

Melanie has been in this business for nine years. She earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of bananas and root crops to sell.

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange is a first-year student at Kepler in Rwanda. She grew up with her parents and five siblings in Rwanda's capital of Kigali. Solange was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year, and chose Kepler because it offers a diversity of students and programs.

An outstanding student, Solange plans to major in communications with a concentration in business, and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. She hopes to gain the skills needed to open her own technology company one day.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: El Sol De Cupiche Group

texts.es: El grupo “EL SOL DE CUPICHE” está conformada por socios dedicados a prestar servicios y al comercio minorista. Xiomara tiene 21 años de edad es conviviente con 1 hijo educando. Ella hace seis meses inicio su negocio de comida rápida. Y a la vez vende helados gelatina. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de insumos pollo papa aceite. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Xiomara es la segunda del lado derecho.
texts.en: The “EL SOL DE CUPICHE” group consists of members who have business providing services and small commercial vendors. Xiomara is 21 years old, has a partner, and 1 child in school. Six months ago she began her fast food business. She also sells gelatin ice creams. The loan will be used to buy supplies such as chicken, potatoes, and oil. The group is grateful to the KIVA investors for the provided support. Xiomara is the second from the right in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more chicken, oil, and potatoes.

loans.name: Ma. Andrea

texts.en:
Ma. Andrea, aged 49, is from the province of General Trias, Cavite, Philippines. She is happily married to Manuel, who is an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker) due to the lack of job opportunities in a third world country. Ma.
