Andrea thought of putting up a catering and piggery business to help meet the growing needs of her family. She has two children, one in high school and one at the elementary level.

Ma. Andrea has been in the catering business for three years already. She has put her cooking skills to good use and caters to all kinds of party services such as anniversaries, weddings, debuts, birthday parties, children's parties, graduations, and reunions. It does not feel like work for her since she really enjoys cooking and catering. This has made her a well-loved caterer in her community. Aside from her catering business, she also has a backyard piggery to augment their income.

To help her maintain her business, Ma. Andrea is requesting for a 20,000 PHP loan to buy a good food processor needed for her catering business and piglets for her piggery. She thanks God and you in advance for your good heart in supporting her livelihood.

Ma. Andrea dreams of having a small restaurant someday. She prays for good health and to see both of her children become professionals. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. She can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy a food processor needed for her catering business and piglets for her piggery.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a first-year student at Kepler, which is a university in Rwanda. He grew up with his parents on a family farm in eastern Rwanda. He was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. He chose Kepler because he would otherwise be unable to attend university because of cost, despite his tremendous academic record.

A talented learner, Patrick plans to major in communications with a concentration in business, and he will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, Patrick hopes to pursue a career in communications and media.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Neddie

texts.en:
Neddie is 54 years old and married with eight children.

Neddie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to resell.

Neddie has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal business for six years and also earns an income from buying and selling fresh fish.

Neddie aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Lionel

texts.en:
Lionel is a first-year student at Kepler, which is a university in Rwanda. Due to his exceptional academic record and test scores, he was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year.

Lionel chose to attend Kepler because he felt it would best provide the skills he needed for a career in business.

Lionel plans to major in communications with a concentration in business, and he will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university.

After graduating, he hopes to work in the private sector and perhaps start his own business shortly afterward.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Normelita

texts.en:
Normelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell fruits of banana business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of fruits of banana to sell.

Normelita has been in this business for ten years now.

In the future, Normelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of fruits of banana to sell.

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Dédé est femme âgée de 63 ans qui vit à Baguida. Veuve et mère de quatre enfants, Dédé est une marchande de produits alimentaires et  de poissons fumés qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Dédé désire ce crédit pour financer son achat de des paniers de poissons fumés, de tomates fraîches et des sacs de charbon de bois en vue de tirer profit et gagner plus de revenus afin de mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille qu’elle endosse.
texts.en: Dédé is a 63 year-old woman, who lives in Baguida. Widow and mother of four children, Dédé sells food products and smoked fish. She resupplies two times per month at the market and sells them afterwards in her home. Dédé wants this loan to finance her purchase of baskets of smoked fish and fresh tomatoes and sacks of charcoal with the aim of making a profit in order to contribute more to the family expenses that she is shouldering.

loans.use: to buy 30 baskets of fried fish, 2 baskets of fresh tomatoes, and 2 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 61 years old and married with eight children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as shampoo, soap, milk, noodles, canned goods, etc.

Pacita has been in this business for ten years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as shampoo, soap, milk, noodles, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Doña Ana, de 44 años de edad, es madre soltera, reside en un sector que pertenece al Municipio de San Pedro Sula, Cortes, vive junto a 3 de sus 4 hijos.
Ella tiene su propio negocio desde hace un año, con el fin de obtener ingresos para la manutención de sus hijos. Ofrece productos de la canasta básica familiar como refrescos, churros, azúcar, arroz, manteca, café, pan, huevos, condimentos, productos enlatados, verduras y otros. y para surtir ha solicitado un préstamo de 5,000 Lempiras para comprar granos básicos, productos de limpieza, cereales, leche, verduras, churros, refrescos, pan, y otros abarrotes que necesite. El negocio lo tiene en un pequeño local alquilado al lado de una vecina. Cree que el prestamo le ayudará mucho a mejorar su negocio y a obtener mejores ingresos. Su meta es ayudarles a sus hijos en el estudio y hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is 44 years old, a single mother, and lives in the Municipio de San Pedro Sula, Cortes area. She lives with three of her four children. She has had her own business for a year, with the goal of obtaining income to support her children. She offers basic grocery products such as soda pop, pastries, rice, butter, coffee, bread, eggs, condiments, canned goods, vegetables, and others.

In order to stock her business she seeks a loan for 5000 Lempiras to buy basic staple groceries, cleaning products, grains, milk, vegetables, pastries, soft drinks, bread and other items that she needs. The business is operated in a small rented space next to a neighbor. She believes this loan will help improve her business a lot and will result in better income. Her goal is to help her children attend school and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy basic staple groceries, cleaning products, grains, milk, vegetables, pastries, soft drinks, bread and other items to sell.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi is from the village of Koda, Tetritskaro district. He lives with his housekeeper wife, and the only income for the family is from dairy farming. Giorgi and his wife sell milk products at the local market and get a small income that is lower than the living wage.

According to this mentioned situation, Giorgi decided to tackle the financial difficulties and be involved in a serving business. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. Giorgi requested a loan from Credo to start up a new type of business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to credit products being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

With the received credit, Giorgi plans to buy a truck and start working on private orders for motor trucking. He will get the chance to generate significant income and make better living conditions for his family.

Giorgi and his wife rely on the goodwill of Kiva lenders and will highly appreciate support, as their living conditions will greatly improve.

loans.use: to purchase a truck and start working on a motor trucking business.

loans.name: Koffi Ablavi

texts.fr: Mère de deux enfants, Ablavi est une femme veuve âgée de 54 ans habitant à Baguida. Ablavi est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui travaille activement pour gagner sa vie en vue de subvenir à ses besoins. Ablavi s’approvisionne au marché et demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois de petits et grands modèles ; ce qui lui permettra d’avoir plus de recettes et pouvoir faire face aux charges de la famille et préparer la scolarité de ses enfants dès la rentrée prochaine.
texts.en:
Mother of two children, Ablavi is a 54 year-old widow living in Baguida. Ablavi is a retailer of charcoal, who actively works to make a living with the aims of meeting her needs.

Ablavi resupplies at the market and is requesting this loan to order sacks of charcoal, which will allow her to make more sales and to be able to cope with the family's expenses of to make tuition payments for the children's next school year.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of small charcoal chips and 2 sacks of large charcoal chips.

loans.name: Urkupina Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 22 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la panadería tradicional.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente y muy feliz. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ caracterizado por la multiculturalidad de sus pobladores.
Maria es de tez morena, cabello negro largo y baja estatura. Su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español (la tercera de la derecha viste polera fucsia). Su vida la comparte con sus familiares que trabajan viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. La necesidad por mejorar sus ingresos la llevo a liderar la banca de emprendimiento, los negocios de los socios, son; venta de desayunos, venta de comida, elaboración de helados, venta de refrescos, venta de fruta, venta de chinelas, venta de ropa de segunda mano y venta de artículos de limpieza. Su negocio es la panadería tradicional; ella se encarga de hornear masas típicas como; Cuñapé (Pequeño bollo hecho de harina de yuca con queso), Empanada de arroz (Horneado de arroz y queso), Bizcochos de trigo (Bollitos duros de harina de trigo), Arepas (Panqueques de harina de maíz mezclados con queso y fritos), y otros, “necesito invertir en aumentar mi producción para mejorar mis ventas y cumplir mis metas económicas…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es que no cuenta con capital para la compra de un horno industrial para 6 latas. Su sueño es tener un local propio y amplio para brindar comodidad a sus clientes, ella desea realizar la compra de un horno industrial para 6 latas para hornear mayor cantidad de masas tradicionales. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos en la institución en 4 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de un horno industrial para 6 latas para hornear mayor cantidad de masas tradicionales.
texts.en:
Maria is a 22-year-old woman, single, without children, and her business is traditional bread making.

She is enterprising, independent, and very happy. She carries out her business in the 'plan 3000' neighborhood, characterized by the multiculturalism of its residents.

Maria has dark complexion, long black hair, and short stature. Her native language is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish (the third from the right dressed in a fuchsia shirt). She shares her life with her family members who work. They live in their own home built of brick and cement with a metal roof and brick floor that has all basic services. The need to improve her income led her to come to the communal bank. The businesses of the members are: breakfast sales, food sales, ice cream making, refreshment sales, fruit sales, slipper sales, second hand clothing sales, and cleaning supply sales. Her business is traditional bread making. She is in charge of baking typical doughs such as; Cuñapé (a small ball made of flour and yucca with cheese), empanada de arroz (baked with rice and cheese), Bizcochos de trigo (small hard balls of flour and wheat), arepas (flour and corn pancakes mixed with cheese and fried), and others. "I need to invest in expanding my production in order to improve my sales and achieve my economic goals..." she says. The advantage of her business is that the sales are daily. The disadvantage is that she does not have the capital to buy an industrial oven for 6 pans. Her dream is to have her own large shop in order to provide convenience to her customers. She wants to buy an industrial oven for 6 pans in order to bake greater quantities of traditional doughs. This is the third loan sequence in the institution in 4 years that she comes developing this business.

For those reasons, Maria requests a loan to buy an industrial oven for 6 pans to bake greater quantities of traditional doughs.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven for 6 pans to bake greater quantities of traditional doughs.

loans.name: Camino Al Exito Group

texts.es: Mercedes tiene 58 años de edad es casada con hijos independientes. Ella hace muchos años implemento su bodega en su vivienda. En el  cual ofrece productos de primera necesidad abarrotes carnes verduras y frutas. Años atrás se dedicaba a su hogar. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas abarrotes verduras y frutas al por mayor. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Mercedes es la segunda persona sentada del lado derecho.
texts.en: Mercedes is 58 years old. She is married and has children who are independent from her. Many years ago she started a grocery store in her home that offers basic need products such as groceries, meat, vegetables, and fruit. Years back, she dedicated herself to her home. She will invest the loan into buying more groceries such as wholesale vegetables and fruits. The group is grateful to Kiva investors for the credit provided. Mercedes is the second person seated from the right side.

loans.use: to buy groceries, vegetables, and fruits.

loans.name: Ilsy

texts.es: Ilsy es una confeccionista con una amplia experiencia que inició su propia microempresa en el año 1990, ella confecciona todo tipo de prenda de vestir; camisas, pantalones, vestidos, uniformes de colegios, entre otros y sus clientes se han mantenido fieles con el pasar del tiempo, pues brinda un excelente servicio y calidad en sus prendas, las cuales son elaboradas sobre medida y con diseños novedosos. Su taller está ubicado en su vivienda en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla en donde labora doce horas diarias para cumplir con su producción y como su demanda de servicios cada vez es mayor, su taller no cuenta con las herramientas necesarias para atender los requerimientos de sus clientes, Ilsy está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en una maquina plana y así fortalecerá su infraestructura técnica y su capacidad de producción.  Su meta a futuro es ampliar sus confecciones hasta convertirlas en una boutique y darles un mejor futuro a sus dos hijas al comprarles una vivienda.
texts.en: Ilsy is a seamstress with a range of experience who began her own micro-business in 1990.  She makes all kinds of clothing items: shirts, pants, dresses, school uniforms, and other items.  Her clients have been faithful over time because she offers excellent service and quality in her garments.  They are made to measurements and with new designs.  Her shop is located in her home in a neighborhood of the city of Barranquilla, and she works there 12 hours a day in order to complete her orders because her work is in great and increasing demand.  Her shop does not have the necessary tools to meet customer needs.  Ilsy is asking for a Kiva loan, her first loan through Kiva's field partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to invest in a flat bed sewing machine (máquina plana) and in this way strengthen her technique and infrastructure and her production capacity.  Her future goal is to increase her creations so that she can make her shop into a boutique and provide a better future to her two daughters by buying them a home.

loans.use: to invest in a flat bed sewing machine.

loans.name: Sergo

texts.en:
Sergo and his big family live in Berdavan village of the Tavush region. His family consists of his two sons, wife, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren.

All grown-up members of the family are engaged in farming. They keep four cows, calves and hens. They also cultivate wheat and corn, and grow grapes and walnuts.

Sergo takes the gathered harvest to the market to sell. Agriculture is the main source of the family's income, and the family works hard to run it successfully.

Sergo is asking for this loan to purchase a cow and to buy forage to feed his livestock. This is his first loan, and it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. This first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have prior access to loans because they had no credit history.

Sergo and his family hope for the good will of the lenders to support them to gather the needed financial resources to enlarge their farm.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and to buy forage to feed his livestock.

loans.name: Wilson Rene

texts.es:
Wilson, es un joven de 22 años de edad, es casado, vive con su pareja y su hija con edades de 20 y 3 años respectivamente, tiene tres años de tener un negocio de venta de ropa, trabaja de lunes a domingo, lo aprendió de un amigo.
Con el capital comprara chores, calzonetas, camisas, blusas pantalones, etc., asimismo adquirirá un estante para ubicar las prendas de vestir, tendrá un inventario surtido para que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos, espera incrementar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Wilson es tener una situación económica estable para darle a su familia un estilo de vida más digno.
texts.en:
Wilson is a young 22 year-old man who is married and lives with his wife and daughter who are 20 and three years old respectively. He has owned a clothing store for three years and works from Monday to Sunday. He learned this work through a friend.

With the loan he will buy shorts, underwear, shirts, blouses, pants, etc., and he will also buy a shelf that he can use to display clothing items. This will provide a stocked inventory so that his customers will feel satisfied. He hopes to increase his income.

Wilson's dream is to have a stable economic situation in order to give his family a more dignified style of life.

loans.use: to buy shorts, underwear, shirts, blouses, pants, etc., and also to acquire a shelf that will be used to display clothes.

loans.name: Ines

texts.pt:
A Senhora Ines vive com seu esposo, dois filhos, uma nora e uma neta na casa propria. Ela é comerciante faz compra e venda de produtos diversos. Com o presente empréstimo vai aumentar o volume do seu negócio comprando açucar, amendoim, feijão e caldo, e com as receitas do negócio irá  garantir o sustento  da sua familia, uma vez que o seu esposo tem tido dificuldades em angariar fundos pois só depende do seu grande esforço nos pequenos trabalhos que tem feito de serralharia.
Ela tem como sonho abrir uma mercearia no distrito de marracuene e expandir o seu negócio para diversas áreas a nivel do distrito.
texts.en:
Ines owns the house where she lives with her husband, two children, a daughter-in-law, and a granddaughter. She is a businesswoman who buys and sells different products.

With this loan, she will expand her business. She will buy sugar, peanuts, beans, and bouillon cubes. With the profits, she will guarantee her family’s sustenance. Her husband has had problems finding the funds, since his income depends on his hard work on small projects at the metal workshop.

Her dream is to open a store in the Marracuene district, and expand her business to other areas all over the district.

loans.use: to buy sugar, peanuts, beans and bouillon cubes.

loans.name: Adelante Cocachacra Group

texts.es: Nataly tiene 31 años de edad es soltera con dos hijos dependientes. Ella implemento su bodega en su vivienda. Ella ofrece abarrotes bebidas productos lácteos  y productos de limpieza hace 04 años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más abarrotes productos lácteos bebidas y útiles de limpieza. El grupo “ADELANTE COCACHACRA” agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Nataly es la tercera persona sentada del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: Nataly is 31 years old. She is single and has two children who depend on her. She opened her grocery store in her home. For four years she has offered groceries, drinks, dairy products, and cleaning products. She will invest the loan into buying more groceries, dairy products, drinks, and cleaning supplies. The group "ADELANTE COCACHACRA" is grateful to Kiva lenders for the provided loan. Nataly is the third person seated from the left side.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products, dairy products, and cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.pt:
A Senhora Leonor vive na casa propria com sua filha menor de idade. Ela é funcionaria pública, com o presente empréstimo quer adquirir material de construção  nomeadamente ( cimento, ferro, pedra e areia ) para dar continuidade com a obra.
Ela teve como sonho abrir uma farmancia o que ja foi concretizado com credito da Hluvuku Adsema e agora gostaria de abrir uma escola de condução mas possui dificuldades financeiras.
texts.en:
Leonor owns the house where she lives with her underage daughter. She is a public servant.

With this loan, she wants to buy construction materials, such as cement, iron, stones and sand to continue with the construction works.

She dreamt of opening a pharmacy, and she has been realizing her dream with loans from Hluvuku Adsema. She would like to open a driving school, but she faces financial difficulties.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, stones and sand.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
Albertina, utilizo el crédito anterior en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de hamacas y para fortalecer la crianza de cerdos, engordo los animales y los vendió a mejores precios, está satisfecha por tener un negocio más competitivo.
Motivada por los buenos resultados que tiene al utilizar créditos nuevamente hace la solicitud de más capital para comprar cerdos, hilo de seda y nilón para elaborar hamacas, mantendrá su negocio con vida.
texts.en:
Albertina used the previous loan to buy raw materials to make hammocks, and to strengthen her pig-raising business. She fattened her animals and sold them at good price. She feels satisfied with her competitive business.

The good results she has had thanks to the loans she has requested, have motivated her to apply for a new loan. She is requesting more capital to buy pigs, silk threads, and nylon to make hammocks. She will keep her business alive.

loans.use: to buy pigs, silk threads, and nylon to make hammocks.

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es: José es un hombre trabajador de 29 años de edad que se gana la vida con su granja de pollos y su tienda de productos básicos, con lo cual ha logrado sostener la economía de su hogar. José cuenta con vivienda propia en la que vive con su hijo de 2 meses de edad y su compañera de vida, por lo que se siente feliz de contar con su familia. José desea continuar mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertirlo en: granos básicos, lácteos, embutidos, golosinas y bebidas para continuar mejorando su negocio, ya que con el crédito anterior surtió su tienda, por lo que desea continuar haciéndolo.
texts.en:
José is a hardworking 29 year old man who earns a living with a chicken farm and a basic goods shop, which he has used to manage the economy of his house.  Jose has his own property where he lives with his 2 month old son and life partner, and he is happy to have his family.  

Jose wants to continue improving his quality of life, which is why he is requesting a loan with FUSAI to invest in basic grains, milk, cold meats, sweets, and drinks to continue improving his business. He used the previous loan to stock his shop and wants to continue doing so.

loans.use: to invest in basic grains, milk, cold meats, sweets, and drinks to continue improving his business.

loans.name: Yessica Carolina

texts.es: Yessica es una joven emprendedora que a sus 21 años de edad ya cuenta con una pequeña venta de platos típicos, lo que le permite apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de su hogar. Yessica vive en casa de sus padres al lado de ellos y sus hermanos, los cuales se encuentran estudiando, ya que ella desea que se superen y los apoya para ello. Yessica desea continuar mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en los ingredientes para continuar con su venta de platos típicos como: pasteles de carne, enchiladas, pasteles, entre otros.
texts.en: Yessica is a young entrepreneur who, at her 21 years of age, already has a small business of traditional dishes, which allows her to support her parents with the expenses of their home. Yessica lives in her parents' home alongside them and her siblings, who are studying, and she wants them to do well and supports them in that. Yessica wants to continue improving her family's quality of life and for that she requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in ingredients to continue with her sales of traditional dishes such as: meat pies, enchiladas, cakes, among others.

loans.use: to invest in ingredients to continue with her sales of traditional dishes such as: meat pies, enchiladas, cakes, among others.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio es un joven  hombre de 23 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 6 años y una hija de 2 años, y su negocio es la producción de estuco. 
El es buen padre, emprendedor e independiente. Su trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad ‘Vichaya’ que cuenta con diferentes minerales para ser explotados, los pobladores no cuentan con los recursos necesarios para aprovechar el mineral.
Rogelio es moreno, de cabello negro corto y físico delgado, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español. Vive con su pareja que trabaja en el mismo negocio y con sus hijos que ya empiezan a estudiar, en una casa construida de adobe con techo de calamina y piso de tierra sin servicios básicos. Su negocio es la producción de estuco, para venderlo por mayor a ferreterías y tiendas de material de construcción, “aprendí el oficio de mi padre que también es productor de estuco…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que trabaja junto a su pareja la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de motor para el molino de estuco. Su sueño es construir su casa, el desea realizar la compra de un motor para el molino de estuco. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rogelio solicita un préstamo para la compra de un motor para el molino de estuco.
texts.en:
Rogelio is a 23 year old young man who lives with his partner. He has a 6 year old son and a 2 year old daughter. His business is the production of stucco. He is a good father, enterprising and independent. His business is in the community of Vichaya, which has different minerals that could be mined, but the inhabitants lack the necessary resources to take advantage of them.

Rogelio is dark skinned, with short, black hair and a thin build. His native tongue is Aymará, but he also speaks Spanish. He lives with his partner, who works in the business with him, and his children, who are now starting school. They live in a house made of adobe, with a galvanized metal roof, dirt floor, and no basic services.

His business is the production of stucco, which he sells wholesale to hardware stores and construction material businesses. "I learned the business from my father, who is also a producer of stucco," he says. The advantage of the business is that he works together with his partner. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy a motor for his stucco mill.

His dream is to build his house and buy a motor for his stucco mill. This is his first round of loans with the institution in the 2 years he has worked in this business. For these reasons, Rogelio seeks a loan to buy a motor for his stucco mill.

loans.use: to buy a motor for a stucco mill.

loans.name: Yorleny

texts.es: Yorleny necesita un préstamo de un millón de colones (₡ 1 000 000) para la compra de materiales de construcción, necesarios para realizar reparaciones en su vivienda. Por medio de este préstamo ella podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Yorleny needs a loan of one million colones (₡ 1 000 000) to buy construction materials that are necessary to carry out repairs in her home. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose continúa con su negocio de artesanía en aluminio. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la construcción de un cuarto para usarlo como taller. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual. Actualmente su producción continua estable, en su nuevo taller puede trabajar perfectamente, “mi pequeño taller trabaja las 24 horas…” comenta. la ventaja de su negocio es que es el único productor en 2 ciudades, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de nuevas herramientas para fabricar nuevos productos. Su sueño es comprarse un auto para distribuir sus productos, él desea realizar la compra de nuevas herramientas para fabricar artesanía en aluminio. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Jose solicita un préstamo para la compra de nuevas herramientas para fabricar artesanía en aluminio.
texts.en:
Jose continues with his business of aluminum handicrafts. The loan he obtained previously he used for the construction of a room to be used as a workshop. He made his payments on time. His production is currently stable. In his new workshop he can work perfectly. "My little workshop is busy 24 hours a day," he says.

The advantage of his business is that he is the only such producer in 2 cities. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy new tools to make new products. His dream is to buy a car to distribute his products. He also wants to buy new tools to make aluminum handicrafts.

This is the third cycle of loans with the institution in the 4 years he's been in this business. For these reasons, Jose seeks a loan to buy new tools to make new aluminum handicrafts.

loans.use: to buy new tools to make aluminum handicrafts.

loans.name: San Sebastian - Huancan Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “San Sebastian - Huancan” y está formado por 06 integrantes responsables y emprendedores. Deysi de 29 años de edad es conviviente con 01 hijo menor de edad. Deysi se dedica a la Agricultura y a los Bordados artesanales. Hace más de 05 años que se dedica a la agricultura, gracias a su constante dedicación puede darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de fertilizantes para su siembra. El deseo de Deysi es contar con un terreno mas amplio para seguir sembrando en cantidad. El grupo “San Sebastian - Huancan” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por darles la oportunidad de conseguir sus metas. Deysi es la que esta con una chompa ploma con raya fucsia agarrando su bordado artesanal.
texts.en:
This is the “San Sebastian – Huancan group,” comprised of six responsible and enterprising members. Deysi, 29, is married and has an underage child. Deysi works in agriculture and makes handmade weaves. She has been working in agriculture for more than five years. Thanks to her hard work, she is able to improve her family’s quality of life.

She requested a loan to buy fertilizers to grow food. She wishes to have a larger plot in order to grow more food. The members of the “San Sebastian – Huancan” group want to thank Kiva lenders for giving them the opportunity to achieve their goals.

Deysi is wearing a dark sweater with a pink stripe. She is holding one of the weaves she makes.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow food.

loans.name: Yovanna

texts.en:
The member Yovanna belongs to the communal bank "Los Diamantes."

Yovanna continues to work at her business of selling handicrafts. She feels grateful for the loan and she commits to making her loan payments on schedule. She continues selling silver jewelry such as earrings, bracelets, and necklaces among other items for her customers that request them. She is a responsible person and it is in this manner that she supports her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy rings and bracelets among other items.

loans.use: to buy rings and bracelets among other items

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María solicita un nuevo crédito para seguir trabajando en el campo y sostener a su familia, comprara abono, insecticidas, plaguicidas y además pagara la preparación del terreno en el que sembrara granos básicos, el resto le será de ayuda para invertirlo en alimento para cerdos.
La facilidad de recursos que le dio el crédito anterior le ayudo a fortalecer su negocio, en ocasiones tiene pequeñas dificultades para cancelar su cuota más sin embargo ha podido salir adelante.
texts.en:
María requests a new loan to continue working in the field and supporting her family. She will buy fertilizer, insecticides, pest-control substances, and also pay for the preparation of the land on which she will plant basic grains. The rest will help her to invest in feed for pigs.

The gift of resources that the previous loan gave her helped her to strengthen her business. On occasion she has small difficulties in paying off her fees, however she has been able to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides, pest-control substances, and also pay for the preparation of the land on which she will plant basic grains.

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Mario tiene 43 años de edad es padre de 1 hijo y vive con su esposa en casa propia,  su actividad principal es el destazo de cerdos y compra de queso y cuenta con más de 10 años de dedicarse a esta actividad obteniendo muy buenos ingresos.
Don Mario  necesita el préstamo para la compra de cerdos para criarlos y poder seguir con su negocio y espera que con esta inversión que realice se le haga realidad el sueño de tener una buena demanda de sus clientes.
Don Mario está contento porque podrá satisfacer con emoción y alegría a sus clientes  y asi obtener unos muy buenos resultados de su trabajo, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros que es uno de sus mayores sueños.

Trojes, Honduras - Julio del 2015
texts.en:
Mario is 43 years old and is the father of one son. He lives with his wife in their own house. His main activity is butchering pigs and buying cheese. He has been working in this business for more than ten years and obtains good income from it.

Mario needs the loan to buy pigs to raise and be able to continue with his business. He hopes that this investment he is making will make his dream come true of having good demand from his clients.

Mario is happy as he can with emotion and joy satisfy his clients and doing so obtain good results from his labor. This would allow him to increase his income to cover family expenses and his financial obligations, which is one of his biggest dreams.

Trojes, Honduras - July 2015

loans.use: to buy pigs for his business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
If you’ll go in the Philippines maybe you’ll hear one unusual business type it’s called Sari-sari store. It’s a small type of convenience store and a tagalog word which means “variety”. Items here are bought by wholesale however they’re selling the products by piece, per kilo or by volume. The store has grills or screen for protection against theft. Foods that are ready to eat such as biscuits, Breads, junk foods and such are hanging on the grills to attract customers. You can even buy one candy for P1.00 that’s how cheap products are in a Sari-sari store. It can be found anywhere in the country. In Barrios, Barangays, Municipalities and Cities.

Though competition is drastic on this line of business, Aida is a Center for Community Transformation (CCT) partner and managing his own Sari-sari store. The daily profit is just enough for their day-to-day expenditures. Dedication and perseverance are the qualities that she has that’s why the business is still growing. Moreover, she is grateful that CCT granted his previous loan of P10, 000 The amount was used to buy additional items for the business. This year, Aida applied for another loan of P12, 000 since she wants to have products on stock such as bottled drinks and grocery items to add on his Sari-sari store business.

Aida regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.es:
Carlos, ve que el haber invertido el crédito anterior en el mantenimiento de su vehículo le está dando buenos beneficios, como nuevos clientes, mejores ingresos y disminución de deudas.
Para mantener su fuente de ingresos con vida hace la solicitud de un nuevo crédito para comprar una caja de transmisión y discos para reparar su vehículo y seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carlos sees that investing his prior loan in maintenance for his vehicle has provided him good benefits, such as new customers, increased income, and decreased debt.

To keep his source of income alive, he seeks a new loan to buy a gearbox and brake discs to repair his vehicle and continue providing good service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy a gearbox and brake discs to repair his vehicle and continue providing good service to his customers.

loans.name: Suth's Group

texts.en: Suth’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Suth makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Roslainie

texts.en:
Roslainie is very thankful to Kiva for the loan granted to her in the amount of PhP 25,000 which she used to buy 3 sacks of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 2 boxes of canned goods and 2 pieces of a desktop computer set. Her income increased and was able to pay the loan on time. Roslainie piso net(customized computer rental) is also doing well as it gains a steady net income of PhP 150 daily.

Just recently one of Roslainie's child has been ill. The revenue of her income helps Roslainie to pay the medicine and the doctor.

Roslainie is now requesting a re-loan in the amount of PhP 30,000 to buy more stocks sacks of rice, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and other items for her grocery store (sari-sari store) and another set of desktop computer for her computer rentals.

The loan will enable her to increase her income more to provide for her family. Roslainie is still working hard and determined to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks sacks of rice, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and other items for her grocery store and another set of desktop computer for her computer rentals.

loans.name: Buntheoun's Group

texts.en: Buntheoun’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia.  Buntheoun makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en: Sopheap’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Sopheap makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Rodiah

texts.en:
Rodiah is 60 years old, married and lives with her husband and her two sons. Rodiah is a florist, she sells flowers for funerals for 20 years. She and her husband pull together to increase their family income.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 7.500.000 rupiah. This loan will be used to buy and build a toilet at their home to improve access water and sanitation for their family. She want to have access to safe sanitation and water source for families. As her family income is still not enough to build a toilet and water source by cash, they are able to repay loans received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to buy and build a toilet at their home to improve access water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Muhammadjon

texts.en:
Muhammadjon is a careful brother. He was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1994. He is single and lives in friendly family. He is hardworking, gentle and honest person. He started to work and earns money very early for his age. That’s he helps his family and parents with finances.

He is willing to educate her sister at university in order she has a higher education degree and knowledge. He hopes Kiva lenders will support him and he can help to pay his sister’s tuition fee for her studies.

loans.use: to pay his sister’s higher education costs of university.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT). She considers CCT as God’s extension of blessing since the loan amount of P10, 000 that she applied before was granted. She is very grateful that there are lenders who are willing to help new entrepreneurs on the business. The amount helped her buy additional products for her sari-sari store business. Sari-sari store is a Filipino word which means “variety” where customers can select wide variety of choices for a cheaper price compare to supermarkets and other convenience store. Aside from managing a variety store business she also sell different foods for breakfast.

Sofia aims to step up every year in the business, on the past six months she considers the business growing with God as her greatest provider. This year she wants to expand her variety store business by adding additional products and stocks so that customers will have variety of choices. She wants the variety store to become a one-stop-shop to customers. With this, Sofia applied for another loan of P15, 000 to buy stocks of grocery items, sacks of rice, eggs and school supplies. 

Sofia regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Deniz

texts.en:
Deniz is single and living with her mother. She is working as an optician just like her father did. She owns an optician store. With the help of her first loan, she bought bulks of lenses, used them on the eyeglasses, made sales and gained money. With the help of her second loan she is planning to buy bulks of lenses and frames, sell them, make money and expand her business.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Deniz hanım bekar annesi ile beraber yaşıyor. Baba mesleği olan gözlükçü işi ile uğraşıyor, dükkanı var. Kullandığı ilk mikro kredi ile dükkana toptan gözlük camı aldı ve gözlüklerde kullanarak satarak para kazandı. İkinci kullandığı mikro kredi ile de toptan gözlük camı ve çerçevesi alarak satış yaparak işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy eyeglass lenses frames

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce wishes to thank Kiva and their lenders for the previous loan. She used the loan to buy certified seeds and added grocery stock which increased her income. She was able to cater for her family's needs by providing better food.

She is borrowing additional Kiva loan to buy more certified seeds and also increase stock to her grocery store. This will further boost her businesses and therefore have a stable income to continue supporting her family needs.

Joyce is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the continued financial support.

loans.use: to buy seeds that will boost crop yield and also pay for more stock of vegetables, such as tomatoes, onions and kale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a Solar Electric Solution for her business and wants to increase her income.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 33 years old, married and a mother of two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from the trainings especially enterprise development.

She practices vegetables farming. She is taking a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and quality seeds to increase vegetables production for increased income. This will enable her to meet family expenses such as food and clothing.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and quality seeds to increase vegetables production and earn more income to pay family expenses e.g. food and clothing.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 43 years old, married and blessed with three children who are all attending school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 so as to benefit from training especially enterprise development. 

She practices vegetable and dairy farming. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and certified seeds to increase vegetables production.  This will enable her meet customers demands.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and certified seeds to increase vegetables production hence meet customers demands.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a first-year student at Kepler. He grew up under difficult circumstances, moving between Rwanda and Uganda. After a rigorous application process based on grades, test scores, and personal interviews, he was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. The first in his family to attend university, Kenneth chose Kepler because of its focus on practical job skills. 

Kenneth plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, he hopes to work in business, possibly starting his own company one day.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Gerardo Oswaldo

texts.es:
Gerardo, requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar pastillas para frenos, llantas traseras y delanteras, le permitirá tener la unidad de transporte en óptimas condiciones para dar un buen servicio a sus clientes.
Con el apoyo de créditos su negocio se mantiene y le genera más utilidades, su grupo familiar ha crecido y hasta la fecha no ha tenido dificultades que le impidan realizar sus actividades con normalidad.
texts.en:
Gerardo needs a new loan to buy brake pads and rear and front wheels. This will allow him to keep his vehicle in optimal conditions and give his customers a good service.

With the support of the loans the business is able to continue functioning and generate more profits. His family has grown and so far he hasn’t had any problems performing his regular activities.

loans.use: to buy brake pads and rear and front wheels.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Lideres De La Esperanza Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Lideres de la Esperanza” y está formado por 08 integrantes responsables. Guillermina de 26 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos menores de edad. Guillermina se dedica a la Agricultura. Desde muy pequeña se dedica  a la agricultura junto a sus padres, gracias a su constante dedicación puede darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para su siembra. El deseo de Guillermina es tener un puesto en el mercado para así vender sus productos de la siembra. El grupo “Lideres de la Esperanza” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por darles la oportunidad de conseguir sus metas. Guillermina es la que esta al medio del grupo con una chompa rosada y pantalón azul oscuro.
texts.en:
This is the group "Leaders of Hope" and it is made up of 8 responsible members. Guillermina is 26 years old, lives with her partner and has 2 young children. Guillermina works in agriculture. Since she was small, she has worked at farming along with her parents, and thanks to her constant dedication, she can give a better quality of life to her family. She is requesting this loan to purchase compost and fertilizers for her crops. Guillermina's wish is to have a stall in the market to be able to sell her crops.

The "Leaders of Hope" group thanks the Kiva investors for giving them the opportunity to achieve their goals. Guillermina is the woman in the middle of the group with the pink shirt and dark blue pants.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es:
Roberto comparte su vida con su esposa e hijos, tiene cinco años de dedicarse a la compra y venta de semilla de marañón, su negocio ya es bastante popular en la zona, de esta manera puede ir generando los recursos económicos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
Utilizará el rédito para comprar semilla de marañón al por mayor para atender los pedidos de sus clientes, la finalidad de la inversión es que su negocio sea más competitivo, atraer nuevos clientes y estabilizarse económicamente.
Sus sueños son mantener su negocio creciendo, ser responsable con sus compromisos y disminuir las necesidades básicas de su familia.
texts.en:
Roberto shares his life with his wife and children. For five years he has worked buying and selling cashew nuts. His business is already quite popular in the zone. In this way, he can go on generating the economic resources to cover the needs of his family.

He will use the loan to buy cashew nuts wholesale to fill the orders of his customers. The goal of the investment is to have his business be more competitive, attract new customers, and stabilize himself economically.

His dreams are to keep his business growing, be responsible in his commitments, and reduce the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy cashews wholesale to meet the orders of his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in pigs, grain, and vitamins to raise them and improve her earnings.

loans.name: Odilia Rosbinda

texts.es:
La señora Odilia tiene 55 años de edad y vive en una comunidad de Trojes, al Oriente de Honduras,  vive con su esposo y su hija. Su actividad principal es el comercio, cuenta con una pequeña pulperia en donde desde tempranas horas del dia brinda los productos de la canasta basica a las persona de la comunidad asi como a las personas que vicitan la aldea.
Doña Odilia necesita el prestamo para la compra de azucar, arroz, manteca, harina, Jabon, avena, huevos, queso, etc. y poder surtir más su negocio y asi cumplir con la demanda de productos de sus clientes espera que esta inverision le genere los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante con su familia.
Uno su sueño es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia.


Trojes, Honduras - Julio 2015.
texts.en:
Mrs. Odilia is 55 years old and lives in a community of Trojes, east of Honduras, along with her husband and daughter. Her main activity is commerce.

She has a small grocery store where early in the morning she offers products of the basic basket to the people of her community and visitors of the village.

Odilia needs the loan to buy sugar, rice, butter, flour, soap, oats, eggs and cheese among other products in order to supply her business and fulfill her client’s needs.

She hopes that with this investment she’ll be able to generate enough incomes to get her family ahead. One of her dreams is to improve hers and her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, butter, flour, soap, oats, eggs, cheese and other products for her business.

loans.name: Melike

texts.en:
Melike is a young and enthusiastic entrepreneur of age 22.  She has been selling Oriflame beauty products for two years and using the money for her education.  She first started this for her own use but later on she started selling the products to her neighbours.  With the help of the third loan from Maya she bought bulks of products and increased her bonus, her gains and her capital.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Melike hanım 22 yaşında genç ve çalışkan bir girişimci.  2 yıldır oriflame güzellik ürünleri satarak okul ihtiyaçlarını karşılıyor.  Melike hanım önce kendi kozmetik ihtiyaçlarını karşılamak için üye oluyor.  Daha sonra ürünleri çevresine  satmaya başlamış  Maya’dan 3. kredisini kullanan Melike Hanım kredileri ile toptan ürün alarak primini, kazancını ve sermayesini artırdı.

loans.use: to buy Oriflame beauty products for resale

loans.name: Anavic

texts.en: Anavic is engaged in selling sea foods like crab and assorted fish. Aside from this, Anavic and her husband also engaged in fishing business to earn a living. They have been doing this for 15 years. She is 38 years old woman and a mother of two children ages 15 and 13 years old. She dreams in the future to uplift their earnings to have enough money to send all her children to school so they could earn a degree. As for now, Anavic is requesting a loan to buy sea foods to sell like squid, sea cucumber, crab and more fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy squid, sea cucumber, crab and more fish to sell

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene is a first-year student at Kepler. He grew up with his mother and five siblings on farm in rural Rwanda. After a rigorous application process based on grades, test scores, and personal interviews, he was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. The first in his family to attend university, Eugene chose Kepler because of it offered a challenging curriculum and international degree.

Eugene  plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, he hopes to work in journalism, while also working to support children from poor families through school.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the trainings especially enterprise and financial management. 

She practices mixed farming i.e. vegetable and poutry farming.  She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy chicken hence expand farming for increased income.  She hopes that this will enable her provide better food, clothing and school fees. 
Mary is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.  She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy chicken hence expand farming for increased income to pay for family expenses e..g food, clothing and school fees.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is 54 years old and has eleven children. Guillerma is married and has one child who is still in school.

Guillerma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Guillerma requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Guillerma has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Guillerma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Dina Aracely

texts.es:
Dina vive con su familia integrada por su esposo y tres hijos, es propietaria de una granja de gallinas y además comercializa huevos, trabaja de forma independiente desde hace dos años, cuenta con mucha experiencia, su horario de trabajo es de cinco de la mañana a siete de la noche.
Para aumentar la productividad de su negocio, solicita un crédito con el que comprara concentrado para los pollos para que estén robustos y sea más fácil incrementar las ventas así como también aumentara la cantidad de huevos para cubrir demandas de otros clientes.
Los sueños que Dina tiene son ampliar su negocio y darles a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar en la universidad.
texts.en:
Dina lives with her family, made up of her husband and three children. She is the owner of a chicken farm and also sells eggs. For the past two years, she has worked independently. She has a lot of experience. Her work schedule is from 5am to 7pm.

To increase her business' productivity, she is requesting a loan with which she will buy feed for the chickens, so that they will be stronger and it will be easier to increase sales. It will also increase the number of eggs, to fulfill the demands of other customers.

Dina's dreams are to grow her business and to give her children the opportunity to go to college.

loans.use: to buy feed for the chickens, so that they are strong and it will be easier to increase sales

loans.name: Josue

texts.es: Josué, tiene 32 años de edad, está soltero y reside en una aldea del municipio de Quimistán, Santa Barbara junto a un hermano. El trabajó por varios años en una empresa de textil y al quedar sin empleo decidió poner su propio negocio de pulpería el cual lleva más de 5 años de funcionar. Vende productos de alimentación básica como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, verduras, refrescos, churros, pan, condimentos, productos de limpieza etc, y además vende cosméticos. El negocio lo tiene en su casa y también sale a repartir cosméticos cuando tiene pedidos. El prestamo que solicita es el séptimo ciclo con ODEF y es por 18,000 Lempiras con el cual piensa invertir el préstamo en compra de carnes, verduras, refrescos, arroz, azúcar, productos de limpieza, pan, y otros abarrotes para incrementar sus ventas. Considera que el préstamo es una buena opción para trabajar mejor. Su meta es crecer con el negocio, ser mejor persona y tener una bodega distribuidora.
texts.en:
Josué is 32 years old. He is single and lives with his brother in a small village in the township of Quimistán, Santa Barbara. He worked for a number of years in a textile business, and on being left without employment, he decided to set up his own grocery store business, which has been functioning for more than 5 years. He sells basic food products such as rice, beans, sugar, corn, vegetables, soft drinks, churros [doughnuts], bread, condiments, cleaning products, etc, and in addition, he sells cosmetics. The business is in his home, and he also goes out to distribute cosmetics when he has orders.

The loan that he is applying for is his seventh [loan] cycle with ODEF, and it is for 18,000 lempiras, which he is thinking of investing in the purchase of meats, vegetables, soft drinks, rice, sugar, cleaning products, bread, and other grocery products in order to increase his sales. He feels that the loan is a good option for working better. 

His goal is to grow with his business, be a better person, and have a distributing warehouse.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, soft drinks, rice, sugar, cleaning products, bread, and other grocery items.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a seaweeds culture business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her seaweeds culture business.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 25 years. Lilibeth earns more income from fish vending.

Lilibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her seaweed business.

loans.name: G.s Los Amigos Group

texts.es:
El señor Fausto tiene 48 años de edad, es padre de 3  hijos y su actividad es la caficultura cuenta con más de 20 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad y también se dedica al cultivo de plátano este tipo de actividad tiene un muy buen mercado tanto local como nacional, porque tiene una gran demanda por los diferentes tipos de uso.
Don Fausto está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de abono y espera que esta inversión le permita obtener los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante con su familia, está muy agradecido con Prisma porque anteriormente tenía un préstamo el cual le fue de mucho provecho y pudo llevar a cabo sus proyectos.
Don Fausto esta solicitando el préstamo de manera grupal con el señor José quien se dedica también a la caficultura.

Trojes, Honduras - Julio del 2015
texts.en:
Señor Fausto is 48 years old. He is the father of three children, and his business is growing coffee. He has more than 20 years of experience working in this type of business, and he also raises bananas. This type of business has a very good market, local as well as national, because it has a great demand due to the different types of use.

Don Fausto is applying for the loan for the purchase of compost, and he hopes that this investment will allow him to obtain the income necessary for him and his family to forge ahead. He is very grateful to Prisma because in the past he had a loan that was of much benefit to him, and he was able to complete his projects.

Don Fausto is applying for the loan through a group [formed] with Señor José, who also grows coffee.

Trojes, Honduras - July 2015

loans.use: to buy compost for his business.

loans.name: Erick Joel

texts.es:
Erick manifiesta que el crédito anterior ha contribuido a tener una cosecha abundante de maíz y pipían, a preparar la tierra y a tener estabilidad económica, se familia se mantiene unida y disfrutando de una vida más digna.
Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar abono, insecticidas y herbicidas para sembrar maíz y pipían, de esta manera seguirá trabajando para satisfacer a sus clientes y disminuir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Erick says that the previous loan helped him to have and abundant harvest of corn and pipian. It also helped him to prepare the land and have better financial stability. His family remains united and they are enjoying a more dignified live.

He is requesting a new loan to buy manure, insecticides and weed-killers to plant corn and pipian. With this he will keep working to satisfy his clients and diminish his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy manure, insecticide and weed-killer to plant corn and pipian (a kind of squash).

loans.name: Virgen De Urkupi¥A Group

texts.es:
Elisa es una mujer de 40 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 16 años, y su negocio es la venta de cuñapes.
Ella es buena madre, independiente y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en el pueblo ‘puerto pailas’ área rural que mayormente se dedica a la artesanía y gastronomía.
Elisa es morena, de cabello largo y físico robusto, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español (sentada a la izquierda, viste mandil y gorro naranja). Vive con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela. La necesidad de mejorar su negocio la hizo formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de prendas de policía, servicio de limpieza, venta de cereales, venta de polainas, venta de pañales, venta de ropa deportiva, venta de ganado ovino y porcino. Su negocio es la venta de Cuñapé que es un Pequeño bollo hecho de harina de yuca con queso, muy popular a cualquier hora del día, “horneo por las noches y vendo durante el día…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos de cocina como, almidón de yuca, leche, queso, levadura y otros. Su sueño es mejorar sus ventas, el desea realizar la compra de insumos de cocina para hornear cuñapes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que realiza esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Elisa solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para hornear cuñapes.
texts.en:
Elisa is a single, 40-year-old woman. She has two children who are 8 and 16 years old. Her business is the sale of cuñapes [cheesy bread balls].

She is a good mother, independent, and very hard-working. She does business in the town of Puerto Pailas, a rural area that specializes in handicrafts and gastronomy.

Elisa is tanned and well-built, with long hair. Her mother language is Guaraní, and she speaks Spanish. (She is seated on the left, with an orange apron and a hat.) She lives with her children, who attend school.

The need to improve her business made her start a communal bank of people with jobs such as police uniform sales, a cleaning service, cereal sales, legging sales, diaper sales, sporting clothes sales, and livestock (cattle and pig) sales.

Her business is the sale of cuñapé, which is a small roll made of yucca flour with cheese. It is very popular at any hour of the day. "I bake at night and sell during the day," she says. The advantage of her business is that the sales are daily; the disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase cooking supplies such as yucca starch, milk, cheese, leavening, etc.

Her dream is to improve her sales. She wants to purchase cooking supplies to bake cuñapes. This is her 1st loan cycle with the institution in the 20 years that she has been in this business.

For these reasons, Elisa is requesting a loan to purchase cooking supplies to bake cuñapes.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies to bake cuñapes

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Don Jorge se dedica a la siembra y comercialización de diversas verduras. Solicita un préstamo de quinientos mil colones ( ₡ 500 00), para la compra de insumos agrícolas y verduras para comercializar, esto con el fin de incrementar los ingresos provenientes de esta actividad.
texts.en: Don Jorge raises and sells various vegetables. He is applying for a loan of 500,000 colones for the purchase of agricultural supplies and vegetables to sell, with the goal of increasing the income coming from this business.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Keiry Mayarith

texts.es:
Keiry, tiene 27 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive junto a su hijo de 8 años de edad, su negocio consiste en la venta de productos de primera necesidad como granos básicos, jugos, golosinas, etc., lo fundo hace un año y medio.
Comprará arroz,  frijoles, huevos, gaseosas, pastas, pan entre otros productos que requieran sus clientes, la visión que ella tiene es tener un mejor inventario para que tanto sus ventas como ingresos sean mayores.
Las aspiraciones de keiry son tener un negocio potencial en la zona y costear los estudios de su hijo.
texts.en:
Keiry is 27 years old. She is a single mother. She lives with her 8-year-old son. Her business consists of selling products of basic necessity such as basic grains, juices, candies, etc. She began the business a year and a half ago.

She will buy rice, beans, eggs, soft drinks, pastas, and bread, among other products that her customers need. The vision that she has is to have a better inventory so that her sales as well as her income will be greater.

Keiry's aspirations are to have a strong business in the zone and to pay for her son's education.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, eggs, soft drinks, pastas, and bread, among other products that her customers need

loans.name: Noemi Elizabeth

texts.es: Noemi de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, trabaja como empleada en una empresa privada desde hace 7 años, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda levantando una pared, colocando techo, piso, puertas y ventanas pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de ladrillos, arena, laminas, y demas materiales de construccion para porder tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Noemi is 31 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and her son. She has worked as an employee of a private business for seven years. With what she earns from her job, she is able to pay for some of the home expenses.

She wants to improve her home by building another wall and placing a roof, floor, doors and windows, but since she does not have sufficient capital she is requesting a loan to buy bricks, sand, metal sheets, and other construction materials in order to have a decent house.

loans.use: to buy bricks, sand, metal sheets, and other construction materials.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Veuve et  mère d’un enfant, Adjovi est une femme âgée de 45 ans qui vit à Baguida. Adjovi est une couturière qui confectionne des habits dans son atelier de couture à  domicile et les revendent au marché. Pour s’approvisionner du nécessaire pour la confection, Adjovi se rend deux fois par mois au marché. Adjovi  demande ce prêt pour commander des pagnes, du fil et de l’huile pour la machine afin de gagner un gain et pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: A widow and the mother of one child, Adjovi is 45 years old and lives in Baguida. She is a dressmaker who makes clothing in her sewing workshop at home. She sells her products at the market. To stock up on necessities for her work, she goes to market twice a month. Adjovi is asking for this loan to order some 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), thread, and machine oil in order to earn a profit and meet the needs of her child, including education.

loans.use: to purchase 3 loads of 'pagne' cloth, a unit of thread, and a unit of machine oil

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina, who is in her late 30s, is married with four children. Three of her children are at school and the other one is still small. She has been running a retail shop selling at retail and wholesale prices, for three years now.

This will be Sakina's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her retail shop and started selling wholesale as well. She is doing great and has managed to pay back all of her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loans, and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to increase her retail and wholesale shop stock. She dreams of expanding her business. 

Sakina will make sure she pays back her loan within the loan scheduled time.

loans.use: to increase her retail and wholesale shop stock

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Veuve de 43 ans, Abra est une femme ayant cinq enfants à charge. Abra vit à Baguida et est une revendeuse d’arachide qui s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Abra sollicite ce crédit pour commander des bols d’arachides. Avec le bénéfice qui en résultera, Abra compte investir dans l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants et leur épanouissement.
texts.en: Abra, a 43-year-old widow, has five children to support. She lives in Baguida and sells peanuts, which are supplied four times a month at the market. She resells her merchandise in front of her home. Abra is requesting this loan to order bowls of peanuts. With the resulting profit, she plans on investing in her children’s education and development.

loans.use: to purchase 90 bowls of peanuts

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla est une femme mariée résidant à Adidogomé avec un enfant à charge. Abla est une revendeuse de charbon de bois et de maïs qui s’approvisionne deux  fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour financer son achat, Abla  nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois afin réaliser plus de bénéfice et soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille puis permettre une bonne éducation à leurs enfants
texts.en: Abla is a married woman residing in Adidogomé with a child in her care. She is a retailer of charcoal and corn, which are supplied twice a month at the market. She resells her merchandise in front of her home. To finance her purchase, Abla needs this loan to order sacks of charcoal for realizing more profit and supporting her husband to cover family expenses, thus allowing their children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase 5 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 53 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are in school. Cristita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, goods, egg, soap, noodles, etc.

Cristita has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Cristita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, goods, egg, soap, noodles, etc

loans.name: Joshua Bastille

texts.en:
Joshua is a first-year student at Kepler. He grew up moving between Rwanda and Uganda. After a rigorous application process based on grades, test scores, and personal interviews, he was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. Joshua chose Kepler because of its focus on practical job skills and its offering of an international degree.

Joshua plans to major in Communications with a concentration in Business and will graduate from Kepler with a B.A. from an accredited U.S. university. He hopes to earn his MBA abroad and then start his own company in Rwanda.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a U.S. college degree

loans.name: Makhsuda

texts.ru: Махсуде 48 лет. Она замужняя женщина из района Шахритус. Махсуда занимается животноводством, а ее муж занимается земледелием. Махсуда хочет помочь мужу купить тележку для трактора. Тележка стоит дорого и им не хватает денег для приобретения. Махсуда и ее муж видят один выход из этой ситуации только в получении займа. Поддержите Мухсуду и ее мужа.
texts.en: Makhsuda is 48 and married and from the Shahrituz region. She works in animal husbandry and her husband works in agriculture. She wants to help her husband buy a trailer for his tractor. Trailers are expensive and they don't have enough money to buy one. Makhsuda and her husband see only one way out of this situation, and that is to borrow money. Please support her and her husband.

loans.use: to buy a tractor trailer

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 48 years old and has five children. Cristita is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Cristita is in the agricultural business, farming bananas in the Philippines. Cristita requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Cristita has been farming banana for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Cristita would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Aileen works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Aileen is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Aileen has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Fortunata is 47 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Fortunata has a farming banana business in the Philippines. Fortunata requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Fortunata has been in this business for three years. Fortunata would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 56 years old and has five children. She is married and has four children who are still in school.

Lydia is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lydia has been in pig fattening for 14 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lydia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, eggs, sugar, etc.

Emelita has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Emelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, eggs, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 34 years old and married with one child in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
