Marcela is 49 years old and has eight children. She is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Marcela is in the agricultural business of farming bananas in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Marcela has been farming bananas for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marcela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Martha requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Martha has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Martha would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 48 years old and married.

She is in the agricultural business of farming corn in the Philippines. Marilou requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional corn seeds to plant.

Marilou has been farming corn for 28 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her farming.

In the future, Marilou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional corn seeds to plant.

loans.name: Mawussi

texts.fr: Agée de 40 ans et mère de deux enfants, Mawussi est une femme mariée habitant à Adidogomé. Mawussi est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour s’approvisionner, Mawussi demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois en vue  d’épargner et favoriser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: Mawussi, aged 40, is the mother of two. She is married and lives in Adidogomé. She is a retailer of charcoal and supplies herself three times a month at the market. She resells her merchandise in front of her home. To stock up, Mawussi is asking for this loan to order sacks of charcoal with the aim of saving money and supporting her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase 12 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
This is Annie, aged 35, from the province of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Michael, a utility man with whom she has three children of which two are in high school and the other one still at the elementary level. Although a majority of Filipinos like Annie's family do not have any luxuries they are happy and content as long they are healthy and love each other.

As her husband's salary is barely enough to raise a family of four, Annie has a small general store to help her husband make a living. She sells dry and packaged food and household items directly to consumers. She also has a small canteen by her store. She has been in that business for seven years already and has established a good name in her community.

To help her continue the operations of her businesses, she is seeking a PHP 19000 loan which she will use to pay for canned goods, biscuits, bread, coffee, powdered milk, chocolate, beverages, and toiletries. Part of the loan she will use to buy ingredients to cook meals at her canteen. She trusts your good heart to support her in her livelihood.

Annie hopes to sustain and grow her business so she could send all her children to college. Education is a great equalizer among the rich and the poor. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week; there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell and ingredients needed at her canteen.

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en:
This is Suzana feeding two out of three of her cute pigs!

“We want to start a family soon; thus, we’ve got to improve our earnings and livestock. Adding one dairy cow and some piglets at the moment will give us that extra cash to boost our income,” said Suzana, while feeding the pigs.

Suzana is 40 years old and recently married with no children yet. Since she got married she has been pursuing livestock as an additional and more stable source of income. She earns approximately $196/month, while her husband makes about $150/month, and her mother-in-law has a retirement pension of $70/month.

loans.use: to add some piglets and a dairy cow

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell.

Marissa has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Gjin

texts.en:
Gjin is 38 and a married father of four children, ranging in age from 8 to 17. They live in a village in the north. The reason why he needs your financial help is that he wants to repair his water well, buy a water pump, and also build a fence. 

Gjin works for little pay that has never been enough, since he is the only breadwinner in the family. Here is what he said in the interview: "I do my very best to find extra labour work, but it is almost impossible. There is a scarcity of laboring jobs in my region, because everybody wants to do the same, even people who have an education since they can't find a job in a relevant industry. It is just tough, altogether." 

In the 2 dynym agricultural land that his family owns, he basically plants corn and wheat and has some grapevines and olive groves. He’s got also a saw and a dairy cow.

loans.use: to repair a water well, buy a water pump, and also build a little fence around the planted land

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa est une femme mariée dynamique qui vit à Adidogomé  avec ses deux enfants  et son mari. Yawa est âgée de 31 ans et  s’active parfaitement  pour avoir une bonne situation financière. Yawa  est une commerçante de pagnes qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Yawa  sollicite ce prêt pour commander des pagnes de qualités afin de répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière remarquable  pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Yawa is a married, energetic woman who lives in Adidogomé with her two children and husband. She is 31 years old and is totally active in achieving a good financial situation. She is a merchant of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and supplies herself three times a month at the market. To reach her goals, Yawa is requesting this loan to order quality ‘pagne’ cloth for responding favorably to the expectations of her customers and for obtaining a remarkable financial autonomy to help with her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase 5 lengths of 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Miriam Naa Ayeley

texts.en:
Miriam is pursuing a four-year, Bachelors of Arts program at the University of Cape Coast; she is currently in her second year. The loan is to help pay for her school fees. God inspires her in life because she has always trusted in Him for strength and not once has He disappointed her. 

Her career path would enable her to interact professionally with people. After her degree program, she will be accepted in any company of her choice.   She sees herself working in a reputable organization and married in the next five to ten years. She would also like to study abroad within that period for her second degree.

Without this loan, she would have looked elsewhere, which would have been expensive and would have affected her parents’ income badly. “My community is a cool place to be and Ghana is a great environment to invest as the people are hospitable," she says.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees

loans.name: Regelyn

texts.en:
Regelyn is 37 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Regelyn has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buy and sell, ready to wear items.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 65 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

Virginia has been in this business for five years.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Marié et mère de trois enfants, Ayawa est une femme qui vit à Tokoin. Agée de 37 ans, Ayawa est une revendeuse des pâtes dentifrices et de couches jetables des enfants qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et les revendent en circulant les quartiers environnant et à domicile. Ayawa demande ce prêt pour réaliser ses achats de carton de pattes dentifrices et de couches jetables afin de répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière considérable pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: The married mother of three, Ayawa lives in Tokoin. She is 37 years old and a retailer of toothpastes and disposable diapers. She stocks up three times a month at the market and resells her merchandise at her home and by going through nearby districts. Ayawa is asking for this loan to realize her purchases of boxes of toothpastes and disposable diapers in order to respond favorably to the expectations of her customers and to obtain considerable financial autonomy for helping her children with their education.

loans.use: to purchase a box of toothpastes and a bag of disposable diapers

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila, ya ha cancelado su deuda y a su negocio asisten nuevos clientes, requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar ropa interior, camisas, blusas, pantalones, vestidos, etc., para ambos sexos lo que le da oportunidad de atender mejor a sus clientes y satisfacer sus demandas.
Al invertir el financiamiento anterior en su negocio pudo presentar nuevos productos a sus clientes, sus ingresos son más fijos y su familia mantiene su núcleo.
texts.en:
Zoila has already paid off the debt and her business has new customers. She requests a new loan to buy underwear, shirts, blouses, pants, dresses etc., for both sexes. This will provide opportunity to better serve her customers and meet their demands.

By investing the previous loan in her business enabled her to present new products to her customers, her income is more stable and her family keeps its core.

loans.use: to buy underwear, shirts, blouses, pants, dresses etc., for both sexes that will provide opportunity to better serve her customers and meet their demands.

loans.name: Norlita

texts.en:
Norlita is 56 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Norlita is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase new rice seeds and fertilizer.

Norlita has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new rice seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sotowegbe

texts.fr: Veuve femme de 78 ans, Sotowegbé réside à Tokoin. Sotowegbé est une vieille femme sans enfant qui  vend de produits d’alimentations générales et s’approvisionne de ses marchandises quatre fois par mois au marché et les revendent à la devanture de son domicile. Sotowegbé  sollicite ce prêt pour commander du riz et de bidon d’huile en vue d’avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin de répondre aux attentes de ses clients et à subvenir aux besoins quotidiens qu’elle éprouve.
texts.en: Sotowegbé, a 78-year-old widow, resides in Tokoin. She is elderly and has no children. Selling grocery items, she stocks up on merchandise four times a month at the market and sells in front of her home. Sotowegbé is requesting this loan to order some rice and containers of oil with the aim of having a significant stock and maximizing her profit. She could then respond to the expectations of her customers and meet her proven day-to-day needs.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of ice and a container of oil.

loans.name: Dodji

texts.fr: Dodji est une femme mariée dynamique qui vit à Tokoin  avec ses trois enfants  et son mari. Dodji est âgée de 32 ans et  s’active parfaitement  pour avoir une bonne situation financière. Dodji  est une marchande de pagnes qui s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Dodji  nécessite ce prêt pour commander des pièces de pagnes de qualités afin de répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière remarquable  pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Dodji is a married, energetic woman who lives in Tokoin with her three children and husband. She is 32 years old and totally active toward obtaining a good financial situation. She sells 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and stocks up four times a month at the market. To reach her goals, Dodji needs this loan to order lengths of quality ‘pagne’ cloth in order to respond favorably to the expectations of her customers and to achieve a remarkable financial autonomy, so as to help her children with their education.

loans.use: to purchase 3 lengths of batik 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a first year student at Kumasi Polytechnic and pursues a course in Procurement and Supply Chain Management. The loan is to help pay her tuition fees.

Her career path will help her become self-reliant and be able to manage her own company in the future. The completion of her studies would allow her cater to her younger siblings, the less privileged in her community, and her family as a whole.

Priscilla draws her inspiration from an older brother who wants to be the best in his field of study, thus ensuring that she also attains the highest of laurels in her academics and makes everyone in the family proud.

In the near future she desires to work in one of the best companies in the world, sharing the skills she acquired at school with all and being able to support her family, especially her younger siblings, and the needy in society to fulfill their dreams also.

But for the help of this loan, Priscilla and her parents have no other means of financing her education because they have exhausted all other means of help.

“Financing the youth to pursue their dreams through education is commendable and I am very grateful. May God showers his blessings on you”, she added.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition fees

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Femme mariée de 48 ans, Adjo habite à Tokoin et a deux enfants à charge. Adjo se bat énormément dans son commerce de poissons fumée pour subvenir  à ses propres besoins ceux de ses enfants. Adjo s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois au marché et demande ce crédit pour commander des cartons  de poissons en vue de les fumés et de revendre afin d’avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Adjo, a 48-year-old married woman, lives in Tokoin and has two children in her care. She struggles greatly in her smoked fish business supporting herself and her children. She gets her supplies five times a month at the market and is asking for this loan to order boxes of fish with the aim of smoking and reselling them. She could have a significant stock and maximize her profit to help her children with their education.

loans.use: to purchase 3 boxes of fish

loans.name: Mercedes Idalia

texts.es: Mercedes de 52 años de edad vive en casa con su esposo, ella se dedica a l cultivo de granos basicos desde hace 10 años, vende sus prodcutos durate todo el año, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de insumos agricolas como: semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plaga, etc. para poder obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en: Mercedes is 52 years old and lives in a home with her husband. Her job for the last 10 years has been growing staple foods. She sells her products throughout the entire year, managing to pay some household expenses with what she makes from her sales. She's applying for a loan to purchase agricultural supplies like: seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, to be able to get a good harvest.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies like: seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia, agradece el apoyo que Padecomsm y kiva le brindan, hace la solicitud de un nuevo crédito por la facilidad de pago y buen servicio, lo utilizara para comprar frutas y verduras, asimismo invertirá en harina, royal, levadura, azúcar, etc., para elaborar la venta de pan, espera tener buenos resultados.
Su negocio es más grande con el buen uso del crédito anterior, introdujo nuevos productos en la venta de frutas y verduras, la venta de pan es mayor, su situación económica es mucho mejor y su familia tiene óptimas condiciones de salud.
texts.en:
Emilia is grateful for the support PADECOMSM and kiva give her. She requests a new loan to assist in payment and good service. She will buy fruits and vegetables as well as flour, baking powder, yeast, sugar etc. to grow the bread sales. She hopes to have good results.

Her business is bigger with good use of the previous loan. She introduced new products of fruits and vegetables and the bread sales is higher. Her economic situation is much better and her family has the best possible health.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables as well as flour, baking powder, yeast, sugar etc. to grow the bread sales.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan, con la ayuda de créditos ha mantenido en el mercado la venta de ladrillos y bicicletas usadas, con sus nuevos ingresos construyo su casa y logro comprar dos novillos, agradece mucho el apoyo recibido.
Opta por un nuevo crédito para comprar chasis, cadenas, pedales, etc., para reparar bicicletas asimismo invertirá en leña, podrá mantenerse produciendo ladrillos para vender.
texts.en: Juan, with the help of loans, has been able to stay in the market selling bricks and used bicycles. With his new income he built his house and was able to buy two young bulls and he's very grateful for the help he received. He's decided on a new loan to buy chassis, chains, pedals, etc., to repair bicycles and also invest in firewood. He'll be able to support himself by making bricks to sell.

loans.use: To purchase chassis, chains, pedals etc., to repair bicycles and also invest in firewood. He'll be able to support himself by making bricks to sell

loans.name: Reuben Nutefe

texts.en:
Reuben is a first year undergraduate pursuing a four year degree program in Agricultural Science at the University of Education. The loan is to help pay for his tuition fee.
Reuben believes his career path in agriculture will open more doors for prosperity as Ghana’s economy is agriculture driven.
He is inspired by his friend who is a graduate in Agricultural Science and has successfully gained employment in that area of study.
In five to ten years he believes he will move from the position of an extension officer to becoming a lecturer in any of the universities.
His father would have done anything within his means to pay his tuition fees which have been expensive.
“It is a good initiative to the less privileged in the society to be able to acquire some education to some level, so I would say keep the good work up”.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees

loans.name: Muruhita Kweterana Group

texts.en: Muruhita kweterena group is located in Rukungiri district. The group is comprised of one man and five women. The women fall into different categories including single mothers, divorcees and a few who are married. They engage in trade and agriculture to fend for their families and they applied for a loan of 3,300,000.  Raphael, the only man in the group, is a widower who takes care of four children of whom two are still going to school. He works in agriculture and animal rearing to look after his family. He has applied for a loan of 800,000 so that he can improve on his farming and use the balance for school fees. He is very optimistic that with the financial support he acquires from UGAFODE his family will not remain the same and he is therefore, very thankful to UGAFODE.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs in the form of fertilizers.

loans.name: Lodrina

texts.en:
Lodrina works hard to support ten children. She is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10400 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Lodrina is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money but also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 34 years old and married with five children; four of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell gasoline business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy additional containers of gasoline to sell.

Divina has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell gasoline business for 8 years, and also earns an income from buying and selling dried coconut meat.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Norma Leticia

texts.es:
Norma, con el préstamo anterior mantiene la venta de tortillas vigente, su negocio está generando mejores ingresos y le han servido para remodelar el local del negocio y para apoyar en los gastos familiares, su hija mayor se gradúo de noveno grado y actualmente la sigue apoyando para que estudie bachillerato.
Solicita un nuevo crédito porque para ella son herramientas útiles para reactivar su negocio, comprara maíz y leña en mayor cantidad para preparar la venta de tortillas, espera aumentar el margen de ganancias.
texts.en: Norma kept her tortilla selling going with the previous loan, her business is generating more income and that has allowed her to remodel the location of her business and help with household expenses. Her eldest daughter graduated from ninth grade and Norma is currently supporting her to go to school for a degree. She's applying for a new loan because to her it's a useful tool to boost her business, purchase corn and firewood in higher quantities to make tortillas to sell and she hopes to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To purchase corn and firewood in larger quantities to make tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de granos basicos desde hace 5 años el cual inicio con capital propio, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, el joven vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi poder tener una mejor cosecha.
texts.en: This young person, whose face has been pixelated because he's 23 years old and lives in a dangerous area, has worked as a farmer growing staple foods for the last five years. He started up with his own capital, and sells his products in local areas close to where he resides. This young man lives in a home of his own with his two children, and is applying for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc. so that he can have a good harvest.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 53 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, noodles, chips, bread, etc.

Regina has been in this business for four years.

In the future Regina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, noodles, chips, bread, etc

loans.name: Mikongeni Group

texts.en:
Mona, who is in her mid 40s, is married with four children, two of whom are grown up and two who are still in school. She has been running a grocery store for five years now. She works from 4 pm to midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mona's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the grocery stock and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy the fast moving items in her grocery store. She dreams of expanding her grocery to a pub.

Mona will share this loan with her loan group Mikongeni, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the fast moving items in her grocery store.

loans.name: Kastriot

texts.en:
Kastriot needs this loan to buy tools and equipment for his construction trade that he’s been practicing for the past fifteen years. His wife receives a very little monthly pay in addition to his unstable income that lately hasn’t been going good at all due to the bad economy that his country has been facing the past two years since the new government took over, as per his statement.

Kastriot is a married father of a 12- and 5-year-old child who live in the town of Lezha with a population of 60,000 habitants, known for its rich ancient history and also for the Illyrian settlement dating back to the 8th century BC. In the cathedral of Saint Nicolas in the town, is also the grave of the national hero, Scanderbeg.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment needed in his construction profession

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y a la siembra de granos básicos, son actividades que ha desempeñad de toda su vida, con las cosechas abastece de alimento su hogar y además puede generar ingresos con los que cubre otras necesidades, se dedica a atender su negocio a tiempo completo; es casado, vive únicamente con su esposa.
Invertirá en cerdos y concentrado para alimentarlos, con otra parte comprara insumos agrícolas para la siembra granos básicos, podrá fortalecer más su negocio, los animales estarán sanos y espera que las cosechas sean abundantes.
Las aspiraciones de Lorenzo son mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en: Lorenzo works in raising pigs and growing staple foods, activities that he was engaged in his whole life. With the harvests he provides food for his household and additionally generates income that he uses to cover other necessities. He takes care of his business full-time, is married, and only lives with his wife. He'll invest in pigs and concentrate to feed them, and with the other portion he'll buy agricultural supplies to grow staple foods, be able to strengthen his business, have healthy animals and he hopes to have abundant harvests. Lorenzo's aspirations are to improve the infrastructure of his home and expand his business.

loans.use: To invest in pigs and concentrate to feed them, and with another portion purchase agricultural supplies to grow staple foods.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is originally from Philadelphia and lives at home with her four children and husband. She is passionate about cleanliness and loves to make things and places look clean and new. Monica started her business, Clean Corp Dustbusters, because of the high demand for her cleaning services. Recently she was offered the opportunity to sign a contract with a well-known real-estate company in her area. This has been her greatest success thus far. However, she has faced difficulty in accessing capital at a rate that matches her business's needs.

Monica is currently seeking a loan to purchase the equipment necessary for her to meet the demands of her most recent and current contract. She is excited about the steady growth her business has witnessed. Her vision for the future is to further expand her company and pass it down in her family, from generation to generation.

loans.use: to purchase equipment required to meet the demands of her most recent and current contract

loans.name: Jijuka Group

texts.en: Beatrice is the group leader, 38 years old. She is married with four children between 6 and 17 years old. They all go to school. The group is called Jijuka, which means “Be Polite” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses to change to a better future. She owns a book shop and has been doing business for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more books, pens, pencils and files to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees of her children and buy land.

loans.use: to buy more books, pens, pencils and files to sell.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is 48 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of canned goods, shampoo, eggs, sugar, etc.

Rosanna has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of canned goods, shampoo, eggs, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Intego Group

texts.en: Xaverine is the group leader. She is 54 years old and married with two children between 20 and 24 years old. The group is called INTEGO, which means “TARGET” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses to improve their future. She sells foodstuffs and has been running a business for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Marije

texts.en:
Marije is a villager from the northern part of the country and a 56-year-old married mother of five who wants to buy a dairy cow with your loan. Her family is classified as very poor according to the national poverty level. In addition to some little income she makes from livestock, her family receives about $30/month social assistance in addition to the monthly disability income of her husband. Sad to say that her 18-year-old son five years ago committed suicide and her husband got in a car accident that left him completely paralyzed. Marije has a lot to deal with, unfortunately.

Marije has had a livestock activity for the past ten years. She has only 700 square meters of land which she mainly plants for the family’s use. She also has a dairy cow, two sows and ten chickens and sells roughly 6-8 kg of raw milk/day for about nine months a year, in addition to selling piglets.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow. Her family falls below the national poverty level.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Don Jose de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la elaboración y venta de obras artesanales como las que muestra en la fotografía desde hace mas de 20 años, se ha hecho de mucha clientela por la calidad de su trabajo, el está solicitando a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar estambre y barniz por mayor y así poder continuar con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Don Jose is 59 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife. He has made a living through the preparation and sale of crafts, such as that which is shown in the photograph, for more than 20 years. He has made many customers through the quality of his work. He is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL that will allow him to purchase more yarn and varnish and thus be able to continue with his work in order to have better income.

loans.use: to purchase yarn and varnish wholesale.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 26 years old with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, chips, soap, noodles, eggs, etc.

Mary Jane has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, chips, soap, noodles, and eggs

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is grateful that she accessed several loans in the past and has repaid them on time. Those loans certainly helped maintain her jeepney service and thus, provided for her family's personal and household needs.

She trusts that she can again avail a 19,000 PHP loan, which she needs to pay for registration renewal and maintenance of her jeepney. It is very important that her jeepeny is regularly maintained to ensure safe and efficient service. She praises God for the continuous support of her livelihood.

Marilou aims to buy another jeepney unit to grow her business and save for her youngest child's college education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney.

loans.name: Urukundo A Group

texts.en: Jeanne, 43, is the group leader. She is married with three children between 8 and 13 years old. They all go to school. The group is called URUKUNDO, which means “LOVE” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses to improve their future. She has a shop and has been running the business for six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to pay for medical insurance.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice to sell.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her motorcycle transport business.

Elenita dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: 56 летняя начинающая бизнес-леди, Махбуба. Она из города Турсунзаде. Махбуда развелась  мужем. Она живет вместе с детьми. У нее прекрасная и дружная семья. Старшие дети женаты и имеют детей. Махбуба активная и сильная женщина, она любит трудиться и зарабатывать на жизнь. Махбуба решила заниматься торговлей деятельности. Она отремонтировала точки торговли и хочет, перевозит продукт питания на продажу. Для перевоза ей нужно деньги, но их у нее нет. По той причине Махбуба решила взять кредит и перевозить продукт питания. Она верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Mahbuba is 56 years old and a new business-lady.  She lives in Tursun-Zoda.  She is divorced from her husband and lives with her children.  She has a wonderful and loving family.  Her older children are married and have children of their own.  Mahbuba is a strong and energetic woman.  She loves to work and earn her way in life.  

Mahbuba decided to get into the sales business.  She has finished remodeling a location for her store and she wants to bring in food products.  Since she doesn't have the money to do this, she has decided to take out a loan for the food products.  She believes in you and that you'll support her.

loans.use: to start a business and bring in food products

loans.name: Shamimu

texts.en:
Shamimu, who is in her late 20s, is married with one child who is still in school. She has been a tailor for one and one half years now. She works from 8am to 8pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Shamimu's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her sewing products and to buy more materials and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profits to pay school fees, to buy a plot of land, to repay the loans and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy nice material for making good dresses and up-to-date suits. She dreams of expanding her tailoring business so it is big.

Shamimu will make sure she pays back her loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy nice material for making good dresses and up-to-date suits.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge Luis se desempeña como guarda de seguridad, el solicita un préstamo de un millón cien mil colones (₡ 1 100 000), por medio de este dinero podrá comprar una motocicleta, con la cual podrá desplazarse todos los días hasta su lugar de trabajo.
texts.en: Jorge Luis works as a security guard. He requests a one million one hundred thousand colones (₡1,100,000) loan. He will be able to purchase a motorcycle with this money, with which he will be able to travel every day to his workplace.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Fran

texts.en:
Fran is 61 and needs your financial help to pay for the electricity bills that are in arrears. “This happened not because I was not responsible to pay, but as you know, it was the company that messed up with all the citizens in this country. They never sent us a bill for so many years, and we had no clue what was going on until we saw it in the media. We are now struggling to pay the lump sum they claim we have to pay; they changed the meters and we’ve got no clue…anyhow, I don’t want to be bitter about it, I just want to pay off the debt and that is all,” said Fran in the interview with the loan officer.

Fran has a little yard where he plants for the family. He also has two sows and he sells her piglets. His profession is electrical technician and he makes approximately $300/month. His mother, who lives with them, receives a retirement pension of about $50/month. This is all the income of the family.

loans.use: to pay for the electricity bills that are in arrears due to the company's operations failure.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald, who is in his late 30s, is married with no children. He has been selling fabrics for one year now. He works from 8am to 6pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Gerald's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase his fabric stock and has paid back his loan successfully. He used the profit to take care of his family, to repay the loan and to cover household expenses. He will use this loan to buy the fast-selling style of fabrics. He dreams of becoming an international businessman.

Gerald will make sure he pays back his loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy the fast-selling style of fabrics.

loans.name: Akossiwavi

texts.fr: Veuve femme de 60 ans, Akossiwa vit à Tokoin et a trois enfants à sa charge. Akossiwa est une revendeuse de noix de coco qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Akossiwa nécessite ce crédit pour commander des noix de coco. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Akossiwa va pouvoir aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
A widow who is 60 years old, Akossiwa lives in Tokoin and takes care of three children. She works selling coconuts that she procures twice a month from the market. She resells the coconuts from the front of her house.

Akossiwa needs this loan to order more coconuts. With the profits, she will be able to help her children with their education.

loans.use: to buy 40 units of coconuts.

loans.name: Abunzubumwe Group

texts.en: Angelique, 37, is the group leader. She is married with five children between 3 and 15 years old. The group is called ABUNZUBUMWE, which means “UNITED” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses to improve their future. She has a shop and has been running the business for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees and to improve her welfare.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice to sell.

loans.name: Houadomé

texts.fr: Houadomé est une femme divorcée et sans enfant résidante à Tokoin. Houadomé est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne cinq  fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour financer son achat, Houadomé nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice et réorganiser son commerce en vue de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens.
texts.en:
Houadomé is a divorced woman, who has no children, and lives in Tokoin. She works reselling charcoal which she procures five times a month from the market. She sells the charcoal from the front of her home.

To finance the purchase of bags of charcoal, Houadomé needs this loan. This will help her to earn more profits and reorganize her business with the goal of supporting her daily needs.

loans.use: to buy three bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Nukri

texts.en: Nukri is a 42-year-old man from Zugdidi district. He lives with his mother, wife and three children. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of land, where they grow nut trees. In addition, Nukri is involved in a husbandry business; he has cows and they produce dairy products to sell. Nukri wants to start an additional seasonal business and requested a loan. The Startup program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1,000 GEL. With the received credit, Nukri will purchase a stock of snacks and juices and will resell them in Anaklia, which is a seaside place and full of tourists. Nukri is very motivated to start the new business and he hopes this will be profitable for his family.

loans.use: to purchase snacks and juices to resell.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 41 years old and has six children. She is married and four of her children are presently in school.

Liezel is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Liezel requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Liezel has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic goods, charcoal, and tar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shirts, jackets, t-shirts, and tunics.

loans.name: Lala Harinirina Rabe Andrianony Angela

texts.fr:
Lala est une femme dynamique et travalleuse de 55 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont deux déjà mariés, un en quête de travail et le dernier âgé de 16 ans, 1ère année en DROIT à l'université. 
Elle exerce une activité d’élevage: canard pékin, poules pondeuses, et poulet de chair. Ce dernier qui est le plus récent, étant commencé en 2013 est l'objet de sa demande de crédit. Elle voudrait encore y investir davantage, le développer et l'étendre, pratiquer des escaliers afin de pouvoir augmenter le revenu.
C'est une femme débrouillarde, presque le pilier de la famille car le travail de son mari n'est pas stable mais il l'aide quand-même dans l'exercice de ces activités.
Sa priorité actuelle est les études de son dernier enfant et la carrière de l'avant dernier, en tout l'avenir de ces deux-là.
texts.en:
Lala is a dynamic and hardworking woman who is 55 years old. She is married and the mother of four children, of whom two are already married, one is looking for work, and the youngest, who is 16 years old, is in the first year studying law at university.

Lala works raising livestock: peking ducks, laying hens, and broiler chickens. She only started raising broiler chickens recently, in 2013, and this is why she is seeking this loan.

She would like to invest, develop, and expand this part of her work more, as a way to increase her earnings.

Lala is resourceful, the pillar of her family, because her husband's work is not stable, even though he helps with the livestock.

Lala's priority is her youngest child's education and her second youngest child's career, so that they have a future.

loans.use: to buy 150 chicks, and 10 bags of feed, vitamins, and firewood.

loans.name: Adepa Wood Carvers Group

texts.en: Kwaku is a 43-year-old man. He is from Kokoben in the Ajumako Enyan Essiam District of the Central Region of Ghana.  Kwaku is the leader and group representative of Adepa Wood Carvers. He is a married man. Kwaku has four children and all the children are currently in school. He has five dependants. Kwaku is a wood carver. He designs things such as bracelets, craft boat ornaments, cranes etc. Kwaku says he became a wood carver because he worked closely on wood carving since childhood with the father. He sells his goods in a local market.  Kwaku has a cocoa plantation that serves as his other source of income. He has been in the business for 20 years. His main challenges are inadequate materials to meet market demands and access to funding. Kwaku wants to see his business expanded in the next five years. He will use his income from sales to cater to his children’s educational needs. Kwaku will use the loan to purchase more materials and tools for his craft work in order to attract more tourists both locally and internationally. He believes accessing loans from Kiva is quick and easy. Kwaku is thankful to all his Kiva micro lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to buy more materials and tools for his craft work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy different kinds of vegetables, like tomatoes, green beans, beans, cucumbers, etc.

loans.name: Adama Hawa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce B.V a été créé le 08 Janvier 2004. Il est composé de femmes qui habitent toutes la même localité et entretiennent des liens fort de solidarité. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Adama Hawa (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle mariée, âgée de 32 ans et mère de 04 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce de produits alimentaires.

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter dans les marchés hebdomadaires 01 bidon de 20 litres d’huile à 14000f et 01 sac de sucre à 18000f 01 sac de riz à 13000f et du thé pour le revendre dans son village en détails.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’aider son mari dans les charges familiales et renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
This banc villageois was created 8 January 2004. It is made up of women who live in the same area and share strong ties of solidarity. They all work primarily in small-scale commerce.

Adama Hawa (who is seated on the far right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is married, 32 years old, and the mother of four children. She works selling foodstuffs.

With this new loan, she plans to buy one 20-liter drum of oil for 14,000 francs CFA, one sac of sugar for 18,000 francs CFA, one sac of rice for 13,000 francs CFA, and tea from the weekly markets. She will resell these goods in her village at retail.

Earnings will allow her to help her husband cover their family's expenses and to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy one 20-liter drum of oil, one sac of sugar, one sac of rice, and tea.

loans.name: Sidwata 09 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mr KOUDOUGOU est le responsable du groupe SIDWATA 09 SAPONE. Il est marié et père de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 17 ans et le moins âgé a 05 ans. 04 enfants vont à l’école et il 07 personnes en charges.
Mr fait de l’élevage depuis 20 ans et pratique aussi l’agriculture. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte  acheter  05 porcs.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans son activité et construire sa maison. Il ambitionne assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Koudougou is the leader of the Sidwata 09 Sapone group. He is married and the father of five children. The eldest child is 17 years old, while the youngest is five years old. Four of the children are in school. Koudougou takes care of seven people.

Koudougou has been raising livestock for 20 years. He is also a farmer. He procures his livestock in the surrounding markets.

With this loan, he plans to buy five pigs. He wants to use his earnings to reinvest in his work and to build a house.

His goal is to ensure his children's education.

loans.use: to buy five pigs.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en: Lia is a 31-year-old married woman. She lives in Telavi district with her mother and husband. Lia works at a local public school. She manages the school and also does logistics along with managerial work. She is very motivated to open her private school and already built a building where she will have the school. Lia needs some money to cover renovation costs. The Startup program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan. With the received credit, Lia will cover renovation costs to open the school. She is very experienced in this field and awaits your support.

loans.use: to cover renovation costs and open a private school.

loans.name: Kherb''group

texts.en: Kherb’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Kherb makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Her name is Wilma. She is 49, from the province of Silang, Cavite, Philippines and married to Zosimo, a farmer. Life may be hard in a developing economy but the couple is grateful for God's faithfulness to their family.

Wilma has been operating her store for five years already. Her earnings have greatly helped cover their daily sustenance. She sells dry and packaged commodities directly to consumers. All products are essential food items. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store means a lot to her since it helps cover their daily personal and household needs.

To help her expand her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan, which she will use to buy grocery items such as canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits, soda, toiletries, etc. Although there are times she has difficulty collecting her receivables from some of her customers, she still maintains a positive attitude that they can make ends meet.

Wilma dreams of having a big grocery store someday. She prays for God's abundance in all areas of her life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell at  her store.

loans.name: Roza

texts.en:
Roza and her nice family live in Nor Dvin village of Ararat region. The main occupation of the family is in agribusiness. Besides this, Roza's husband works at local village school, her elder son provides taxi service and her second son is a migrant worker. Roza's daughter-in-law takes care of her two little kids and also helps Roza with farming jobs.
The family's farm include hens (30 chickens and 10 turkeys) and also cultivation of fruit trees such as peach, plum and pear.

To be able to enlarge the farm, Roza asks this loan. She plans to purchase four calves and forage for feeding the livestock. This is her first loan and it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. This first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have prior access to loans because they had no credit history.

Roza and her family hope for the good will of the lenders to support them to gather the needed financial resources to invest in their farm.

loans.use: to pay for four calves and forage for feeding the livestock

location.town: Nor Dvin village of Ararat region

loans.name: Sidwata 05 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mr OUSMANE est le responsable du groupe SIDWATA 05 SAPONE. Il est marié et père de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 22 ans et le moins âgé a 01 an. 04 enfants vont à l’école et il a 07 personnes en charges.
Mr fait de l’élevage depuis 20 ans et pratique aussi l’agriculture. Il s’approvisionne dans le marché du village et environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte  acheter 03 porcs.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour augmenter son chiffre d’affaire. Il ambitionne construire sa maison.
texts.en:
Ousmane is the leader of the Sidwata 05 Sapone group. He is married and the father of five children. The eldest child is 22 years old, while the youngest is one year old. Four of the children are in school. Ousmane takes care of seven people.

Ousmane has been raising livestock for 20 years. He is also a farmer. He procures his livestock from the village market and surrounds.

With this loan, he plans to buy three pigs.

He wants to use his earnings to increase his turnover. His goal is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy three pigs.

loans.name: Nuray

texts.en:
Nuray is a widow and her children are married, so she now lives alone. For years she has been producing Turkish ravioli (mantı) at home and selling them. With her first loan loan she bought in bulk flour, meat and eggs, made her mantı, sold them and gained money. With the help of the her second loan she is planning to buy more bulk of flour, meat and eggs, to make more mantı, sell them and improve her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Nuray hanım eşi vefat etmiş çocuklarını evlendirmiş yalnız yaşıyor. Uzun yıllardır evde mantı yaparak ve satarak evini geçindiriyor. Kullandığı ilk mikro kredi ile mantı malzemesi un, et, yumurta toptan aldı üretti ve satıp aile ekonomisine katkı sağladı. İkinci kullandığı mikro kredi ile toptan mantı malzemesi un, et, yumurta alarak üreterek satarak para kazanmak ve işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make traditional Mantı (Turkish ravioli)

loans.name: Yat's Group

texts.en: Yat’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Yat makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is a first-year student at Kepler. She grew up with six siblings in Rwanda's capital of Kigali. Because of her dedication and impressive academic record, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. She chose Kepler because it offers the skill training and financial support not available elsewhere in Rwanda.
Allen plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, she hopes to own her own business, possibly in the aerospace or airport industry.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is a first-year student at Kepler. She grew up in Rwanda's capital of Kigali with her mother, a primary school teacher. Due to her strong academic record, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year, and chose Kepler because of its reputation for getting its graduates great internships and jobs.

Laura plans to major in Health Care Management, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, she hopes to work at a hospital or health NGO—while also giving back to her family and community.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Tupendane C Group

texts.en:
Mariam who is in her early 40s, is widowed with three kids, two of them are grown up and one is still in school. She has been a food vendor for ten years now. She works from 06am to 05pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mariam’s 8th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on the food stock and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayment, bought a plot of land, save the money and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in mamalishe business. She dreams of expanding her business.

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group Tupendane C which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in her mamalishe business.

loans.name: Sidwata 02 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mr RASMANE est le responsable du groupe SIDWATA 02 SAPONE. Il est marié et père de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 04 ans et le moins âgé a 05 mois. 0 enfant ne va à l’école et il a 04 personnes en charges.
Mr fait de l’élevage depuis 07 ans et pratique aussi l’agriculture. Il s’approvisionne dans le marché du village.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 04 moutons.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour acheter d’autres moutons. Il ambitionne assurer l’avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Rasmane is the leader of the Sidwata 02 Sapone group. He is married and the father of two children. The eldest is four years old, and the youngest is five months old. None of the children are in school. Rasmane takes care of four people.

Rasmane has been raising livestock for seven years. He is also a farmer. He procures his livestock in the village market.

With this loan, he plans to buy four sheep.

He wants to use his earnings to buy other sheep. His goal is to ensure his children's future.

loans.use: to buy four sheep.

loans.name: Sidwata 01 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mr  BERNARD est le responsable du groupe  SIDWATA 01 SAPONE. Il est marié et père de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 16 ans et le moins âgé a 05 ans. 01 enfant va à l’école et il a 15 personnes en charges.
Mr fait de l’élevage et pratique aussi l’agriculture depuis 06 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 05 porcs.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour s’occuper de sa famille. Il ambitionne devenir un grand éleveur.
texts.en:
Bernard is the leader of the Sidwata 01 Sapone group. He is married and the father of two children. The eldest child is 16 years old, and the youngest is 5 years old. One of the children is in school. Bernard takes care of 15 people.

Bernard has been farming and raising livestock for six years. He procures his livestock in the surrounding markets.

With this loan, he plans to buy five pigs.

He wants to use his earnings to take care of his family. He dreams of becoming a large livestock farmer.

loans.use: to buy five pigs.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a dedicated mother and lives in Lahore Pakistan with her husband and son. Her husband owns a meat shop in the nearby market and has been running the shop for 5 years now He is a reliable butcher, so he has gathered a lot of faithful customers within this short span of time. He is only bread winner of his house, so it becomes difficult for him to manage the household at times due to stock shortages.

Now he wants to buy several goats which is the most demanded meat, so that he earns enough of the profits and run his family with ease. Therefore Sofia has applied or the loan and thanks the Kiva and its field partner BRAC,Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy goats for providing meat for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Famous Wood Carvers Group

texts.en: Cecilia is 54 years of age. She is from Kokoben in the Ajumako Enyan Essiam District of the Central Region of Ghana. Cecilia is the group representative of Famous Wood Carvers. She is married with six children and one of them is schooling currently. The ages of the children are 19, 21, 24, 26, 28 and 35. Cecilia is a wood carver with five years of working experience. She sells her wood artifacts at the local Art Centre. She designs things like masks, toys, etc. Cecilia is aiming to see massive improvement in her business in five years to come. Cecilia also has an orange plantation as another source of income to support the family. Her main business challenge is funding to enable her to finance business working capital. Cecilia needs a loan to purchase materials to increase production and to rent a store to keep the artifacts. Cecilia planned to use part of her income generated from sales to support her husband to cater to their children and the remaining will be invested into the business. She thanks all her Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy materials such as wood, paint, and polish to increase her production and to rent a storeroom to keep her artifacts.

loans.name: Mukazi

texts.en:
Mukazi is a first-year student at Kepler. She grew up in a family of four brothers. Because of her impressive academic credentials, she was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year. Mukazi chose to attend Kepler because it provides competitive internships for its students.

Mukazi plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. A hard worker, she hopes to develop her communications skills to a point where she can manage a business after graduating.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Vicessia

texts.fr: Vicessia est une femme mariée âgée de 33 ans habitant à Tokoin. Vicessia est sans enfant et est une revendeuse de boissons alcoolisées traditionnelle  appelé « Sodabi »  qu’elle achète six fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile. Vicessia sollicite ce prêt pour commander des bidons de boissons afin d’étendre son commerce et gagner plus de bénéfices en vue de soutenir son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Vicessia is 33 years old, married, and lives in Tokoin. She has no children.

Vicessia works selling a traditional alcoholic beverage called "Sodabi" [West African palm wine liqueur used in local ceremonies]. She procures this drink six times a month from a market and resells it from her home.

Vicessia is seeking this loan to order drums of this drink in order to expand her commerce and earn more profits. Her goal is to help her husband cover the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy drums of sodabi [West African palm wine liqueur used in local ceremonies].

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.en:
Miguel, 27 years old, is a single man who lives in the municipality of Caparrapi. Last year this man started his own business. He owns a farm where he grows different kinds of products. This job he learned thanks to his father who taught him everything so he can work well.

For this man, it is very important that his business can last in time because it is the financial support for his family. He wants to see his products in good markets and admired for their good quality. He asked for a loan to pay for some skilled labor that helps him improve his sugar cane growing and to buy some tools for cane cutting.

Miguel wants to improve his house so he and his family can live in a safer home. You can help this man to do great things in his business and his life. A loan can do a lot for him.

loans.use: to pay for some skilled labor to help him improve his sugar cane farming and to buy some tools for cane cutting.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is a 43-year-old married mother of three children. Sixteen years ago, she started working at the administration department in a hospital to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children.
Erma is a hard worker and sacrificing mother who is depriving herself for the sake of her children. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees.
Erma hopes to succeed in her work and get a promotion to stay capable of satisfying her family's needs.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Gaviotas Doradas Group

texts.es:
Doris es una mujer de 32 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 14 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es independiente, buena madre y muy amable. Su negocio lo realiza en un mercado de la zona ‘mutualista’ caracterizado por encontrarse en el centro de la ciudad donde se encuentra la mayor parte del movimiento comercial.
Doris es de tez trigueña, cabello castaño y baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español (al centro, viste blusa blanca con mangas cortas negras). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo con techo de calamina y piso de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su sueño de superación la llevó a liderar la banca de personas.  Su negocio es la venta de comida, “cocino a diario y mis clientes son continuos…” comenta. la ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos de cocina como, aceite, carne, fideo, y otros. Su sueño es ser la elegida por los clientes de la zona, ella desea realizar la compra de insumos de cocina. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Doris solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para comida tradicional.
texts.en:
Doris is a 32 year old woman. She lives with her partner and has 2 children, ages 7 and 14. Her business is selling food. She is independent, a good mother and very friendly. Her business is located in a market in the "mutual" area characterized for being in the center of the city where the large part of the commercial movement can be found.

Doris has a dark complexion, brown hair and a short stature. Her native language is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish as well (she is in the middle, wearing a white blouse with short black sleeves). She shares her life with her partner who works, and with her children who are in school. They live in a rented room built of brick with a tin roof and brick floors, that has all of the basic needs.

Her dream of improvement led her to lead a bank of people. Her business is selling food. "I cook every day and my customers are constant," she says. The advantage of her business is that she has daily sales. The disadvantage is the lack of money to buy kitchen supplies such as oil, meat, noodles, and others.

Her dream is to be chosen by the customers in the area. She wants to buy kitchen supplies. This is the 2nd loan with the institution in 2 years that she has been doing this work. For those reasons, Doris is asking for a loan to buy kitchen supplies for traditional foods.

loans.use: to buy kitchen supplies for traditional foods.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es: Jose Carlos es un joven muy esforzado que necesita un préstamo de quinientos mil colones (₡ 500 000), para la compra de una motocicleta que le permita trasladarse hasta su lugar de trabajo.
texts.en: Jose Carlos is a very courageous young man. He needs a loan of 500,000 colones to buy a motorbike that allows him to get himself to work.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Saren's Group

texts.en: Saren’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Saren makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as farmer and construction worker to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Sarah works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell linen  business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and raising livestock. Sarah is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of linen to sell for her buy and sell linen business.

Sarah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of linen to sell

loans.name: Saran's Group

texts.en: Saran’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Saran makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer and seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Yomaira Adriana

texts.es: Yomaira es una comerciante reconocida en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla, que cuenta con una amplia experiencia en la administración de su tienda de víveres y abarrotes ubicada en esta localidad, inicialmente su madre era la antigua propietaria y le cedió el negocio para que continuara con este legado familiar. Yomaira de 31 años reside con su cónyuge y dos pequeños hijos a quienes ofrece bienestar y calidad de vida, gracias a su desempeño en su negocio, el cual  le exige extensas rutinas de atención al público.  Ella diariamente empieza a atender a partir de las 6 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m. para lograr obtener las ventas esperadas y así llegar al punto de equilibrio para luego garantizar utilidades. No es una tarea fácil por lo fluctuante que pueden ser las ventas sin embargo, Yomaira es constante y está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir surtido de víveres; legumbres, arroz, aceite, carne, pollo y demás, con la finalidad de que sus clientes encuentren todo en un mismo lugar.  Su meta a futuro es convertir su tienda en un autoservicio y remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Yomaira is a well-known merchant in a neighborhood of the town of Barranquilla. She has lots of experience managing her grocery store located in this area. Initially, her mother was the former owner and she handed the business over to her so that she could continue the family inheritance.

Yomaira is 31 years old and lives with her partner and two small children. She gives them wellbeing and quality of life thanks to her job performance, which requires extensive customer service routines. Every day, she beings to work at 6 AM until 9 PM in order to get the expected sales and break even, to then ensure profits. It is not an easy job because of the fluctuation of the sales. However, Yomaira is consistent and is asking for her first Credikiva through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will buy grocery supplies such as vegetables, rice, oil, meat, chicken and others, with the hopes that her customers can find everything in the one place. Her future goal is to convert her store into an auto service and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to buy grocery supplies such as vegetables, rice, oil, meat, chicken and others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle, vitamins, and food to continue to improve her business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 40 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 3 años y una hija de 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de carteras y mochilas. 
Ella es buena madre, dedicada y muy constante. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ’16 de julio’ caracterizado por el comercio y manufactura en todas las áreas.
Rosa es morena, de baja estatura y físico robusto. Su lengua materna s el Aymará y hala español. Vive con su pareja que trabaja y con sus hijos que ya comienzan la escuela, viven en un cuarto propio construido de adobe que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de carteras y mochilas, en su puesto fijo de venta durante todos los días de la semana, “empecé hace 10 años y trabajo sola…” comenta. la ventaja de su negocio es que su puesto de venta esta bi3en ubicado, la desventaja es la competencia. Su sueño es fabricar sus propias carteras, ella desea realizar la compra de una máquina de coser industrial. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que realiza esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Rosa solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser industrial para confeccionar carteras.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 40 year old woman. She lives with her partner and has a 3 year old son and an 8 year old daughter. Her business is selling purses and backpacks. She is a good mother, dedicated and very consistent. Her business is located in the "16th of July" area, characterized by its commercial and manufacturing areas.

Rosa is dark-skinned, with a short stature and a robust physique. Her native language is Aymará and she speaks Spanish. She lives with her partner who works, and with her children who are starting school. They live in their own home built from adobe that has all of the basic services.

Her business is selling purses and backpacks in her stall every day. "I began 10 years ago and I work alone," she comments. The advantage of her business is that her stall is in a good location. The disadvantage is her competition.

Her dream is to make her own purses. She wants to buy an industrial sewing machine. This is the 1st loan with the institution in the 10 years she has been doing this work. For those reasons, Rosa is asking for a loan to buy an industrial sewing machine to make purses.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine to make purses.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Doña Martha de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee un chalet donde vende antojitos y gaseosas ubicado cerca de su casa en una zona muy transitada desde hace 12 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de gaseosas, aceite, papas, plátanos y todos los ingredientes para la elaboracion de los antojitos y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos
texts.en:
Martha is 60 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband. She owns a house, located next to her home in a very busy area, where she has sold snacks and soft drinks for 12 years. With the earnings from her sales, she manages to resolve some household expenses.

She is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks, oil, potatoes, bananas, and the other ingredients to make the snacks, and thus be able to have better income earnings.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, oil, potatoes, bananas, and the other ingredients.

loans.name: Gods Way Wood Carvers Group

texts.en:
Michael is a 52-year-old man from Kokoben in the Ajumako Enyan Essiam District of the Central Region of Ghana.

Michael is the leader of God’s Way Wood Carvers, and he is married with 4 children. His wife is a petty trader who sells eggs and vegetables. Their children are aged 13, 19, 20 and 25, and three of them are currently in school. Michael therefore has 5 people as dependents.

He is a craftsman and sells his goods in a local market. He designs things like masks, toys and furniture, and he has been in this business for the past 15 years. Michael became a wood carver after completing his secondary education because there was no money to further his education. He also has a cocoa plantation which serves as his other source of income.

His challenge is a lack of funds to buy materials and tools for crafting, so he intends to use the loan to purchase carving materials. The loan will help him to meet the demands of tourists. In the next 5 years, Michael also wants to export some of his designs to other countries.

This is Michael's first time working with this field partner. He is grateful to all Kiva micro-lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy more materials for his craft work

loans.name: Variable Carvers Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 43 years old and comes from Kokoben in the Ajumako Enyan Essiam District of the Central Region of Ghana.

He is the group representative of the Variable Carvers Group, and he is married with 3 children. All his children are currently in school. His wife is a trader who assists the family when the need arises. Emmanuel therefore has 4 dependents.

He is an artisan who carves wood and then sells to local and foreign tourists in the local market. Emmanuel says he chose to be a craftsman because he lost his parents at a tender age so there was no-one there to assist him in furthering his education.
