He has been in this business for 10 years and has 3 employees. He also has a cocoa and plantain farm as his other source of income.

His challenges in his business are the high cost of materials and inadequate capital. He will use the loan to buy more materials for his work in order to meet the high demands from tourists. He wants to see an improvement in his business in the next 5 years.

He thanks all Kiva micro-lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy polish, wood and tools for his work.

loans.name: Liliana Patricia

texts.en:
Liliana is a 41-year-old mother of one, and she lives with her son in the municipality of Puerto Triunfo. She is a single mother who has made her life a working life in order to support her son and give him the best quality of life she can. She’s been working selling products like clothes and shoes for many years - around 11 years - something that has allowed her to progress.

She wants her business to become more competitive in the market, and she wants to see it successful. This is why she wants to invest in her business. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy more clothes, shoes and perfumes to generate more income.

She dreams of buying her own house so she and her son can have a place where they can live happily, safely and comfortably.

Please help this devoted mother to accomplish all her dreams and improve her business. This loan will bring her closer to her goals.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, shoes and perfumes to generate more income.

loans.name: Felix Antonio

texts.es: Don felix de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, el se dedica al cultivo de granos basicos desde hace 20 años y tambien como jornal, comercializa sus productos en los meses de marzo y abril, tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su unica fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Felix is 53 years old and lives in his own home with his son. He has made a living for the last twenty years from growing grain, he also works as a day labourer. He sells his produce during the months of March and April and has many customers. He is able to pay for his household expenses with what he makes from selling his produce. He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure and pesticides so he can continue with his business which is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticides etc

loans.name: Ilia

texts.en:
Ilia is 45 years old and from Gori district. He lives with his wife and three children. The family has no income and they live in poverty. Ilia and his wife are unemployed. They decided to start a trading business to generate income.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables Ilia to get a loan of 1,000 GEL. With this loan he will purchase clothes to resell in his village at higher prices to generate income and cover everyday expenses. Ilia is very motivated and hopes that this business will be profitable for his family. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin selling clothes to generate income.

loans.name: Gyidi Wood Carvers Group

texts.en:
George is a 55 year old man. He comes from Ajumako in the Central Region of Ghana. George is married and has five children, ages 3, 5, 6, 27, and 30 years old. Three of his children are in school.

George is a wood carver. He has 25 years working experience and four employees he works with. He produces wooden masks, sculptures, and necklaces and sells them at the Art Center in the local market. George has a commercial vehicle, cocoa plantation, and palm plantation which serve as his other sources of income. His wife is a trader who has been assisting him with their children.

George wants to improve his business in the next five years by purchasing more materials for his work, but he lacks funds to achieve this goal. He needs a loan to finance the working capital needs of his business. This will assist George in improving the lives of his children by financing their education. He thanks all his Kiva lenders for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like paints, brushes, wood, and carving tools.

loans.name: Hernan Dario

texts.en:
Dario is 35 years old and lives with his partner in the municipality of Concordia. This year he decided to start a business. He grows coffee, which is very traditional in Colombia. He works really hard, around 10 hours every day, because he is really committed to his work and to making his business successful.

Dario wants to make his business bigger so he has more to offer to his clients. Right now, like any entrepreneur, he has some troubles with money because he needs a lot to organize his business. That is why he asked for a loan so he can buy seedlings and seeds to improve his business.

Dario dreams of buying his own house so he and his family can have a place to live safely. He also expects that his business can help him improve his family's quality of life. You can help Dario to fulfill his dreams with a loan.

loans.use: buy seedlings and seeds to improve his business.

loans.name: Oscar Alonso

texts.en:
Oscar is a 48-year-old married man who lives in the municipality of Pueblo Rico. He has two sons, who are 8 and 4 years old. For Oscar, his sons are the most important thing in his life. Oscar has owned a business raising pigs since 2012, a job that has allowed him to support his family. He learned all that he knows thanks to his wife’s brother.

Oscar wants his profits to increase and his business to be more competitive. Right now he has a pregnant pig that in about a month will give birth. She needs a lot of maintenance and it costs a lot, so he is asking for a loan to pay the money he still owes for his female pig and to buy food for the new piglets that are coming.

Oscar dreams of paying for his children's education because he wants them to be professionals someday. He also would like to improve his house so his family can have a better quality of life. You can help Oscar to accomplish all his dreams - a loan will do a lot for him.

loans.use: to pay the money he still owes for his female pig and to buy food for the new piglets that are coming.

loans.name: Irma Estela

texts.en:
Irma is a 43-year-old woman, who is married to a loving husband. Irma and her husband have three sons, but non of them live with them, so they only provide for each other.
Irma has been making a living by selling catalog cosmetics for ten years and she has been earning a good profit.

Now, Irma is asking for a 6,000 MXN loan to buy more merchandise to resell. She is willing to buy a bigger amount to earn a bigger profit. We at Kubo are really confident that she will succeed because of her experience in the cosmetics market, and we are sure that she will be able to repay the loan she is taking because she has handled bigger loans in the past and she repaid every one of those without any trouble.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to resell

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima is a kind woman from the district of Shahrituz. She is 52 years old. Fotima has been engaged in livestock farming since her childhood. When she successfully graduated from secondary school, her parents married her off. Therefore, she could not go to the University.

Even if Fotima did not receive higher education, she's always worked and continued her farming activities after the marriage. She has now a good experience in livestock farming. Now Fotima needs a loan to increase the quantity of her livestock and expand her business. She believes that with the help of Kiva lenders, her life conditions will improve. Prom the profit of her activity Fotima wants to renovate her home and live with her family in a comfortable house.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of her livestock.

loans.name: Abadahemuka Group

texts.en:
Jenifer is a group leader; aged 29 years. She is married with 4 children aged between 1 and 8 years. The group is called ABADAHEMUKA means “TRUSTED PEOPLE” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future.

Jenifer has a shop and has been running a business for 5 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school and to improve her welfare.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale.

loans.name: Saray's Group

texts.en: Saray’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Saray makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a 49-year-old married mother of two. Five years ago, she started preparing and selling "Mouneh" and working as a hairdresser from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.
Samira is a hard worker and ambitious lady who has a good reputation among her region and trying desperately to improve her family's living conditions. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house to make it a healthier place for her children. 
Samira hopes to develop her business to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate her house to make it a healthier place for her children

loans.name: Viley's Group

texts.en: Viley’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Viley works as seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Vasfiye

texts.en:
Vasfiye is married and a mother of three. She is selling cleaning products via a network system. She used the money she gained to the education of her children and later on for their weddings. Vasfiye makes her sales on the house meetings which she regularly attends.

She is using her fourth loan and with the help of the loans she made bulk orders and decreased her costs and increased her profit.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Vasfiye Hanım evli ve 3 çocuk annesi. Network sistemi ile temizlik malzemeleri satıyor. Bu işten kazandığı paraları çocuklarının eğitimi ve evlenmeleri için kullandı. Vasfiye Hanım satışlarını düzenli olarak katıldığı ev toplantılarında yapıyor. MAYA’dan 4’üncü kredisini kullanan Vasfiye Hanım aldığı krediler ile toptan sipariş vererek ürünlerinin geliş maliyetini azaltarak daha fazla kar elde etti.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Suriya Group

texts.en:
Suriya is a responsible wife and mother of seven children living in Lahore, Pakistan along with husband. He owns a shoe shop and is a pioneer in shoe making. He can make any kind of shoe whenever being ordered and of whatever color, because he dyes them as well. He has been given orders from his pool of several customers. The couple dream of giving their children a great future, as all parents dream, but they are falling short of savings and also are unable to buy the raw materials for shoe making.

So Suriya requested for a group loan from Kiva, along with its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With this, the couple is thankful to Kiva and its partner.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for shoe making, by  her husband.

loans.name: Walde-Lemobe Group

texts.fr: Mr NOUHOUM est un éleveur alphabétisé, âgé de 47ans, résidant au Mali. Il est avec sa conjointe et 7enfants (4 filles et 3 garçons) dont une fille scolarisée, c’est plus de 10 ans qu’il fait l’élevage des bœufs et gagne jusqu’à 75 000FCFA de bénéfice lui permettant de nourrir sa famille, couvrir les soins sanitaires et payer les frais de scolarité de sa fille ; sa conjointe fait le petit commerce pour gagner sa vie et aider les enfants. Dans le souci d’accroitre son activité, il sollicite un prêt pour acheter en plus, beaucoup de bœufs, les élever et les revendre afin de gagner plus de bénéfices lui permettant d’envoyer d’autres enfants à l’école et d’aménager mieux son site d’élevage.
texts.en: Mr. Nouhoum is a literate farmer aged 47 who lives in Mali. He lives with his spouse and seven children (four girls and three boys) including one daughter who goes to school. He has been raising bullocks for over ten years and earns up to 75,000FCFA profit which enables him to feed his family, cover health costs and pay for his daughter's school fees; his spouse works in a small business to earn her living and help the children. Hoping to expand his business, he requests a loan to buy many bullocks, to raise them and resell them in order to earn more profit to enable him to send other children to school and to improve the premises where he raises his livestock.

loans.use: to buy bullocks for resale.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 54 years old and married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like sacks of rice, charcoal, sugar, salt, oil, soft drinks groceries, etc. to sell .

Elvira has borrowed and paid 1 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile load.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: purchase additional items like sacks of rice, charcoal, sugar, salt, oil, soft drinks groceries, etc. to sell .

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fresh and dried fish. Gina is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to purchase of materials like nails, bamboo, etc for her fishing business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase of materials like nails, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine lives with her husband and two kids in the Mkhtchyan village of Ararat region. They have been engaged in agribusiness for already 5 years, and over those hard and tireless working years, Narine and her husband were able to have a sustainable farm. They currently have plans to build a greenhouse where they would be able to cultivate all season fruits and vegetables. The reason of applying for this loan is to finance greenhouse renovation works - purchase supplies, materials, and hire workers.

This is Narine's first loan and it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. This first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have prior access to loans because they had no credit history. Narine and her husband hope for the good will of the lenders to support them to gather the needed financial resources, build the greenhouse and start cultivation work.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the greenhouse, to purchase supplies, materials, and hire workers.
